column2: God creates the heavens and the earth. The earth and heavens are water. Then He creates light. He separates light from darkness, and this becomes the definition of day and night. That was the first day as we know it. On the second day, God separates the earth waters and heaven waters with sky. On the third day, God moves all the water on the earth to one place called seas, and the rest of the earth, now dry, was called land; and He made every type of plant, and the plants that grow on that land that bear seed, and plants that had seeds in fruit; and those seeds would make the same types of plants from which they came. On the fourth day, God made the sun and the moon and the stars to mark seasons, days, and years. On the fifth day, God made every type of bird and every type of creature in the ocean. On the sixth day, God made every type of creature that moves on the land; and God created man in His image; and God created woman; and God told man to fill the earth with his offspring and rule it; and God told man that man governs over everything on earth; and God said seed-bearing plants and fruit bearing trees will be man's food, while everything else (except the creatures in the sea) will eat green plants for food. Everything that God created was labeled as good.

The seventh day was holy, blessed by God when He rested on that day. During the creation of the earth, streams sprung up from the ground to water the earth. God made man from the dust of the earth and breathed the breath of life into his nose. God made a garden, which was full of pretty trees that were good for food, called Eden and He placed man there to live and to tend to the garden. In the middle of the garden were the tree of life and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil. God said to man that he could eat the fruit of any tree in the garden except for the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, for he will die if he does eat of that tree. God parades the birds, the livestock, and the beasts of the field in front of man for him to name. The man, now called <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler>Adam</jLink></jLink></jLink>, is put to sleep by God. During <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler>Adam</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s sleep, God takes part of him (a rib) from which to make a woman. Thereby, husband and wife together shall be considered one flesh.

The serpent convinces the woman to eat of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, and the woman in turn convinces man to eat of the same tree. Suddenly they realize they are naked and make clothing out of fig leaves. The serpent is cursed by God for this action, making it crawl on its belly and be attacked by man. The woman is cursed by God to have increased pain in child birth and to be ruled by her husband. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler>Adam</jLink></jLink></jLink> is cursed by God with having to work the land hard for food, saying he will eat the plants of the field. God will make thorns and thistles grow on the land. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler>Adam</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s wife is called <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2332' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2332' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2332' clickHandler>Eve</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Man has become like God, knowing good and evil. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler>Adam</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2332' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2332' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2332' clickHandler>Eve</jLink></jLink></jLink> are banished from the garden, and the tree of life is guarded by cherubim and a flaming sword.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler>Adam</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2332' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2332' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2332' clickHandler>Eve</jLink></jLink></jLink> begot <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler>Cain</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler>Abel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler>Cain</jLink></jLink></jLink> was a farmer. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler>Abel</jLink></jLink></jLink> was a shepherd. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler>Cain</jLink></jLink></jLink> offered plants to God, while <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler>Abel</jLink></jLink></jLink> offered fat animal parts. God did not like <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler>Cain</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s plants, but God liked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler>Abel</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s offering. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler>Cain</jLink></jLink></jLink> was angry. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler>Cain</jLink></jLink></jLink> was jealous of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler>Abel</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s favor with the Lord. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler>Cain</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s anger and jealously provoked him to kill <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler>Abel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler>Cain</jLink></jLink></jLink> is cursed by God with not being able to farm and to restlessly wander the earth. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler>Cain</jLink></jLink></jLink> is marked by God so that God will curse a killer of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler>Cain</jLink></jLink></jLink> seven times over. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler>Cain</jLink></jLink></jLink> moves away and reproduces. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler>Cain</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s great, great, great grandson <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3929G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3929G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3929G' clickHandler>Lamech</jLink></jLink></jLink> says <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7014B' clickHandler>Cain</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s “killer curse” is eleven times stronger with him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler>Adam</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2332' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2332' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2332' clickHandler>Eve</jLink></jLink></jLink> begot <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8352' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8352' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8352' clickHandler>Seth</jLink></jLink></jLink> to replace <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler>Abel</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

The lineage from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler>Adam</jLink></jLink></jLink> to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, totaling 1056 years.

The “sons of God” married the daughters of men. Humans will live no more than 120 years from now on. The <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5303' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5303' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5303' clickHandler>Nephilim</jLink></jLink></jLink> had offspring with the daughters of man. Men thought only of evil all the time. God was sorry He ever made man and said He would wipe every creature off the earth. But <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> was the one and only man of the time that did not sin. God walked with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> make a big boat, because He will flood the earth and all life under the heavens will perish with the exception of the life on that boat. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> is to bring his three sons, their wives, and two of every kind of creature on the face of the earth, male and female, on the boat. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> is to gather and store every type of food needed by the animals that will be eaten during the flood. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> did what God told him to do.

Now God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to bring seven male/female pairs of every kind of clean animals, two pairs of every kind of unclean animals, and seven pairs of every kind of bird to preserve all of these creatures throughout the earth; for He will flood the earth in seven days and kill every living creature on the face of the earth. The flood began when <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> was 600 years old, in 1656 AC. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> and his wife, his sons and their wives all board the boat, as did all the previously noted pairs of animals under Gods will. It rained for forty days and forty nights; the floodgates of the heavens opened and springs of the great deep burst open. The water on the earth rose high enough to cover the highest mountain by at least twenty feet. Every living thing on the face of the earth was destroyed. The waters flooded the earth for 150 days.

The floodgates of the heavens closed, and springs of the great deep closed. God made wind drive back the water. After a while, the boat settled on a mountain. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> sent out a raven and a dove to look for dry land. No luck. He waited seven days and sent the dove out again. It returned with an olive leaf. About a year after the flood had began, it was over. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to bring everything out of the boat and to go forth and multiply. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> took some clean animals and clean birds and made a burnt offering of them. God says that even though man is evil, He will never again destroy all living creatures. "As long as the earth endures, seed time and harvest, cold and heat, summer and winter, day and night will never cease.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to reproduce and fill the earth. All creatures will now fear man. All creatures, as are all plants, now man's to eat. Man must kill the creature before eating it. Man must not kill another man. Never again will God flood the world. His rainbow will remind him of that promise. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> made a vineyard, and drank of wine from it. He fell asleep naked. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s son <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2526G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2526G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2526G' clickHandler>Ham</jLink></jLink></jLink> saw <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> naked and convinced his other brothers to cover him. They did so not looking at him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> was angry when he found out what had happened. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2526G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2526G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2526G' clickHandler>Ham</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s son <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler>Canaan</jLink></jLink></jLink> was cursed by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> into servitude of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s son <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8035' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8035' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8035' clickHandler>Shem</jLink></jLink></jLink> because of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2526G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2526G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2526G' clickHandler>Ham</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s actions. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> died in 2006 AC.

More lineage information. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5248' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5248' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5248' clickHandler>Nimrod</jLink></jLink></jLink> is a mighty hunter. In the time of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6389' clickHandler>Peleg</jLink></jLink></jLink> the earth was divided.”

Everyone spoke one language. Men founded <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8152' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8152' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8152' clickHandler>Shinar</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and began building a tower to the heavens. God came to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8152' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8152' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8152' clickHandler>Shinar</jLink></jLink></jLink> to observe this. God said that with men united in one language, there is nothing they can't do. Seeing this, God confuses their language and scatters the people to different places on the earth. Lineage and ages reported from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8035' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8035' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8035' clickHandler>Shem</jLink></jLink></jLink> until in 1949 AC, when Abram (soon to be <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink>) was born. Abram's wife Sarai (soon to be <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8283' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8283' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8283' clickHandler>Sarah</jLink></jLink></jLink>) was barren of children.

God tells Abram to move to a different location and at that location, his offspring will prosper, and others will be blessed or cursed according to how they treat his offspring. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> Abram sets out for the land of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler>Canaan</jLink></jLink></jLink> with his wife and his nephew <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3876G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3876G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3876G' clickHandler>Lot</jLink></jLink></jLink> in 2024 AC. He tents at the site of the great tree of Moreh at <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7927G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7927G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7927G' clickHandler>Shechem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and builds an altar, and God tells him that this land will belong to his offspring. He continues on and builds an altar between Bethel and Ai. He continues toward Negev. Abram decides to wait a while in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> because the land was in a famine. Sarai is very attractive, so Abram and Sarai agreed to call each other brother and sister so that the Egyptians would kill Abram to get Sarai. Sarai caught the <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547G' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s eye, so the <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547G' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> brought her to his place and treated Abram well. God inflicted serious diseases on <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547G' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> and his household because Sarai was there. The <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547G' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> became angry at Abram for lying and inciting God's wrath on him, and sent Abram and Sarai on their way.

Abram, his wife, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3876G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3876G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3876G' clickHandler>Lot</jLink></jLink></jLink> headed back for Negev. Abram was very wealthy with livestock and money. Then he went back to the altar between Bethel and Ai and spoke to God. Abram and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3876G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3876G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3876G' clickHandler>Lot</jLink></jLink></jLink> had to part ways because there weren't enough local resources for the both of them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3876G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3876G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3876G' clickHandler>Lot</jLink></jLink></jLink> picked to go east and settled near Sodam. The men of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler>Sodom</jLink></jLink></jLink> were wicked. Abram lived in the land of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler>Canaan</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God tells Abram to look around; all that he sees will be given to his offspring forever and his offspring will be innumerable. Abram settles near the altar at the site of the great tree of Moreh at <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7927G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7927G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7927G' clickHandler>Shechem</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

Frogs were everywhere. Egyptian magicians were able to duplicate this. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> to pray to God to stop the frog plague. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> prays and the frogs die (except those in the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler>Nile</jLink></jLink></jLink>). The land stunk of dead frogs. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s heart hardened and he dismissed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> again. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> to strike the ground with his staff, which would cause the dust <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> to become gnats. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> did this. Egyptian magicians were not able to duplicate this and claimed that this was God's doing. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s heart was hard and he didn't let the Israelites go. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> that if he does not let the Israelites go, God will bring a plague of flies, but the flies will only pester the Egyptians. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and God did this. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> to pray to God so that the fly plague stops, and says he will let the Israelites go. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> prays. The plague stops. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s heart hardened and he would not let the Israelites go.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> that if he does not let the Israelites go, God will kill all the Egyptians' livestock tomorrow. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> doesn't listen, so God kills all the Egyptians' livestock. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s heart was hard and he didn't let the Israelites go. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to toss soot into the air near <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The soot would then become dust that causes boils on all [Egyptian] people and [Egyptian] animals in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tossed the soot and boils broke out. God hardened <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s heart so that he would not listen to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The God-fearing people sheltered things and livestock. Others ignored the warning. The hail storm came everywhere in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> except Goshen. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> to pray to God to stop the hail. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> prays. The hail stops. When the hail stopped, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> sinned again and hardened his heart. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> wouldn't let the Israelites go.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to stretch his hand to the sky so that total darkness would fall upon <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and he did. God describes how the Passover will work and how it is to be celebrated in the years to come, and says that this will be the first month of the Hebrew year. Now: Slaughter a defect-free male lamb (sheep or goat) at twilight. Paint the top and sides of the door jamb with blood form the lamb so God will know to pass by that household. Eat bread without yeast. Cook the lamb over the fire whole. Burn any leftovers before morning. Eat it quickly, fully clothed, with staff in hand. In years to come: Celebrate the Feast of Unleavened Bread. No yeast can be in the house and you can eat nothing with yeast from the evening of the fourteenth day to the evening of the twenty-first day. Cut off anyone who has yeast in this time. Do no work on the fourteenth or the twenty-first. At midnight, God killed the first born of men and cattle of the Egyptians. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> summoned <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> and told them to leave <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> with the Israelites. They did, and plundered <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> by asking for valuables as God had said to do. The Israelites went from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7486G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7486G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7486G' clickHandler>Rameses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to Succoth. The Israelites left <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> 430 years to the day since coming there.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to consecrate every firstborn male, man or livestock. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells the people to observe Passover and consecrate every firstborn male, man or livestock. God leads them toward the Red Sea as a pillar of cloud by day and a pillar of fire by night. They travel from Succoth to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0864' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0864' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0864' clickHandler>Etham</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the Israelites to turn back and encamp by the sea near Pi Hahiroth directly across from Baal Zephon. God will harden <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s heart so that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> will pursue them, so that God can gain glory by showing His power, and so that the Egyptians will know that they are dealing with God. God manipulates <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> so that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> pursues with his army on horseback and horse drawn chariots. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547J' clickHandler>Pharaoh</jLink></jLink></jLink> and his army caught up with the Israelites. The Israelites saw the oncoming Egyptians and complained to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells the Israelites not to worry because God is on their side. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to raise his staff to the sea to part it, and to lead the Israelites across, and that God will make the Egyptians pursue them. Then God moved between the Egyptians and the Israelites, as did the pillar of cloud to keep the Egyptians away. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> raised his staff and so God sent a <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6924A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6924A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6924A' clickHandler>East</jLink></jLink></jLink> strong wind to drive the water back all night long. There was a path of dry land between two walls of water that the Israelites took to go across. The Egyptians pursued the Israelites. God confused the army and broke their chariots. After the Israelites made it across, God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to raise his hand to let the sea come back together. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> does that and all of the Egyptian army dies in the water. The Israelites now feared God, and trusted in God and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

There is a song that praises God and rehashes the story just told. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> leads the Israelites through the Desert of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7793' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7793' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7793' clickHandler>Shur</jLink></jLink></jLink> for three days without water. They find bitter water. The people grumble. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> makes the water sweet with wood shown to him by God. God made a decree and tested them and said if that if they do what God tells them to do, He will not plague them like He did the Egyptians.

In the Desert of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5512B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5512B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5512B' clickHandler>Sin</jLink></jLink></jLink>, on day fifteen of the second month since leaving, the people grumbled about not having food. God rains bread (manna) from heaven each night with the instructions that for six days the Israelites will collect this manna, and on the sixth day they are to collect twice what they need, because there will be no manna the seventh day. This will repeat itself every seven days. As <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> was telling the Israelites this, God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> that He will also bring meat to the Israelites in the evening. That evening quail settled all over the camp. In the morning the ground was cover with thin, white manna that tasted like wafers made with honey. The people collected what they needed, and manna not collected, melted away. Some Israelites angered <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> by saving manna for the next day. The leftover manna was full of maggots and it stunk. On the sixth day, the people collected twice the regular manna. The seventh day the leftovers were OK. But some people still looked for manna on the seventh day. The people observed the Sabbath on the seventh day. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to save an omer of manna for future generations to see. The people ate manna for forty years.

Now camped at camped at <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7508' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7508' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7508' clickHandler>Rephidim</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the Israelites grumbled about not having water. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked God what he should do. God says to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> take elders up ahead with him and to tap a rock with his staff, and that will cause water to come from the rock. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> did this. The Amalekites attacked the Israelites there. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> to lead the Israelite troops. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2354G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2354G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2354G' clickHandler>Hur</jLink></jLink></jLink> went up on a mountain where <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> raised his hand and staff, with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2354G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2354G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2354G' clickHandler>Hur</jLink></jLink></jLink> helping. Because of this, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> was able to defeat the attackers. God says that He will wipe the Amalekites from memory, and so God went to war against the Amalekites for generation after generation.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> sends his wife and two sons to his father-in-law, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3503' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3503' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3503' clickHandler>Jethro</jLink></jLink></jLink>. They come back with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3503' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3503' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3503' clickHandler>Jethro</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3503' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3503' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3503' clickHandler>Jethro</jLink></jLink></jLink> sees <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> judging the daily disputes and suggests teaching the people the laws and decrees and then making a hierarchy of judges, with judges for 10s, 50s, 100s, and 1000s, whereby only the really difficult cases would come to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> does this. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3503' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3503' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3503' clickHandler>Jethro</jLink></jLink></jLink> goes home.

On the third month since leaving <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the Israelites came to the Desert of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5514G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5514G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5514G' clickHandler>Sinai</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Mt. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5514G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5514G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5514G' clickHandler>Sinai</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the people that if they obey His rules, they will be favored by God. The people agreed that they would. God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> that he should consecrate the people, have them wash their clothes, and abstain from sexual relations, being ready in three days. Also, punishable by death, the people and animals are to stay off the mountain until a ram's horn is blown. On the third day, there was a dense cloud of thunder and lightening on the mountain. A trumpet blast assembled the people at the foot of the mountain. God came upon the mountain in smoke and fire. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> spoke and God replied with thunder. God went to the top of the mountain, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> followed after being requested by God. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to warn the people not to come up. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> says the people can't come up because he had done what God had instructed. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to bring <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> up the mountain as well.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Ten Commandments: Have no gods but God. Have no idols; God punishes the to the third and fourth generation of children for the sin of the fathers that hate Him, but will love those who love Him and keep His commandments for 1000 generations. Don't mis-use God's name. Observe Sabbath on the seventh day. Honor your parents. Don't murder. Don't commit adultery. Don't steal. Don't give false testimony against your neighbor. Don't covet your neighbor's belongings. The people tell <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to talk to God for them and relay His message. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> goes up the mountain. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> that they should not make idols, they should make earthen altars, and if they make an altar of stones, they should not carve the stones in any way. Also, they should not make steps to the altar.

God says: A Hebrew male servant is to be free after 6 years, taking with him whatever possessions he had at the time when he was bought. If his master gave the servant a wife, the wife and children belong to the master. The male servant can elect to serve for life. Female servants are not to be freed. Her master can't sell her to a foreigner. If the master's son marries her, the master must treat her like a daughter. If the son takes another wife, he must continue to treat the servant girl as a wife or else she is free to go. A person who intentionally kills another person shall be killed. A person who accidentally kills another person shall be allowed to flee to a location of God's choice. A person who attacks or kills his parent shall be killed. Anyone who kidnaps another and either sells him or still has him when he is caught must be killed. A person who curses either of his parents shall be killed. A person who beats another to injury must pay for any time lost from that injury. If a man beats a slave to death, he is to be punished; but he is not punished if the slave is injured temporarily. If men hit a pregnant woman and she miscarries, the men are to meet the husband's and the court's demands. If there is serious injury during fighting, you should take take life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot, burn for burn, wound for wound, bruise for bruise. If a man punctures an eye or breaks a tooth of a servant, the servant is free to go. If a bull kills a person, the bull is to be stoned to death and the owner is blameless; except if the owner knew of this type behavior in his bull, in which case the owner will be stoned as well unless payment is demanded instead; except if a slave is gored, in which case the bull owner owes the slave owner thirty shekels of silver. Killed animals shall be payed for in one method or another.

God says: A livestock thief must repay fivefold for ox and fourfold for sheep he kills or sells. A thief caught and killed at night shall leave the owner guiltless; but if the thief is killed in the day, the owner is guilty of bloodshed. A thief must payback or be enslaved. If the animal is found alive with the thief, the thief must payback double. If a man grazes his livestock in a field or vineyard and lets them stray and they graze in another man's field, he must make restitution from the best of his own field or vineyard. A fire-starter must make restitution for what is burned. Any case of lost property about which two people claim 'This is mine,' both parties are to bring their cases before the judges and the one whom the judges declare guilty must pay back double to his neighbor. If a man watches an animal for his neighbor and it dies or is injured or is taken away while no one is looking, the issue between them will be settled by the taking of an oath before God that the neighbor did not lay hands on the other person's property. The owner is to accept this, and no restitution is required. But if the animal was stolen while under watch, he must make restitution to the owner. If it was torn to pieces by a wild animal, he shall bring in the remains as evidence and he will not be required to pay for the torn animal. If a man borrows an animal from his neighbor and it is injured or dies while the owner is not present, he must make restitution. If the animal was hired, the money paid for the hire covers the loss. If a man seduces a virgin who is not pledged to be married and sleeps with her, he must pay the bride-price, and she shall be his wife. If her father absolutely refuses to give her to him, he must still pay the bride-price for virgins. Kill sorceresses. Kill those that have sexual relations with an animal. Kill anyone that makes sacrifices to any other god. Don't mistreat an alien or oppress him. God will kill someone who takes advantage of a widow or an orphan. If you lend money to a fellow Israelite, charge no interest {or excessive interest}. If you take your neighbor's cloak as a pledge, return it to him by sunset. Don't blaspheme God or curse the ruler of your people. Do not hold back offerings from your granaries or your vats. Sacrifice the firstborn of your sons, doing the same with your cattle and your sheep, on the eighth day of their lives. Let them stay with their mothers for seven days, but give them to God on the eighth day. Don't eat the meat of an animal torn by wild beasts.

God says: Don't spread false reports. Don't help a wicked man by being a malicious witness. Don't follow the crowd in doing wrong. When you give testimony in a lawsuit, don't show favoritism to a poor man in his lawsuit. If you come across your enemy's ox or donkey wandering off, be sure to take it back to him. If you see the donkey of someone who hates you fallen down under its load, do not leave it there; be sure you help him with it. Don't deny justice to your poor people in their lawsuits. Have nothing to do with a false charge and do not put an innocent or honest person to death. Don't accept a bribe. Don't oppress an alien.  For six years you are to sow your fields and harvest the crops, vineyard, and olives, but during the seventh year let the land lie unplowed and unused. Six days do your work, but on the seventh day do not work. Don't invoke the names of other gods.  Celebrate the Feast of Unleavened Bread. Celebrate the Feast of Harvest. Celebrate the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you gather in your crops from the field. Don't cook a young goat in its mother's milk. God says that He's sending an angel ahead to guard the Israelites in their journey, and the angel will not forgive rebellion. God will wipe out the Canaanites, Hittites, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler>Amorites</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler>Perizzites</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler>Hivites</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler>Jebusites</jLink></jLink></jLink> and demolish their sacred places. If they worship God then they will not be sick or miscarry. God will not drive out the Canaanites, Hittites, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler>Amorites</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler>Perizzites</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler>Hivites</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler>Jebusites</jLink></jLink></jLink> in one year, but slowly so that the land may be maintained. The land of the Canaanites, Hittites, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler>Amorites</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler>Perizzites</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler>Hivites</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler>Jebusites</jLink></jLink></jLink> that will be theirs stretches from the Red Sea to the Mediterranean, and from the desert to the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler>Euphrates</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Then God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to make sacred priestly garments to serve the Him.
