No making of cast idols. Keep the feast of unleavened bread. The firstborn offspring of every womb is to be sacrificed to God. Observe the Sabbath. Observe the feast of weeks. All male children must appear before God three times per year. The blood of a sacrifice shall not be offered together with yeast, nor shall the sacrifice of the Passover feast be left until the next morning. The best of the firstfruits of the land are to be brought before God. Don't boil a baby goat in its mother's milk. This time and every time after, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>' face glowed after talking with God. He covered his face with a veil when talking to others.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> reminds the people of the Sabbath, stating that no one can light a fire in their house on the seventh day as well. Materials are gathered for the tabernacle and the construction work is started on it.

They got enough material, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells the people to stop bringing material. The tabernacle is made.
The Ark is made. The Table is made. The Lamp Stand is made. The Altar of Incense is made.
The Altar of Burnt Offerings is made. The Washing Basin is made. The Courtyard is made. A census was taken for silver collection, with 603,550 men being counted.

The various priestly garments are made. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> inspected the work and blessed them for doing it just as instructed.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to set up and consecrate the tabernacle as previously instructed on the first day of the first month, and to consecrate <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the other priests from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s lineage. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> did this, including putting the stone tablets of the Testimony in the Ark. When God dwelt in the tabernacle as a cloud by day or fire by night, the Israelites did not travel.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> how to make burnt flesh offerings. If the offering is a bull, it must be without defect, and the person making the offering is to lay his hand on the bulls head to signify it for atonement of sins. The blood will be put on the altar. All parts are to be burned. Sheep or goats without defect can be offered. Doves or young pigeons can be offered, though the crop of the bird is to be thrown on the ashes instead of burned. The smell of burnt flesh pleases God.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> how to make burnt grain offerings. No yeast or honey should used. Salt, oil, and incense should be used. Only part of the grain offering is to be burnt, while the rest belongs to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> and his sons.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> how to make fellowship, or peace, offerings. Fellowship offerings are to be made from an animal without defect. The person making the offering is to put his hand on the head of the animal. The animal's fat and kidneys are to be burnt. People are not to eat the body fat or blood.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> how to make sin offerings. If a priest unintentionally sins, a bull without defect is to be slaughtered after that priest places his hand on the bull's head. Its blood is to be sprinkled in front of the Tent of Meeting seven times. The bull's fat and kidneys are to be burnt at the altar, while the rest of the bull is to be burnt outside the camp. If the community sins unintentionally, even if they didn't know it was a sin and later found out about it, the process is the same except all of the elders of the community lay their hands on the bull's head. If a leader unintentionally sins, then the same process is followed except a male goat is used and no seven sprinklings are needed (or at least they are not explicitly required). If a community member unintentionally sins, then the process is the same as for the leader, except a female goat or female sheep is to be used.

God says: Testify if you know something about the case. Don't touch anything unclean. Don't make hasty promises. Transgressing the actions above require a sin offering. If that person can't afford a lamb or goat, then two pigeons or doves are to be used. If that person can't afford two pigeons or doves, then fine flour is to be used. If a person unintentionally sins against holy things, a ram of proper value must be offered, and a fifth of the value is to be given to the priests. If a person unintentionally sins he must offer a ram without defect and of proper value.

God says: If a neighbor cheats another neighbor out of property, he must return it, plus a fifth of the value and also make a ram guilt offering. Then God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> of the priests' requirements for the burnt, grain, and sin offerings. The priests can eat some of the grain and sin offerings. The priests must also make a daily grain offering.

Then God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> of the priests' requirements for the guilt and fellowship offerings. The priests get to keep the hides. People are not to eat the body fat or blood. The priests get a regular share of the offerings.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> ordains <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> and his sons as priests. The priests stay outside the Tent of Meeting for seven days as part of this process and did what God commanded through <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>.
On the eighth day, the priests make offerings for themselves and for the people. At the end, God appeared before all of the people and there was much rejoicing.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5070G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5070G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5070G' clickHandler>Nadab</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0030' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0030' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0030' clickHandler>Abihu</jLink></jLink></jLink>, two of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s sons, burnt incense for God in a way not consistent with the instructions, so God burns them to death. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> says that priests cannot mourn those killed by God, such as by tearing their clothes or uncovering their heads, but the rest of the nation can mourn; otherwise those priests will be killed. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> that the priests cannot have a fermented drink in the Tent of Meeting or they will be killed; and that they must teach the people what is clean and unclean, as well as all of God's commandments. The priests made a sin offering, but burnt it all. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> is angered that they did not eat any of the offering. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> says he could not eat any because of what had just happened.
Clean and unclean animals are defined. Unclean animals are not to be touched or eaten. If a person is made unclean by these actions, the uncleanliness lasts until evening.

God says to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>: A woman is unclean during her period. A woman is unclean after giving birth for seven/fourteen days for a boy/girl. The boy must be circumcised on the eighth day. A woman is to be purified after giving birth at thirty-three/sixty-six days for a boy/girl. The purification is done through sin offering.

God says to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink>: If a person has a skin disease, he is unclean. An unclean person must uncover his head, cover his lower face, and shout “unclean”; and that person must live alone outside of the community. If an article of clothing gets mildew that will not go away, it should be burned, or the contaminated portion should be burned.

God says to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink>: Once a person is free of an infectious skin disease, they must be ceremonially cleaned. This is done with two birds, one killed over fresh water, the other dipped in the dead bird's blood and set free. There's much more, including shaving all the hair off the body and making a guilt offering. For a house which God inflicts with mildew, the house is to be purged of the mildew. If the house cannot be cleaned, then the house is to be torn down.

God says to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink>: People with bodily discharges, including semen and periods, are unclean. A man that has sex with a woman on her period will be unclean for seven days. Anything that unclean person uses, sits on, or lays on will be unclean. Other than semen, persons with discharges must go through a ceremonial cleaning seven days after the discharge passes.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>: The priests are to make atonement for all the sins of the Israelites in front of the Atonement Cover on the Ark once a year on the tenth day of the seventh month. First the high priest will sacrifice a bull for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering, covering the priest's transgressions. Then he'll take two male goats for a sin offering for all of the Israelites. One goat will be sacrificed as a sin offering. The other will have all of the sins of the Israelites put on its head, and then get released in the desert, a.k.a. the scapegoat.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>: The people must make their offerings in front of the Tent of Meeting. People should not eat blood. Life is in blood. Blood is for atonement. Blood eaters must be cut off from the people. Don't eat animals found dead or torn by wild animals.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>: The people should not have sex with: close relatives, your mother, your father's wife, your father's daughter, your father's or mother's sister, your father's brother's wife, your son's wife, your brother's wife, a woman and her daughter or son's daughter or daughter's daughter as well, don't take your wife's sister as a rival wife while the first wife is living, and don't have sex with a woman on her period. Don't sacrifice a child to Molech. Don't have sex with another man. Don't have sex with an animal. Anyone who does these things should be cut off from their people.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>: The people should: Respect your parents. Observe the Sabbath. Don't have idols. Do a fellowship offering correctly. Leave the edges of your fields and the grapes leftover from first harvest for the poor. Don't steal. Don't lie. Don't deceive one another. Don't swear falsely in God's name. Don't defraud or steal from your neighbor. Pay a working man each day. Don't curse at a deaf man. Don't trip a blind man. Don't favor the poor or the great in giving justice. Don't slander. Don't endanger your neighbor's life. Don't hate a person in your heart, rather rebuke him frankly. Don't seek revenge or bear a grudge, but love your neighbor as yourself. Don't mate different kinds of animals. Don't plant a field with two different kinds of seeds. Don't wear clothing woven of two different kinds of materials. If a man has sex with a slave girl promised for another, he must be punished and must make a guilt offering with a ram. When you plant a fruit tree, discard its fruit for three years and sacrifice its fruit to God the fourth year. Don't eat meat with blood in it. Don't practice divination or sorcery. Don't cut your sideburns or beard. Don't mourn with cuts on your body or make tattoos. Don't make your daughter a prostitute. Have reverence for God's sanctuary. Don't go to mediums or spiritists. Show respect to the elderly. Don't mistreat aliens. Don't use dishonest standards of measurements.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>: Kill by stoning those that sacrifice to Molech or they will be cut off from their people. Those who go to mediums or spiritists will be cut off from their people. Kill those that curse their parents. Kill both the man and woman that commit adultery. Kill both the man and woman when a man sleeps with his father's wife. Kill both the man and woman when a man sleeps with his daughter-in-law. Kill homosexuals. If a man marries a mother and her daughter, they are to be burned to death. If a person has sexual relations with an animal, the person and the animal must be killed. If a man marries his sister or sister-in-law, he must be cut off from his people. If a man has sex with a woman on her period, they must be cut off from their people. Don't have sex with the sister of your mother or father. A man that has sex with his aunt will be childless. A man who marries his brother's wife will be childless. Kill mediums and spiritists.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>: Priests can't mourn unless is its for a direct relative. Priests can't shave or cut their bodies. Priests can't marry prostitutes or divorcees. If a priest's daughter becomes a prostitute, she must be burned to death. The high priest must not uncover his head or wear torn clothes. The high priest must not be anywhere there is a dead body. The high priest is not permitted to make himself unclean, even for his parents. The high priest can't leave the sanctuary. The high priest must marry a virgin from his own people. None of the priests' decedents that have imperfections (including damaged testicles) may offer food for God.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>: <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the priests are to respect the offerings. Unclean people are not to go near the offerings to God. The priests must try to remain clean or abstain from the offerings until they are clean, or God will kill them. No one outside the priests' households may eat of the sacred offerings. If someone eats it by mistake, they must pay its value plus one fifth. A priest that lets an unholy person partake in the offering must make a guilt offering. Offerings must be males without defect. Freewill offerings may use a defective ox or sheep. Don't offer an animal whose testicles are bruised, crushed, torn or cut. A newborn animal is ready to be sacrificed on its eighth day of life outside the womb. Don't sacrifice a sheep or cow and its young on the same day. Don't use God's name in vain.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>: Observe the Sabbath. Observe the Passover and Feast of Unleavened Bread. Observe the Feast of the Harvest/Firstfruits. Observe the Feast of Ingathering/Weeks. Observe the Feast of Trumpets. Observe the Day of Atonement, and God will kill anyone that works on this day. Observe the Feast of the Tabernacles, during which native-born Israelites are to live in booths.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> how to keep the lamps in the tabernacle burning and how to set bread before God. The son of an Egyptian father and Israelite mother blasphemed God. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> that everyone who heard the son is to lay their hands on the son's head. Then everyone is to stone the son to death. If a person kills a person, the killer must be killed. A person that kills another's animal must make restitution. Injuries are to by paid in kind, an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth. This law holds for Israelites and aliens. The people stoned the son who blasphemed.

Observe a Sabbath year on the seventh year. There is to be a Year of Jubilee every fiftieth year. Treat this like a Sabbath year. This is to be a family reunion year, back on your original property. Don't take advantage of someone when selling your land. Sold land is to be returned to the previous owner, except for houses in walled cities, in the Year of Jubilee. Levites can always buy their land back, with the exception of houses in walled cities which have only a one year sell-back opportunity. Support poor Levites so they can live among you. Don't treat Israelite slaves ruthlessly. You can buy slaves.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>: If the people obey God's laws, they will have an easy life with abundance and peace. Five Israelites will chase down one hundred enemies, and one hundred Israelites will chase down ten thousand enemies. God will dwell with them. If the people do not obey, they will be stricken with pestilence and famine, and attacked by wild animals and enemies. The Israelite population will be reduced to only a few and will be spread through the nations of their enemies. They will be so fearful of their enemies that they will run at the sound of a leaf in the wind. The people and the land will be decimated. If the people then repent, God will then keep His promise and they will be able to go back to the Promised Land.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> how people can buy back offerings to God, be they man or animal.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to take a census of the Israelite men who were 20 years old or more, except for the Levite tribe, on the first day of the second month of the second year out of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. From the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7205' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7205' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7205' clickHandler>Reuben</jLink></jLink></jLink> were 46,500. From the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8095G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8095G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8095G' clickHandler>Simeon</jLink></jLink></jLink> were 59,300. From the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1410G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1410G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1410G' clickHandler>Gad</jLink></jLink></jLink> were 45,650. From the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> were 74,600. From the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3485G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3485G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3485G' clickHandler>Issachar</jLink></jLink></jLink> were 54,400. From the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler>Zebulun</jLink></jLink></jLink> were 57,400. From the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> were 40,500. From the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler>Manasseh</jLink></jLink></jLink> were 32,200. From the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler>Benjamin</jLink></jLink></jLink> were 35,400. From the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1835H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1835H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1835H' clickHandler>Dan</jLink></jLink></jLink> were 62,700. From the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler>Asher</jLink></jLink></jLink> were 41,500. From the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler>Naphtali</jLink></jLink></jLink> were 53,400. This totaled 603,550. The Levites are responsible for the Tabernacle, moving it when necessary, and protecting the other Israelites from it.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> how to set up camp.

God says that the Levites are to be given to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the priests to work for the Tabernacle. God says He is taking the Levites in place of the firstborn sons of the Israelite women. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to count the Levite males one month old or older. The Levites numbered 22,000. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to count all the firstborn males one month old or older among the Israelites. They numbered 22,273. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to collect redemption money from the families of the 273 firstborn families which exceed the Levite count, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> does this.

God says take a census of the Kohathite branch of Levites, males 30 to 50 years old, because they are to care for the most holy parts of the Tabernacle. When moving the most holy things, the priests have to cover everything up, then the Kohathites have to carry the most holy things. The Kohathites can't look at or touch any of the most holy things or they will die. God says take a census of the Gershonites branch of Levites, males 30 to 50 years old, because they are to carry the curtains of the Tabernacle. God says take a census of the Merarites branch of Levites, males 30 to 50 years old, because they are to carry the frames of the Tabernacle. There were 2,750 Kohathites, 2,630 Gershonites, and 3,200 Merarites.

God says unclean people must leave the Israelite camp. Wrongdoers must confess and make restitution. If a husband suspects a wife of infidelity, she is to go before the priest and drink curse water, a water that will cause pain, make her miscarry, and make her be barren if she has committed adultery.

God defines the duties of a person who vows separation for God, known as a Nazirite. Nazirites cannot partake of vine products, must let their hair grow, and cannot be near a dead body. The Nazirite become guilty if someone dies suddenly in their presence. After this vow, the Nazirite must make many offerings and shave off his hair that was dedicated to God to be burned with these offerings. God prescribes the Priests' blessing for the Israelites.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> consecrated the Tabernacle. Each of the twelve tribes brought forth an offering. The totals of the offering are in the text. God speaks to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> between the cherubim on the atonement cover.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> how to set up the lamp stand. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> how to consecrate the Levites, including having them shave off all of their hair. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> that Levite men from 25 to 49 years old must work for the Tabernacle.

God says to celebrate Passover. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> unclean people ask if they can celebrate Passover as well. God says that unclean and traveling people have the option to celebrate Passover, but someone who is clean and not traveling who does not celebrate must be cut off from his people. Aliens can celebrate Passover as well. God's cloud/pillar of fire ruled where, when, and for how long the Israelites would camp in certain locations.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to make trumpets to command the people and to use at various other times, including when battling an oppressor so that God will remember the Israelites. On the 20th day of the second month of the second year, the Israelites left Mount <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5514G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5514G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5514G' clickHandler>Sinai</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> convinced his father-in-law to come with them.

God hears the Israelites complaining of hardships and so He burns some of them to death. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> prays for God to stop the fires and so God does stop them. The Israelites complain that they want meat. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> complains that his burden is too heavy. God puts the spirit of Himself on seventy of the elders to lighten <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>' burden. God says that He will give the people meat until it comes out of their noses. God blows quail into the camp, three feet deep, and causes a big plague on the Israelites.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4813G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4813G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4813G' clickHandler>Miriam</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s sister, talked bad about <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> because he married a Cushite woman. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> was the most humble man in the world. God disciplines <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4813G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4813G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4813G' clickHandler>Miriam</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and makes <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4813G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4813G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4813G' clickHandler>Miriam</jLink></jLink></jLink> leprous. God says that He speaks face-to-face with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but speaks through visions, dreams, and riddles to others.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to send people to explore and report on the land of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler>Canaan</jLink></jLink></jLink>. A leader from each of the twelve tribes went. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> gave Hoshea son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5126' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5126' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5126' clickHandler>Nun</jLink></jLink></jLink> the name <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink>. After 40 days they returned with a report that the land was full of milk and honey. They also reported the land was full of strong people, and there were <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5303' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5303' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5303' clickHandler>Nephilim</jLink></jLink></jLink> there. By their account, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6061' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6061' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6061' clickHandler>Anak</jLink></jLink></jLink> are descendants of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5303' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5303' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5303' clickHandler>Nephilim</jLink></jLink></jLink> and are gigantic.

The Israelites complain about having to face these strong people and thereby die by the sword. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler>Caleb</jLink></jLink></jLink> son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3312G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3312G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3312G' clickHandler>Jephunneh</jLink></jLink></jLink> said do not complain; God is on our side so the conquest will be easy. God says that He is angry and He will kill the Israelites with a plague and let <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> make a new nation. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> says that the Egyptians will find out about such a plague. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> has to remind God that He is “slow to anger, abounding in love and forgiving sin and rebellion.” God says that He forgives them, but all of them will die in the desert as they had asked for in their complaint over the course of 40 years; and the leaders who spread the information to the people, except <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler>Caleb</jLink></jLink></jLink>, were killed by a plague from God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells the people this. The next morning the people went into the land of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler>Canaan</jLink></jLink></jLink> even though God had said they cannot go there, and they were killed.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> that offerings will now require an extra offering of grain and wine. Aliens living among the Israelites are to do the same thing. The first ground meal belongs to God. If the community sins unintentionally, a young bull burnt, a male goat sin, a grain, and a drink offering must be made. If a person sins unintentionally, a female goat sin offering must be made. Stone Sabbath-breakers. Don't follow your heart. Wear blue tassels to remind you of your covenant with God.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7141I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7141I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7141I' clickHandler>Korah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1885' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1885' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1885' clickHandler>Dathan</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0048G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0048G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0048G' clickHandler>Abiram</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and 250 Israelite community leaders (possibly they were all Levites) said that the whole Israelite community is holy and asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> why he thought he was better then anyone else. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them to come out tomorrow with burning incense and God will show them who is holy to Him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> asks the Levites is not it enough to be special for God? <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1885' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1885' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1885' clickHandler>Dathan</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0048G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0048G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0048G' clickHandler>Abiram</jLink></jLink></jLink> said they would not come, asking is not it enough that they will die in the desert? <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> asks God not to take the offerings from any of the ones who were questioning <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7141I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7141I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7141I' clickHandler>Korah</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the 250 Israelites show up. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> to separate themselves from the assembly so that He can kill the assembly. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> ask God if He will be angry with the assembly when only one man sins? God opens up the earth under <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7141I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7141I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7141I' clickHandler>Korah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1885' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1885' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1885' clickHandler>Dathan</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0048G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0048G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0048G' clickHandler>Abiram</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s tents such that all of their entire households, including wives and children, are buried alive. Then God burned to death the other 250 members of the assembly. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to take the bronze censers that the 251 had burned incense in and hammer them out, overlaying the altar with them. The whole Israelite community grumble to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> about these killings. God sends a plague to these people. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> to light incense and make atonement for these people. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> stops the plague after 14,700 have died.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to take a staff from each of the twelve tribes, inscribed with the leaders name, and place them in the Tent of Meeting for a sign of who is chosen. The next day, the Levites'/<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s staff had budded flowers and bore almonds. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to display the staff as a reminder so that the people will not talk against God and die. The people grumble that they are all lost, and if they come near the Tabernacle they'll die.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> that the priests are responsible for sins against the priesthood; that the Levites are to help, but cannot go near the furnishings of the Tabernacle or both the Levites and the priests will die. God says that anyone else who comes near the sanctuary must be killed. God says to give the priests the offerings of the people. Firstborn Israelites and unclean animals are to be redeemed at birth. Firstborn clean animals are to be sacrificed. The Levites get the tithes of the people. The Levites are to tithe the tithes to the priests, and they must be the best parts of the tithes, so that they will not die.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> to have a red cow, free of defect and never under a yoke, slaughtered and burnt with cedar wood, hyssop, and scarlet wool . The ashes will be used in the water of cleansing for purification of sin and the man that gathers them will be unclean until evening. Whoever touches a dead body will be unclean for 7 days, provided he is purified on the third and seventh day. Otherwise, he must be cut off from his people. The same goes for touching a human bone or a grave. Anyone who touches the water of cleansing will be unclean until nightfall. Anything an unclean person touches will be unclean.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> leads the Israelites to the Desert of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6790' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6790' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6790' clickHandler>Zin</jLink></jLink></jLink>. They complain about not having water. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> go to the Tent of Meeting and humbly fall face down. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to gather the Israelites and talk to a rock and water will come from that rock. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> gather the people and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> taps the rock twice with his staff and water comes from it. The clans of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler>Zebulun</jLink></jLink></jLink> numbered 60,500. The clans of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler>Manasseh</jLink></jLink></jLink> numbered 52,700. The clans of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> numbered 32,500. The clans of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler>Benjamin</jLink></jLink></jLink> numbered 45,600. The Shuhamite clans numbered 64,400. The clans of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler>Asher</jLink></jLink></jLink> numbered 53,400. The clans of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler>Naphtali</jLink></jLink></jLink> numbered 45,400. The total number of the men of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> was 601,730. The number of male Levites one year or older were 23,000. Other than <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler>Caleb</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink>, none of the Israelites from the original census were still alive at that time.

The daughters of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6765' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6765' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6765' clickHandler>Zelophehad</jLink></jLink></jLink> complain that there are no males to carry the family inheritance. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> asks God about this. God sets up rules for inheritance. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be the leader of the Israelite community in place of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> when <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> dies, and instructs <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to begin giving <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> power.

Daily offerings are to be: 2 lambs, a grain and a drink offering. Sabbath offerings in addition to the daily offerings are to be: 2 lambs, a grain and a drink offering. Monthly offerings are to be: 2 young bulls, 1 ram, 7 male lambs, 10 grain and 10 drink offerings, and a male goat sin offering, in addition to the daily offering. Passover offerings in addition to the daily offerings are to be the same as the monthly offerings. Feast of Weeks/Firstfruits/Harvest offerings in addition to the daily offerings are to be the same as the monthly offerings.

Feast of Trumpet offerings are to be: 1 young bull, 1 ram, 7 male lambs, 9 grain and 9 drink offerings, and a male goat sin offering, in addition to the daily offering. Day of Atonement offerings are to be: 1 young bull, 1 ram, 7 male lambs, 9 grain and 9 drink offerings, and a male goat sin offering, in addition to the daily offering. Feast of Tabernacles offerings are to be: 71 young bulls, 15 rams, 105 male lambs, 191 grain and 191 drink offerings, and 8 male goat sin offerings, in addition to the daily offerings, spread across 8 days.

When a man makes a vow, he is obligated to fulfill every word. When a woman makes a vow, the vow can be nullified by her father or her husband if done in a timely fashion, otherwise she must fulfill every word.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> to fight the Midianites. With 1000 from each tribe, 12,000 Israelites fight and destroy all of the Midianite men, and kill <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1109A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1109A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1109A' clickHandler>Balaam</jLink></jLink></jLink> in the process. They bring back the women, children, and loot. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> becomes angry because they brought back women, so he orders the Israelites to kill all of the boys and non-virgin women. They can keep the virgins for themselves. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> how to split the plunder, and what of the plunder should be sacrificed to God, of which the living were 675,000 sheep, 72,000 cattle, 61,000 donkeys and 32,000 virgin women. The officers offer the gold they had plundered because not a single Israelite died. Each soldier takes a share of plunder.

The Reubenites and Gadites ask for land on the east side of the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink> River. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> agrees to this if they will still take up arms and help drive out the enemies from the Promised Land. The Makirites also take some land there.

This discusses the stages of travel among the Israelites. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> was 123 when God killed him. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> that when they cross the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink>, they must drive out all the inhabitants or God will do to the Israelites what He is planning on doing to the Canaanites. They must destroy all of their worship items and places.

God gives the boundaries of the borders of the Canaanite Promised Land and tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> who shall help assign the land.

The Levites are to get 48 towns, 6 of which are for refuge for accidental murderers or murderers awaiting trial. If a man kills another with anything that could be called a weapon, or kills a man with hostile intent, he is a murderer and should be killed by the closest relative of the victim. If the murderer goes outside the city of refuge before the High Priest dies, the closest relative of the victim can kill the murderer without retribution. Do not take ransom from a murderer. Shedding [human] blood on the land defiles the land, and it can only be cleaned by the blood of the one that shed the blood originally.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> that no one is to marry Israelites other than from their own tribe. That way, the land which belongs to each tribe will stay with each tribe.

On the first day of the fortieth year, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> repeats what God had told him and what has happened to all the Israelites. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells how they left Horeb; they established judges; they spied out the Promised Land; they rebelled against going to the Promised Land because of its occupants; God killed all of that generation except for the children who did not know bad from good.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells of how God directed them from place to place. God did not make the Israelites lack anything while in the desert. God delivered <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5511' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5511' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5511' clickHandler>Sihon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, King of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2809' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2809' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2809' clickHandler>Heshbon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and his people to the Israelites, and the Israelites killed every last one including their women and children, and the Israelites plundered the cities destroyed them.

God delivered <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5747' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5747' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5747' clickHandler>Og</jLink></jLink></jLink>, King of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1316' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1316' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1316' clickHandler>Bashan</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and his people to the Israelites, and the Israelites killed every last one of them, including their women and children. The Israelites plundered and destroyed their cities too, many of which were highly fortified. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5747' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5747' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5747' clickHandler>Og</jLink></jLink></jLink> was a giant. The newly captured land east of the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink> was divided among the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler>Manasseh</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> that he will lead the Israelites into the Promised Land.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells the Israelites to obey the laws he is giving them, and do not add or subtract from them. Other nations will be impressed by these laws. Teach the laws from generation to generation. Do not make an idol, because God is jealous. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> will die on the east of the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink>. If the people become wicked, God will drive them out of the Promised Land. But if they look for God then, He will be merciful to them. God is the only God and He brought the Israelites to the Promised Land. The following are the laws that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> told the people.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> repeats the Ten Commandments: Have no God but God. Do not worship idols because God is jealous, punishing the family of those who hate Him down to their great grandchildren, showing love to those that love Him. Do not blaspheme. Observe the Sabbath. Honor your parents. Do not murder. Do not commit adultery. Do not steal. Do not give false testimony on your neighbor. Do not covet what your neighbor has. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> reminds the people to follow the commands of God.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> says: Obey God's commands. Love God. Tell your children about God's commands when you sit at home, walk along the road, lie down, and when you get up. Tie them as symbols on your hands and bind them on your foreheads. Write them on the door frames of your houses and on your gates. Do not worship other gods. Do not test God.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> says: When you go into the Promised Land, you must destroy the inhabitants completely, showing no mercy. If you do not, they may convince you to start worshiping other gods, and God will destroy you quickly for that. Destroy all they hold sacred. You are the fewest people and God loves you. God loves those that love him and keep His commandments, but will quickly destroy those that hate Him. If you love God and keep His commandments, you will be blessed over all nations, including by not having closed wombs in people or livestock. Do not be afraid of the occupants of the Promised Land, even though they are greater in number. You saw how God plagued <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and pulled us out of slavery. God will send hornets to kill those that hide from the Israelites. God will deliver the kings of the Promised Land to you. Do not bring anything detestable into your house.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> says: Do not forget God. God brought you through the desert to test your hearts. God made you hungry and gave you manna to teach you man doesn't live by bread alone, but by the word of God. Your sandals and clothes didn't wear out in the 40 years in the desert. If you become proud and claim accomplishments as your own, God will kill you.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> says: God is not giving the Israelites this land because they are righteous, rather because the inhabitants of this land are wicked, so He will drive the inhabitants out to keep His promise. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells how the Israelites angered God and how <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> had to pray and convince God not to destroy them.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells how God wrote out the Ten Commandments on a second set of stone tablets. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink> died in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H4149A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H4149A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H4149A' clickHandler>Moserah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> told how he was told to lead the Israelites. Fear God, for He is the biggest and owns everything. God shows no partiality, takes no bribes, defends the fatherless and the widow, and loves the alien. You are to love the alien too.

This basically repeats Deuteronomy 6, including how you are to remind yourselves of God's word. Added is that when the Israelites enter the Promised Land, they are to proclaim on Mount Gerizim the blessings, and on Mount <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5858B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5858B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5858B' clickHandler>Ebal</jLink></jLink></jLink> the curses.

Destroy sacred things of other faiths. Worship and make offerings only in the chosen worship place. You can kill and eat other animals in your town, provided you do not eat their blood. Do not neglect the Levites. Do not inquire about other gods because they are worshiped in ways God detests, such as by burning to death their sons and daughters as sacrifices. Do not add to or take away from the Law.

Kill those that tell you to worship other gods. If a relative tells you to worship other gods, you must be the first to lay a hand on them towards killing them, and they must be stoned to death. If an entire town worships other gods, kill all the people and livestock, and burn all the plunder in the center of town, and never rebuild that city.

Clean and unclean animals are defined again, again calling a bat an unclean bird. Do not eat animals that are found dead, but you can give them to aliens or sell them to foreigners. Do not cook a young goat in its mother's milk. Make a tithe.

Every 7 years, debts must be canceled. There should be no poor among you, yet there will always be poor in the land. Give to the poor generously. At the seventh year, Hebrew slaves must be set free, and should be well supplied with livestock, grain, and wine. If the slave doesn't want to leave, puncture his or her earlobe with an awl against your door and he or she will then be a servant to you for life. The firstborn from the flocks and herds are to be sacrificed to God at the holy place of His choosing, unless the animal has defects. Do not eat blood.

Observe Passover. The bread without yeast is a remembrance that the bread made during the Exodus was unleavened. During Passover, you are to eat unleavened bread for seven days; and also six days. Observe the Feast of Weeks. Observe the Feast of Tabernacles. Men are to appear before God three times a year at these three events. Set up judges. Do not show partiality. Do not accept bribes. Do not set up any wooden Asherah pole beside an altar to God, and do not erect a sacred stone.

Do not sacrifice a flawed animal to God. If a person worships anything or anyone else but God, stone that person to death at the city gates. The witnesses should be the first stone throwers. For a capital sin, a person should only be put to death if there is more than one witness to their sin. Difficult lawsuits are to be judged by the priests. Do everything they give as their judgement or be put to death. Your kings are to be chosen by God. The king should not have many wives. The king should not amass great personal wealth. The king should read the Law of God every day. The king is not to consider himself better than anyone else.

The Levites are not to own anything. They are to live off offerings. Do not harbor anyone who sacrifices his son or daughter in the fire, who practices divination or sorcery, interprets omens, engages in witchcraft, or casts spells, or who is a medium or spiritist or who consults the dead. God will provide a prophet like <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and from the Israelites. If the people do not listen to the prophet, God himself will reckon with that person. A false prophet, or a prophet of other gods must be put to death. You will know a false prophet by if what a prophet proclaims in the name of the God does not take place or come true.

Set aside three cities of refuge for people who kill people accidentally, otherwise an avenger of death may kill the murderer, thereby shedding innocent blood, thereby making the people guilty before God. If the people do what God tells them and God gives them all of the Promised Land, set up three more cities for refuge. A man who kills with malicious intent must be brought out a refuge city and killed. Do not move the boundary stones of inheritance. Two or more witnesses is enough to convict a man. For single witnesses, the case must be thoroughly investigated. If the witness is found to be a liar, he is to bear the punishment of the accused crime. Show no pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.

When going into battle against a city, do not be afraid because God is with you. Anyone who has a new home, has a new vineyard, is engaged to be married, or is fearful of battle is excused from battle. First offer peace to a city in exchange for becoming slave labor. If the offer is not accepted, lay siege to the city. When the siege is over, kill all the men, leave the women, children, and livestock for your own use. You may cut down non-fruit-bearing trees for making siege implements. However, for the cities in the Promised Land, anything that breaths is to be completely destroyed.

If there is an unsolved murder, the nearest town must sacrifice a cow that has not been worked, breaking its neck in a stream, to atone for the death. You may take a war-captured woman as your wife after she has mourned her parents for a month. If you are displeased with her, let her go free. If a man has two wives, one that he does not love, and one that he does love, the larger part of his inheritance must go to the firstborn son, regardless of which wife provided that son. A rebellious son should be proclaimed a profligate and a drunkard, and then stoned to death by all the men of the town. A person that is hung on a tree for a capital crime should be buried the same day.

Return lost livestock, or hold it for safekeeping until the owner looks for it. Help livestock that has stumbled. Do not be a cross-dresser. You may take young birds or eggs in a nest, but do not take the mother. Build fall protection for your roof. Do not plant two kinds of seed in a vineyard. Do not plow with an ox and a donkey yoked together. Do not wear clothes of wool and linen woven together. Make tassels on the four corners of the cloak you wear. If a man marries a woman, dislikes here, slanders her by saying she was not a virgin, and her parents produce proof of her virginity with a [bloody] cloth, then the man should be fined 100 shekels of silver and will have to stay married to her. If no proof can be found, the woman is to be stoned to death. If a man commits adultery with another man's wife, both the man and the wife should be killed. If, in a city, a man rapes a virgin promised for marriage to another man, both the man and the ex-virgin are to be stoned to death, the ex-virgin because she did not scream loud enough. If, in the country, a man rapes a virgin promised for marriage to another man, just the man is to be killed. If a man rapes a virgin that is not promised for marriage to another man, the man must pay the ex-virgin's father 50 shekels of silver and marry her and never divorce her. A man is not to marry his father's wife.

No one with damaged or removed testicles or penis can enter the congregation. No bastard child, nor any of his lineage down to the 10th generation, may enter the congregation. No Ammonite or Moabite may enter the congregation. The Edomites and Egyptians may join the congregation after the third generation. When in a war camp, a man who has a nocturnal emission of semen is unclean until nightfall of the new day and must wait outside camp until then. When in a war camp, bury your waste products outside of camp. Protect a slave who takes refuge with you and let him go freely. Israelites should not become male or female prostitutes, for they are detestable to God. Do not take a prostitute's money for God. Only charge interest to foreigners for borrowed things. Repay any verbal vow quickly. You may have “all-you-can-eat” of your neighbor's vineyard or grain provided you do not take a to-go box.

If a man divorces a woman because he is displeased with her, giving her a certificate of divorce, he is not to remarry her if she remarries. A newlywed man is to stay at home pleasing his wife for one year. Do not take a man's livelihood as security for a debt.
