If an Israelite kidnaps an Israelite and sells him or treats him as a slave, the kidnapper must die. Treat skin diseases per the priest's recommendations. When you offer a loan to your neighbor, wait for him to bring you a pledge. If the neighbor is poor, return the pledge by sundown. Do not take advantage of the hired poor or needy. Pay a man each day. Fathers will not die for their children's sin, nor will the children die for their father's sin. Do not deprive the alien or orphan of justice. Do not take the cloak from a widow as a pledge. Only make one pass in your harvesting, leaving the missed harvest for the poor, the aliens, and the widows.

The judges will decide guilt and punishment. If there is punishment, the flogging will take place in front of the judge and shall not be more than 40 lashes. Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain. If a married man dies before having a son, one of his brothers must marry that man's wife and name the firstborn son after the dead man. However, if the brother refuses to do this, the widow, in front of the village elders, will take off one of the brother's sandals, spit in his face, and say that is what he deserves. If two men are fighting and a wife of one of them seizes her husband's assailant's testicles to try and rescue her husband, the wife's hand must be cut off. Use accurate weights and measures. The Israelites will completely destroy the Amalekites for what they did to them on their journey through the desert.
Instructions for the offering of the firstfruits. Obey all of God's commands.

On Mount <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5858B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5858B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5858B' clickHandler>Ebal</jLink></jLink></jLink>, take large stones, cover them with plaster, and write all the laws there. Build an altar there of unformed stones and make offerings. After crossing the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink>, on Mount Gerizim the tribes of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8095G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8095G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8095G' clickHandler>Simeon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3878' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3878' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3878' clickHandler>Levi</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3485G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3485G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3485G' clickHandler>Issachar</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3130G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3130G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3130G' clickHandler>Joseph</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler>Benjamin</jLink></jLink></jLink> will bless the people; and on Mount <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5858B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5858B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5858B' clickHandler>Ebal</jLink></jLink></jLink> the tribes of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7205' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7205' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7205' clickHandler>Reuben</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1410G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1410G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1410G' clickHandler>Gad</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler>Asher</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler>Zebulun</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1835H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1835H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1835H' clickHandler>Dan</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler>Naphtali</jLink></jLink></jLink> will pronounce curses. The Levites will say: Cursed is the man who carves an image or casts an idol-a thing detestable to the LORD, the work of the craftsman's hands-and sets it up in secret. Cursed is the man who dishonors his father or his mother. Cursed is the man who moves his neighbor's boundary stone. Cursed is the man who leads the blind astray on the road. Cursed is the man who withholds justice from the alien, the fatherless or the widow. Cursed is the man who sleeps with his father's wife, for he dishonors his father's bed. Cursed is the man who has sexual relations with any animal. Cursed is the man who sleeps with his sister, the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother. Cursed is the man who sleeps with his mother-in-law. Cursed is the man who kills his neighbor secretly. Cursed is the man who accepts a bribe to kill an innocent person. Cursed is the man who does not uphold the words of this law by carrying them out.

If you obey all of the laws, God will bless you. It lists the blessings for obeying. It lists the curses for not obeying; curses that will completely destroy the Israelites. One of the curses is a raining of dust. One of the curses is cannibalism of their own children. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> says all of these curses will come to pass if they do not obey God's laws.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells them that the Israelites are now making a covenant with God, and all of the curses will come to pass if they break the covenant. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> recounts the many things they have seen from God. If the covenant is broken, the whole Promised Land will become a burning waste of salt and sulfur-nothing planted, nothing sprouting, no vegetation growing on it.

If, after the blessings and the curses come upon the Israelites and they are few and scattered, the Israelites again believe and follow God in all his laws, God will gather them back to the Promised Land where they will prosper. Their enemies will then get the curses that plagued the Israelites. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> pleads that the Israelites chose the path of blessings.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> named <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> as his successor, since <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> was 120 years old and near death, and could not go into the Promised Land per God's decree. Every 7 years the laws of God must be read during the Feast of Tabernacles for all to hear. God meets with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> in the Tent of Meeting as a pillar of cloud. God says the people, soon after entering the Promised Land, will rebel and worship other gods, and so God will apply curses to them. God said to take the laws that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> is writing down and place them beside the Ark of the Covenant as a witness against the people. God said to have the people memorize a song as a witness against them when they become evil.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells the people the words to God's song. In it, Gods works are perfect, all of His ways are just, and He does no wrong. God laments that He would like to kill all of the Israelites, but the nation which invades <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> would not understand why He had all of the Israelites killed. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> should go up on Mount Nebo in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler>Moab</jLink></jLink></jLink> to die.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> provides blessings for the twelve tribes of the Israelites.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> goes up on Mount Nebo in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler>Moab</jLink></jLink></jLink> to die at 120 years old. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> was still perfectly healthy. God buried him. Since then, no prophet like <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> has risen in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> talked with God face to face.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> to lead the people across the river <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink>, saying He will never leave or forsake <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and no one will stand up against him and everywhere he walks will belong to him. God reminds <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> to follow the laws completely, for only then will he prosper. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells the leaders of the tribes they will cross the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink> in 3 days. The leaders say they will obey <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> as they did <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and will put to death those that do not obey.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> sent 2 of spies ahead to survey the land and especially the city of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler>Jericho</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The 2 spies go to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler>Jericho</jLink></jLink></jLink> and stay the night in an inn, or possibly a prostitute's house, run by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler>Rahab</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler>Jericho</jLink></jLink></jLink> recognizes that the spies are there, and they are from the Israelites, so the king sends for the spies. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler>Rahab</jLink></jLink></jLink> hid the 2 spies and lied to the guards, saying the spies left before the city gate was closed. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler>Rahab</jLink></jLink></jLink> explains that God has put the fear of the Israelites in her people and makes a deal to protect her and her family since she protected the spies. The spies say to keep this secret, and tie a scarlet cord in her window, and thereby all in her house will be saved. Then the spies sneak back and report the people are melting in fear to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> prepares the Israelites to cross the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink>, commanding the priests to carry the Ark of the Covenant in front of the Israelites, and the people are to follow behind about 1000 yards. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> that He will prove that God is with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> with miracles. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> says to the people when the Ark of the Covenant enters the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink>, its water will stop and rise up in a heap as a sign that God is with the Israelites and will drive out the Canaanites, Hittites, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler>Hivites</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler>Perizzites</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1622' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1622' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1622' clickHandler>Girgashites</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler>Amorites</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler>Jebusites</jLink></jLink></jLink> without fail. As soon as the priests' feet touch the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink> (which was flooded at the time) its upstream water began heaping near a town called <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0121G' clickHandler>Adam</jLink></jLink></jLink> in the vicinity of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6891' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6891' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6891' clickHandler>Zarethan</jLink></jLink></jLink>, while the rest of the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink> drained dry. The Israelites crossed the dry <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell a representative from each tribe to each take a stone from the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink> river bed and place it where they sleep tonight. The 12 did this to serve as a reminder. 40,000 armed men from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7205' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7205' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7205' clickHandler>Reuben</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1410G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1410G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1410G' clickHandler>Gad</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and the half-tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler>Manasseh</jLink></jLink></jLink> crossed the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink> in front of the other Israelites. As soon as the priests with the Ark left the riverbed, the waters returned. The Israelites treated <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> as they did <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> since God exalted him. The stones were placed at Gilgal, on the eastern border of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler>Jericho</jLink></jLink></jLink>, where the Israelites camped that night. The stones are a reminder to fear God forever.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> to circumcise all the Israelites, because apparently circumcisions had not been performed while in the desert. The party encamped there until everyone was healed from the circumcisions, and took Passover there. They also ate produce from the land of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler>Canaan</jLink></jLink></jLink>. At that time, the manna stopped. The commander of God's army appeared to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> and told him to take off his sandals because he was on holy ground.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> how to wage psychological warfare on the city of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler>Jericho</jLink></jLink></jLink>, which was now closed up due to the Israelites' proximity. For 6 days, all the armed men matched once around the city, followed by the priests carrying the Ark, while 7 priests blew 7 trumpets. On the seventh day, the same group marched 7 times around the city. For the 7th march, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> gave the instructions for the men to shout, for the wall will collapse, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler>Rahab</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s household should be spared, and all gold, silver, bronze, and iron spoils belong to God, and they should stay away from “devoted things”, things that should be destroyed for God. The men shouted. The wall collapsed. The men killed every living thing in the city, including the livestock, with the exception of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7343' clickHandler>Rahab</jLink></jLink></jLink> and her family for saving the spies. The metal spoils were put in God's treasury. Then the city was burned. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> cursed anyone who would rebuild <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler>Jericho</jLink></jLink></jLink>, saying it will cost that man his first born and his youngest son. God was pleased.

When the Israelites had attacked <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler>Jericho</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler>Achan</jLink></jLink></jLink> son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3756H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3756H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3756H' clickHandler>Carmi</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the son of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2174B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2174B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2174B' clickHandler>Zimri</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2226I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2226I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2226I' clickHandler>Zerah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, of the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, took some plunder. God was angry with all of the Israelites for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler>Achan</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s theft. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> when the Israelites sent 3000 men to conquer Ai, the Israelites were defeated, 36 were killed, and the Israelites subsequently lost heart in taking the Promised Land. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> that He will point out the guilty party, and everything that belongs to that person, as well as the plunder, must be destroyed. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler>Achan</jLink></jLink></jLink> is identified and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler>Achan</jLink></jLink></jLink> admits his wrongdoing. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5912' clickHandler>Achan</jLink></jLink></jLink> son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2226I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2226I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2226I' clickHandler>Zerah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, his sons and daughters, and his livestock were stoned to death. Then they were burned. A large pile of rocks were placed over him that are there in the Valley of Achor to this day.

God said to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> attack Ai with the whole army using an ambush. God says they can keep the plunder and livestock this time. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> sets 5,000 men up for the ambush, and 25,000 men to “attack” the city. The army of Ai chased the 25,000. The 5,000 plundered the city and burned it. Then the combined 30,000 attacked the army of Ai. All 12,000 people from Ai were killed, and the king was hanged and then buried under a pile of rocks at the destroyed city's gates that's still there to this day. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> makes an altar, makes some sacrifices, copies God's laws on stone tablets, and read them to the entire Israelite community at Mount <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5858B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5858B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5858B' clickHandler>Ebal</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

The kings of the Hittites, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler>Amorites</jLink></jLink></jLink>, Canaanites, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler>Perizzites</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler>Hivites</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler>Jebusites</jLink></jLink></jLink> began to unite for war against the Israelites. But the Gibeonites were smarter, and tricked the Israelites into a peace treaty. The Israelites let them live, but cursed them only to serve as water carriers and woodcutters for the Israelites, which they do to this day in the cities of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler>Gibeon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3716' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3716' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3716' clickHandler>Chephirah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0881G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0881G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0881G' clickHandler>Beeroth</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and Kirjathjearim.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0139' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0139' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0139' clickHandler>Adoni-Zedek</jLink></jLink></jLink> king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> appealed to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1944' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1944' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1944' clickHandler>Hoham</jLink></jLink></jLink> king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler>Hebron</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6502' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6502' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6502' clickHandler>Piram</jLink></jLink></jLink> king of Jarmuth, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3309G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3309G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3309G' clickHandler>Japhia</jLink></jLink></jLink> king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3923' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3923' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3923' clickHandler>Lachish</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1688H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1688H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1688H' clickHandler>Debir</jLink></jLink></jLink> king of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler>Eglon</jLink></jLink></jLink> to unite against <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler>Gibeon</jLink></jLink></jLink> for making a treaty with the Israelites. They all set to attack <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler>Gibeon</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> got <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler>Gibeon</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s help cry and marched all night to attack the attackers. God made the attackers' armies confused so they were defeated and they retreated. The Israelites pursued them. God killed many more with huge hailstones. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked God to make the sun and the moon stand still until the nation was avenged. God does this. There has never been a day before or since when God listened to a man. Joseph locked the kings of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler>Hebron</jLink></jLink></jLink>, Jarmuth, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3923' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3923' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3923' clickHandler>Lachish</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler>Eglon</jLink></jLink></jLink> in a cave where they hid while his army destroyed almost all of the rest of the retreating armies. Then Joseph commanded his army commanders to get the 5 kings from the cave and step on their necks. Then Joseph killed the kings, hung them until nightfall, then buried them under stones at the mouth of the cave. Then his army attacked and devastated Mekkedah, killing all inhabitants. Successively, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> and his army devastated and slaughtered all at Libnah, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3923' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3923' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3923' clickHandler>Lachish</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler>Eglon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler>Hebron</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1688H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1688H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1688H' clickHandler>Debir</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The whole region from Kadesh Barnea to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler>Gaza</jLink></jLink></jLink> and from the whole region of Goshen to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1391' clickHandler>Gibeon</jLink></jLink></jLink> was conquered because God was on their side.

The Israelites had similar victories throughout the north, including against an army as numerous as the sand on the beach with a large number of horses and chariots. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> took this entire land: the hill country, all the Negev, the whole region of Goshen, the western foothills, the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6160G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6160G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6160G' clickHandler>Arabah</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the mountains of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> with their foothills, from Mount Halak, which rises toward <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8165B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8165B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8165B' clickHandler>Seir</jLink></jLink></jLink>, to Baal Gad in the Valley of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler>Lebanon</jLink></jLink></jLink> below Mount Hermon. God had hardened everyone's hearts in the Promised Land to wage war against the Israelites. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> took from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler>Hebron</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1688H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1688H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1688H' clickHandler>Debir</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6024' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6024' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6024' clickHandler>Anab</jLink></jLink></jLink>, from all the hill country of Judah, and from all the hill country of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. No survivors were left except some Anakites in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler>Gaza</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1661' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1661' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1661' clickHandler>Gath</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0795' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0795' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0795' clickHandler>Ashdod</jLink></jLink></jLink>. All was done as <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> had directed.

The defeated kings are listed, 31 total, including <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5747' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5747' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5747' clickHandler>Og</jLink></jLink></jLink> king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1316' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1316' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1316' clickHandler>Bashan</jLink></jLink></jLink>,one of the last of the Rephaites.

When <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> was old, God told him that there was still much land to take. God Himself would drive people out of the mountain regions from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler>Lebanon</jLink></jLink></jLink> to Misrephoth Maim. God reminds <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> to divide the land among the tribes. Then the different tribe inheritance lands thus far are listed.

The land divisions on the west of the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink> are discussed. The hill country of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler>Hebron</jLink></jLink></jLink> is given to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler>Caleb</jLink></jLink></jLink> as a reward for his actions in Deuteronomy 1.

The land allotment for the tribe of Judah is discussed. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler>Caleb</jLink></jLink></jLink> captures his given land and give his daughter to her cousin as a reward for capturing a city in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler>Caleb</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s new land. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler>Caleb</jLink></jLink></jLink> gave his daughter land in Negev and the upper and lower springs. Clan by clan Judah's land division is discussed. Judah couldn't “dislodge” the <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2983G' clickHandler>Jebusites</jLink></jLink></jLink> in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

The allotment for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler>Manasseh</jLink></jLink></jLink> are discussed. Clan by clan <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s land division is discussed. They did not dislodge the Canaanites, but turned them into slaves instead.

Clan by clan <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler>Manasseh</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s land division is discussed. The Manassites were not able to occupy all the towns in their allotment because the Canaanites “were determined to live in that region”. When the Israelites got stronger, they forced the Canaanites into slave labor, but could not drive them out completely. They said that one of the reasons they couldn't beat the Canaanites is that they all had iron chariots. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3130G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3130G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3130G' clickHandler>Joseph</jLink></jLink></jLink> reassures them that they can drive out the Canaanites.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> has they remaining 7 tribes survey the remaining land and then he divides it up for them. The allotment for the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler>Benjamin</jLink></jLink></jLink>, clan by clan is discussed. The allotment includes the Valley of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7497B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7497B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7497B' clickHandler>Rephaim</jLink></jLink></jLink> (Valley of the Giants).

The allotment for the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8095G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8095G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8095G' clickHandler>Simeon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, clan by clan is discussed. The allotment for the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler>Zebulun</jLink></jLink></jLink>, clan by clan is discussed. Their allotment included Bethlehem. The allotment for the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3485G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3485G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3485G' clickHandler>Issachar</jLink></jLink></jLink>, clan by clan is discussed. The allotment for the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler>Asher</jLink></jLink></jLink>, clan by clan is discussed. The allotment for the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler>Naphtali</jLink></jLink></jLink>, clan by clan is discussed. The allotment for the tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1835H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1835H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1835H' clickHandler>Dan</jLink></jLink></jLink>, clan by clan is discussed. The Danites had difficulty taking their land, so they went somewhere else. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> was given Timnath <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8294' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8294' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8294' clickHandler>Serah</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

The cities of refuge were set up for those that committed accidental murder: <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6943G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6943G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6943G' clickHandler>Kedesh</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7927G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7927G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7927G' clickHandler>Shechem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, Kiriath <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0704' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0704' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0704' clickHandler>Arba</jLink></jLink></jLink> (that is, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler>Hebron</jLink></jLink></jLink>), <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1221H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1221H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1221H' clickHandler>Bezer</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7433' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7433' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7433' clickHandler>Ramoth</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1474' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1474' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1474' clickHandler>Golan</jLink></jLink></jLink>.
The Levites get their towns and pasture lands for stewardship. God did all that He had promised and not one of their enemies withstood them.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> sends the men from the tribes east of the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink> back to their homes since the promised lad was now taken. The eastern tribes built a replica of God's altar just across the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The western tribes were afraid the eastern sides were already breaking off from God and prepared for war with the eastern tribes. The western tribes explained the altar was just to serve as a reminder that they were part of God's chosen people as well, and the western tribes were then happy again with the eastern tribes.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> was about to die, so he summoned all the leaders of the Israelite tribes. He reminds them to love God and follow His laws, the Law of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>. He says God has fulfilled all of His promises. He reminds the leaders that God will inflict them with “all the evil he has threatened” if they stray from their covenant with God.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> calls all the tribes of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> at <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7927G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7927G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7927G' clickHandler>Shechem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, including the elders, leaders, judges and officials. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> recounts their history; saying that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink> and his father had worshiped other gods. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> recounts the flight from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the history thus far. And he reminds the Israelites to keep the covenant with God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> says “[God] is a jealous God. He will not forgive your rebellion and your sins.” <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> says God will hurt and destroy them if they worship other gods. The people say they will. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> says they're not able to do it. The people say yes we can and we will. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> puts a rock against a tree as a witness to their covenant affirmation. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> dies. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0499G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0499G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0499G' clickHandler>Eleazar</jLink></jLink></jLink> dies.

God tells the Israelites that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> will now lead them to victory over the Canaanites in place of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and He has given the Canaanites into the Israelites hands. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> enlisted the Simeonites to fight as well. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> attacked the Canaanites and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6522' clickHandler>Perizzites</jLink></jLink></jLink>, killing 10,000 at Bezek. They found <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0137' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0137' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0137' clickHandler>Adoni-Bezek</jLink></jLink></jLink> and cut off his thumbs and big toes. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0137' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0137' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0137' clickHandler>Adoni-Bezek</jLink></jLink></jLink> considered this payback for 70 kings he'd given the same punishment. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0137' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0137' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0137' clickHandler>Adoni-Bezek</jLink></jLink></jLink> died in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> attacked Canaanites living in the hill country, the Negev and the western foothills, in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler>Hebron</jLink></jLink></jLink> (formerly called Kiriath <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0704' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0704' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0704' clickHandler>Arba</jLink></jLink></jLink>) and defeated <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8344' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8344' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8344' clickHandler>Sheshai</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0289G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0289G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0289G' clickHandler>Ahiman</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8526G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8526G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8526G' clickHandler>Talmai</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler>Caleb</jLink></jLink></jLink> gives his daughter Acsah to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6274' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6274' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6274' clickHandler>Othniel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler>Caleb</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s brother, for taking Kiriath Sepher. Acsah requested and received the upper and lower springs from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler>Caleb</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> totally destroys <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6857' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6857' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6857' clickHandler>Zephath</jLink></jLink></jLink> (Hormah), and took <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler>Gaza</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0831' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0831' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0831' clickHandler>Ashkelon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6138' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6138' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6138' clickHandler>Ekron</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Although God was with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, They could not drive out the people of the plains because those people had iron chariots. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2275A' clickHandler>Hebron</jLink></jLink></jLink> was given to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3612G' clickHandler>Caleb</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3130G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3130G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3130G' clickHandler>Joseph</jLink></jLink></jLink> attacked Bethel (formerly <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3870G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3870G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3870G' clickHandler>Luz</jLink></jLink></jLink>) and killed the entire city but the family of a man that helped the invasion. This family built a new city called <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3870G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3870G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3870G' clickHandler>Luz</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler>Manasseh</jLink></jLink></jLink> left some “determined” Canaanites living in the lands and eventually made them slaves. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> left Canaanites as well. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler>Zebulun</jLink></jLink></jLink> left Canaanites as well, which were eventually turned into slaves. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0836' clickHandler>Asher</jLink></jLink></jLink> left Canaanites as well. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler>Naphtali</jLink></jLink></jLink> left Canaanites as well, which were eventually turned into slaves. The <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler>Amorites</jLink></jLink></jLink> held the Danites from entering the plains. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0567' clickHandler>Amorites</jLink></jLink></jLink> in Mt. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2776G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2776G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2776G' clickHandler>Heres</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0357' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0357' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0357' clickHandler>Aijalon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8169' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8169' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8169' clickHandler>Shaalbim</jLink></jLink></jLink> were turned to slave by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

God, in angel form, tells the Israelites that since they made covenants with some of the people in the Promised Land, and since the Israelites didn't break down their altars, God will not drive the people out before the Israelites and they will remain as thorns in the Israelites' sides. This occurred at Bokim. The generation after <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091G' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> knew not God or what He did for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. They broke God's covenant and worshiped Baals and other pagan gods. God was angry and sent raiders to defeat them. Then God raised up judges (leaders) to save them from the raiders, because God had compassion on the Israelites for their suffering. The Israelites continued their disobedience to God despite the judges, and become more corrupt after each judge dies. God leaves the people of the Promised Land among the Israelites to test them.

God leaves the five rulers of the Philistines, all the Canaanites, the Sidonians, and the <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2340' clickHandler>Hivites</jLink></jLink></jLink> living in the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler>Lebanon</jLink></jLink></jLink> mountains from Mount Baal Hermon to Lebo <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2574G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2574G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2574G' clickHandler>Hamath</jLink></jLink></jLink> to teach warfare to the Israelites that had not seen battle and to test the Israelites with their covenant with God. The Israelites became corrupt. God “sells” the Israelites into slavery for 8 years. After the Israelites cried out to God, He sends <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6274' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6274' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6274' clickHandler>Othniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> as a judge to liberated them. The Israelites find peace for 40 years. The Israelites became corrupt. God gives power over the Israelites to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler>Eglon</jLink></jLink></jLink> king of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler>Moab</jLink></jLink></jLink> for 18 years. After the Israelites cried out to God, He sends <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0164G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0164G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0164G' clickHandler>Ehud</jLink></jLink></jLink> as a judge to liberated them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0164G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0164G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0164G' clickHandler>Ehud</jLink></jLink></jLink> was left-handed. He tricks <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler>Eglon</jLink></jLink></jLink> into private council and assassinates him with a short sword plunged completely into <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5700H' clickHandler>Eglon</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s fat body. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0164G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0164G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0164G' clickHandler>Ehud</jLink></jLink></jLink> escapes and leads the Israelites into battle killing 10,000 Moabites. The Israelites find peace for 80 years. The next judge was <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8044' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8044' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8044' clickHandler>Shamgar</jLink></jLink></jLink> who kills 600 Philistines with a cattle prodding stick.

When <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0164G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0164G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0164G' clickHandler>Ehud</jLink></jLink></jLink> died, the Israelites sinned again, so God punishes them by “selling” them to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2985H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2985H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2985H' clickHandler>Jabin</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the king of the Canaanites. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5516G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5516G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5516G' clickHandler>Sisera</jLink></jLink></jLink> was <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2985H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2985H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2985H' clickHandler>Jabin</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s army commander, and he had 900 iron chariots. The Israelites were cruelly oppressed for 20 years when they finally called for help from God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1683H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1683H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1683H' clickHandler>Deborah</jLink></jLink></jLink> was the judge/leader of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> at that time. The Israelites came to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1683H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1683H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1683H' clickHandler>Deborah</jLink></jLink></jLink> for guidance.
