Trust in the Lord: Expresses <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>’s trust in the Lord despite the threats he faces. When the foundations of society are shaken, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> declares his confidence in God as his refuge. He acknowledges that the Lord is in His holy temple and sees what happens on earth. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> reassures himself that the righteous will see God’s face and that the Lord will judge the wicked. This psalm emphasizes the importance of faith in God during difficult times and the assurance of His justice.

A Plea for Help Against Deceit: A lament about the prevalence of deceitful speech and the lack of faithful people. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> cries out to God for help, expressing his concern for the faithful who seem to be vanishing. He laments the lies and flattery of the wicked and asks God to protect and preserve the righteous. The psalm concludes with the assurance that the words of the Lord are pure and will stand firm against the deception of the wicked. This psalm highlights the importance of truth and God’s commitment to justice.

A Cry for Deliverance: <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expresses deep anguish and a sense of abandonment by God. He asks how long God will forget him and pleads for God to answer his prayers. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> feels overwhelmed and fears that his enemies will triumph over him.¶Despite his distress, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> ultimately expresses faith in God’s goodness and love. He chooses to trust in God’s salvation and rejoices in His mercy. This psalm illustrates the struggle between despair and hope, showing that even in difficult times, faith can prevail.

The Foolishness of the Wicked: <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> reflects on the foolishness of those who deny God. He states that the fool says in their heart, "There is no God." <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> describes the wicked as corrupt, who do not do good and do not seek God.¶The psalm highlights the suffering of the poor and the oppressed, and it emphasizes that God is with the righteous. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> concludes by expressing hope that salvation will come from Zion, and he calls for joy among the people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. This psalm serves as a reminder of the importance of faith in God and the consequences of turning away from Him.

The Character of the Righteous: Describes the qualities of a person who may dwell in God’s presence. The psalm begins with a question asking who can live in God’s holy hill. The answer outlines the characteristics of the righteous: they walk blamelessly, do what is right, speak the truth from their heart, do not slander others, and do not harm their neighbors. They reject evil and honor those who fear the Lord. This psalm emphasizes the importance of integrity and righteousness in one’s life and affirms that those who live according to God’s ways will be welcomed into His presence.

A Psalm of Trust and Joy: A beautiful expression of trust in God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the author, declares that the Lord is his refuge and source of security. He expresses joy in the company of the faithful and acknowledges that God is the one who provides for him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> also speaks against idol worship, declaring that the Lord alone is his inheritance and portion. He finds comfort in God’s guidance and expresses confidence in eternal life, famously stating that God will not abandon him to the grave. This psalm highlights the themes of trust, joy, and the hope of resurrection.

A Prayer for Protection: The author, likely <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>, prays for protection against his enemies. He asks God to hear his plea and to listen to his cry for help. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> describes his innocence and faithfulness, asserting that he has not turned to evil ways.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> seeks God’s deliverance from the wicked, who are described as ruthless and powerful. He asks God to guard him as the apple of His eye and to protect him from those who seek to harm him. The psalm ends with a declaration of faith that he will behold God’s face and be satisfied when he awakens. This psalm highlights the themes of trust and reliance on God for safety.

A Song of Thanksgiving: <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> gives thanks to the Lord for delivering him from his enemies, particularly from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler>Saul</jLink></jLink></jLink>. He begins by declaring his love for God, who is his strength and fortress. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> describes how God rescued him from danger, using vivid imagery of a mighty warrior who comes to his aid.¶The psalm recounts <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>’s distress and how God responded by shaking the earth and sending help. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> praises God for His faithfulness and acknowledges that God rewards the righteous. The psalm concludes with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> celebrating God’s victories and proclaiming His greatness. This psalm emphasizes gratitude for God’s protection and deliverance.

The Glory of God in Creation and His Law: Celebrates God’s revelation through creation and His Word. The psalm begins by declaring that the heavens declare the glory of God, and nature speaks of His handiwork. Day after day, creation reveals knowledge about God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> then shifts focus to the law of the Lord, describing it as perfect, trustworthy, and radiant. He emphasizes that God’s commands bring joy and enlightenment to the heart. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> concludes with a prayer, asking God to keep him from sin and to accept the words of his mouth and the meditation of his heart. This psalm highlights the beauty of creation and the significance of God’s law.

A Prayer for Victory: A prayer for the king, likely composed for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> during a time of battle. The psalm expresses confidence in God’s protection and help. The people pray for the king’s success and for God to grant him his heart’s desires. They affirm that while some may trust in chariots and horses, they will trust in the name of the Lord. The psalm concludes with a request for God to save and answer the king when he calls. This psalm emphasizes the importance of seeking God’s support in times of conflict.

Thanksgiving for the King’s Victory: The author celebrates the victory of the king, likely referring to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Begins with praise for God’s strength and the blessings given to the king. It describes how God answered the king’s prayers and granted him great victories.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> rejoices in God’s protection and the triumph over his enemies. The psalm emphasizes that the king’s victories come from God, and it expresses confidence that God will continue to support him. This psalm highlights the themes of gratitude and the acknowledgment of God’s role in success.

A Lament and Hope: Begins as a lament, with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> crying out to God in despair. He feels abandoned and expresses his suffering, describing how he is mocked and scorned by others. This psalm famously opens with the words, "My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?" However, as the psalm progresses, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> recalls God’s faithfulness and the ways He has helped his ancestors. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expresses hope that God will deliver him from his troubles and ends with a declaration of praise. He envisions future generations praising God for His deliverance. This psalm is significant as it foreshadows the suffering of Christ and emphasizes themes of lament, hope, and faith.

The Lord as Shepherd: One of the most well-known psalms, attributed to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>. In this psalm, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> describes the Lord as his shepherd, emphasizing deep trust and reliance on God. He begins by stating, "The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want," indicating that God provides for all his needs. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> illustrates how God leads him to green pastures and still waters, restoring his soul.¶Even when walking through the darkest valley, often interpreted as a time of trouble or danger, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> fears no evil because God is with him. The imagery of God’s rod and staff provides comfort and guidance. The psalm concludes with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expressing confidence that goodness and mercy will follow him all the days of his life, and he will dwell in the house of the Lord forever. This psalm emphasizes themes of comfort, guidance, and divine provision.

The King of Glory: Celebrates the majesty of God and His rightful place as King. The psalm begins by proclaiming that the earth and everything in it belongs to the Lord. It asks the question, "Who may ascend the hill of the Lord?" and answers that only those with clean hands and pure hearts can stand in His presence.¶The psalm continues with a call to open the gates for the King of Glory, depicting God as a mighty warrior. The "King of Glory" is often understood to refer to God as He comes to His people. This psalm highlights themes of holiness, worship, and the recognition of God’s sovereignty.

A Prayer for Guidance: A prayer of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> asking for guidance and forgiveness. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> opens by expressing his trust in the Lord and seeking God’s help. He asks God to guide him in His truth and teach him, as he relies on God for salvation. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> acknowledges his sins and asks for mercy, showing humility and repentance.¶He reflects on God’s goodness and faithfulness, encouraging others to hope in the Lord. The psalm emphasizes the importance of seeking God’s direction and the assurance of His mercy for those who are humble and repentant.

A Declaration of Integrity: Another psalm of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>, where he affirms his integrity and righteousness. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> asks God to vindicate him, as he has walked in faithfulness and trusted in the Lord without wavering. He contrasts himself with those who engage in deceit and wickedness, stating that he has not associated with them.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expresses his desire to be in God’s presence and to worship in His house. He concludes with a plea for redemption and grace, highlighting the importance of living a life of integrity and devotion to God.

Confidence in the Lord: A powerful declaration of faith by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>. He begins by stating that the Lord is his light and salvation, creating a sense of confidence against fear. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expresses his desire to dwell in the house of the Lord and to seek His presence.¶He acknowledges facing enemies and adversity, yet he remains confident that God will protect him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> emphasizes the importance of seeking God and waiting for His help. The psalm concludes with encouragement to be strong and take heart, reaffirming trust in God’s goodness. This psalm emphasizes themes of faith, courage, and the importance of God’s presence.

A Cry for Help: A prayer of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> seeking God’s help amidst trouble. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> cries out to the Lord, asking not to be silent and to hear his plea. He expresses concern that if God does not respond, he will be like those who go down to the pit.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> pleads for God to deliver him from the hands of the wicked, who speak deceitfully. He calls upon God to bless His people and to be their strength and shield. The psalm concludes with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expressing confidence that God will save His anointed and provide help to His people. This psalm highlights the importance of prayer and reliance on God during difficult times.

The Voice of the Lord: A majestic hymn that describes the power of God’s voice in creation. The psalm begins by calling the heavenly beings to give glory to the Lord. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> describes the Lord’s voice as powerful and full of majesty, causing the mighty to tremble and the trees to sway.¶The psalm emphasizes God’s sovereignty over nature, depicting storms and thunder as manifestations of His power. It concludes by stating that the Lord sits enthroned over the flood and gives strength to His people. This psalm highlights themes of God’s majesty, power, and care for His people.

A Song of Thanksgiving: A song of thanksgiving attributed to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>, celebrating God’s deliverance. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by praising the Lord for lifting him out of despair and not allowing his enemies to rejoice over him. He recounts how he cried to God for help and how God restored his health.¶The psalm reflects on the temporary nature of sorrow, emphasizing that joy comes in the morning. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> encourages others to give thanks to the Lord and to sing praises for His faithfulness. This psalm emphasizes the themes of gratitude, healing, and the transformation from sorrow to joy.

A Prayer for Protection: A prayer of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> in which he seeks refuge in God during times of distress. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by asking God to deliver him and protect him from his enemies. He expresses his trust in the Lord, stating that God is his rock and fortress.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> acknowledges his troubles and sorrow, feeling the weight of his circumstances. He pleads for God’s mercy and asks for help, declaring that he has trusted in God since his youth. The psalm emphasizes the importance of seeking God’s guidance and finding hope in His faithfulness. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> concludes by calling for joy, as he knows that God will save him from his troubles. This psalm highlights themes of trust, protection, and the assurance of God’s presence.

The Blessing of Forgiveness: Attributed to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> and focuses on the joy of receiving forgiveness from God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by stating that those whose transgressions are forgiven are blessed. He describes how he felt when he kept silent about his sins, experiencing physical and emotional pain.¶When he finally confessed his sins to God, he found relief and forgiveness. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> encourages others to seek God while He may be found, reminding them that God is a refuge for those in need. The psalm concludes with a call to rejoice in the Lord, emphasizing the blessings of confession and the joy that comes from being in a right relationship with God. This psalm emphasizes themes of repentance, forgiveness, and the joy of salvation.

The Greatness of God: Celebrates the greatness and power of God as Creator. The psalm begins with a call to praise the Lord with joyful songs. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> emphasizes the importance of righteousness and true worship, encouraging people to trust in God’s unfailing love.¶He describes how God created the heavens and the earth by His word and how His plans will prevail. The psalm also reflects on the nations and their rulers, stating that they do not stand against God’s will. It concludes with a declaration that those who hope in the Lord will be blessed. This psalm emphasizes themes of worship, God’s sovereignty, and the assurance of His protection.

A Call to Praise and Trust: A psalm of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> written when he pretended to be insane before Abimelek to escape danger. In this psalm, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> invites others to join him in praising the Lord for His goodness. He shares how God delivered him from all his fears and troubles.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> encourages the afflicted to seek the Lord, stating that God hears their cries and saves them. The psalm describes the blessings of those who trust in God, including protection from harm. It concludes with a reminder that the Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit. This psalm emphasizes themes of praise, deliverance, and God’s care for the needy.

A Prayer for Rescue from Enemies: A plea from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> for God’s intervention against his enemies. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by asking God to contend with those who contend with him and to fight against those who fight against him. He describes his enemies’ schemes and their desire to harm him without cause.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expresses his hope that God will bring justice and protect him from his adversaries. He calls for their shame and confusion, asking God to vindicate him. The psalm concludes with a declaration of praise to God when He delivers <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> from his troubles. This psalm emphasizes themes of justice, divine intervention, and trust in God’s protection.

The Wickedness of Humanity and God’s Faithfulness: Contrasts the wickedness of humanity with the faithfulness of God. The psalm begins by describing the wicked person, whose sin leads to deception and a lack of fear of God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> reflects on the consequences of such behavior and the danger it poses to others.¶In contrast, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> extols God’s love and faithfulness, describing it as precious and life-giving. He emphasizes that God’s righteousness is like the mountains and His judgments are deep. The psalm concludes with a plea for God’s protection and guidance, expressing confidence that those who take refuge in Him will be safe. This psalm highlights the contrast between human wickedness and God’s steadfast love.

Trust in the Lord: A wisdom psalm that encourages trust in the Lord amid the apparent prosperity of the wicked. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by advising not to be envious of evildoers, as their success is temporary. Instead, he encourages the faithful to trust in the Lord, do good, and delight in Him.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> lists the blessings that come from trusting God, including the inheritance of the land and peace. He contrasts the fate of the wicked with that of the righteous, assuring that the righteous will be upheld by God. The psalm emphasizes patience and confidence in God’s justice. This psalm highlights themes of faith, patience, and God’s ultimate justice.

A Cry for Help in Suffering: A penitential psalm in which <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expresses deep sorrow and physical suffering due to his sins. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by pleading for God’s mercy and not rebuking him in anger. He describes his afflictions, feeling overwhelmed by guilt and pain.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> acknowledges his sinfulness and the weight of his transgressions. He feels isolated and distressed, calling out to God for help. Despite his suffering, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expresses hope that God will not forsake him. The psalm concludes with a plea for deliverance, emphasizing the need for God’s mercy and the importance of repentance. This psalm highlights themes of guilt, suffering, and the power of confession.

A Reflection on the Brevity of Life: Attributed to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> and reflects on the shortness and fragility of life. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by expressing his desire to be silent and not speak out of anger or frustration. He realizes that speaking thoughtlessly can lead to sin.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> reflects on the nature of human life, recognizing that it is brief and filled with trouble. He acknowledges that people are like a mere breath and that their days are fleeting. In his sorrow, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> asks the Lord to show him how long he has left and to deliver him from his sins. The psalm concludes with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expressing his hope and trust in God, asking for deliverance from his troubles. This psalm emphasizes themes of humility, the brevity of life, and the importance of seeking God.

A Song of Thanksgiving for Deliverance: Another psalm of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> that begins with a declaration of hope. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expresses his gratitude for God’s deliverance from distress. He recalls how he waited patiently for the Lord, and God heard his cry.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> describes being lifted from a pit of despair and placed on solid ground. He emphasizes the importance of praising God and sharing his testimony with others. In this psalm, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> speaks about the joy of following God’s will and expresses a desire to do what pleases Him. The psalm concludes with a plea for help in the face of adversity, acknowledging that God cares for the poor and the needy. This psalm highlights themes of deliverance, gratitude, and the joy of serving God.

A Prayer for Healing and Protection: A psalm of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> that reflects on the blessings of caring for the weak and the sick. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by declaring that those who consider the poor will be blessed and protected by the Lord.¶He expresses his own distress, asking for God’s mercy and healing. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> mentions the betrayal he feels from a close friend, which causes him deep sorrow. Despite his pain, he remains confident in God’s protection and deliverance. The psalm concludes with a note of praise for the Lord, affirming that He is the God of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. This psalm emphasizes themes of compassion, healing, and trust in God.

A Deep Longing for God: Expresses a profound longing for God. The psalmist, often understood to be <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>, compares his thirst for God to a deer that longs for water. He remembers the joy of worshiping in the house of God but feels distant from the Lord.¶The psalmist expresses deep sorrow and confusion, wondering why his soul is so downcast. He recalls past experiences of joy but struggles with feelings of abandonment. Despite his despair, the psalmist encourages himself to hope in God, affirming that he will yet praise the Lord. This psalm highlights themes of longing for God, the struggle with despair, and the importance of hope.

A continuation of the themes from Psalm 42. The Psalmist pleads with God to vindicate him against an unjust nation and deceitful people. He asks God to send His light and truth to guide him back to His holy hill, which refers to Mount Zion in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The Psalmist expresses a desire to worship God again in His presence. He repeats the refrain of hoping in God, showing determination to praise Him despite his troubles.

A National Lament: A communal lament that reflects the suffering of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> as a nation. The psalmist recalls God’s past victories and the deliverance of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> from its enemies. However, he expresses confusion and sorrow because, despite their faithfulness, the people are now facing defeat and humiliation.¶The psalmist cries out to God, asking why He has hidden His face and allowed the nation to suffer. He affirms their commitment to God and pleads for His help and deliverance. This psalm highlights themes of national identity, lament, and the struggle to understand God’s actions in times of trouble.

A Royal Wedding Song: A royal psalm celebrating a king’s wedding. The psalmist describes the beauty and majesty of the king, praising his strength and righteousness.¶The psalm emphasizes the king’s role as a warrior and leader, expressing hope that he will be blessed by God. It also speaks about the queen, adorned in gold, and encourages her to honor the king. This psalm beautifully illustrates themes of love, royalty, and the blessings of God upon the leaders of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

God as Our Refuge: A powerful affirmation of God’s presence and protection. The psalm begins with the proclamation that God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.¶The psalmist describes natural disasters and chaos but assures that believers need not fear because God is with them. The imagery of the city of God, often interpreted as <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, emphasizes God’s faithfulness and protection. The psalm concludes with an invitation to be still and know that God is in control. This psalm highlights themes of God’s protection, His presence in times of trouble, and the call to trust in Him.

God is King Over All the Earth: A joyful hymn celebrating God’s sovereignty and kingship. The psalm begins with a call for all nations to clap their hands and shout with joy to God. The psalmist emphasizes that the Lord is most high, a great king over all the earth.¶The psalm recounts how God subdued nations and chose <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> as His inheritance. The imagery of God ascending with a shout and the sound of a trumpet emphasizes His majesty and power. The psalm concludes with an invitation to sing praises to God, affirming that God reigns over the nations. This psalm highlights themes of worship, God’s sovereignty, and the call for all people to recognize His greatness.

The Beauty of Zion: Celebrates Zion, often understood as <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and praises its beauty and strength. The psalmist begins by declaring that the Lord is great and worthy of praise in the city of God. Zion is described as a joyful place, the mountain of God, where His presence dwells.¶The psalm reflects on the security of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, noting that kings and nations may gather against it, but they will be terrified and flee. The psalmist encourages people to walk around Zion, recounting its towers and ramparts. The psalm concludes with a reminder of God’s faithfulness and presence in the city. This psalm emphasizes themes of divine protection, the beauty of God’s dwelling place, and the joy of being in His presence.

The Futility of Trusting in Wealth: A wisdom psalm that addresses the futility of trusting in riches. The psalmist begins by calling for attention from all people, regardless of their social status. He speaks about the inevitability of death and how wealth cannot save anyone from the grave.¶The psalm emphasizes that the wise and foolish both die and leave their possessions behind. The rich may think their wealth will secure their legacy, but it cannot prevent their demise. The psalm concludes with a warning that those who trust in wealth will perish, while the righteous will be redeemed by God. This psalm highlights themes of mortality, the emptiness of materialism, and the importance of trusting in God.

God Calls for True Worship: A prophetic psalm attributed to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler>Asaph</jLink></jLink></jLink>, a leader in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>’s court. God is depicted as the mighty one who summons the earth to witness His judgment. He declares that He does not need sacrifices, as He owns all creation.¶God critiques empty rituals and calls His people to offer true thanksgiving and fulfill their vows. The psalm emphasizes that God desires honest worship and a close relationship with His people rather than mere ritualistic offerings. The psalm concludes with a warning to the wicked, reminding them that God will judge those who do not honor Him. This psalm highlights themes of true worship, accountability, and God’s desire for sincerity in faith.

A Prayer for Forgiveness and Restoration: One of the most famous penitential psalms, traditionally attributed to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> after his sin with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1339' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1339' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1339' clickHandler>Bathsheba</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by pleading for God’s mercy and forgiveness, acknowledging his sinfulness.¶He asks God to create a clean heart within him and to restore the joy of salvation. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expresses deep remorse and recognizes that true worship comes from a broken spirit and a contrite heart. The psalm concludes with a prayer for God to rebuild the walls of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and to accept the sacrifices of the righteous. This psalm emphasizes themes of repentance, forgiveness, and the longing for spiritual renewal.

The Fate of the Wicked: A psalm that addresses the wickedness of a man named <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1673' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1673' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1673' clickHandler>Doeg</jLink></jLink></jLink>, who betrayed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The psalmist begins by mocking the strength of the wicked, describing how <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1673' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1673' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1673' clickHandler>Doeg</jLink></jLink></jLink> boasts in evil and destroys others with his words.¶The psalm contrasts the fate of the wicked with that of the righteous. While the wicked may thrive temporarily, they will ultimately be uprooted. The psalmist expresses confidence in God’s steadfast love and declares that he will praise God forever. This psalm highlights themes of the consequences of evil, the ultimate triumph of good, and the importance of faithfulness to God.

The Folly of Atheism: Similar to Psalm 14 and addresses the foolishness of denying God’s existence. The psalmist declares that the fool says in his heart, "There is no God," and describes the corruption of such people.¶He reflects on how they do not seek God and act wickedly, causing harm to others. The psalm emphasizes that God looks down from heaven to see if anyone is wise or seeks Him. The psalm concludes with a longing for the salvation of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, affirming that God will restore His people. This psalm emphasizes themes of faith, the folly of disbelief, and the hope for divine intervention.

A Prayer for Help Against Enemies: Another prayer of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> seeking help from God against his enemies. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by asking God to save him by His name and to vindicate him by His strength. He expresses his fear of those who seek to harm him.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> recalls that God is his helper and that He will uphold his life. The psalm concludes with a promise to offer sacrifices to God and to praise His name for His goodness. This psalm emphasizes themes of divine assistance, trust in God’s protection, and the importance of worship.

A Lament Over Betrayal: A lament of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expressing deep sorrow and anguish. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by pleading with God to listen to his prayer and not to ignore his cries for help. He describes his fear and the distress he feels because of his enemies.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> reveals that he is deeply troubled by the betrayal of a close friend, someone he trusted, which intensifies his pain. He longs for peace and wishes he could escape his troubles, expressing a desire to fly away and find rest. Despite his despair, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> calls on God, confident that God will save him from his enemies. The psalm concludes with a reminder that God will hear the cries of the righteous and bring justice. This psalm emphasizes themes of betrayal, sorrow, and trust in God's deliverance.

Trust in God Amid Fear: Another psalm of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>, written when the Philistines captured him in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1661' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1661' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1661' clickHandler>Gath</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by expressing his fear of men who are attacking him. He acknowledges that many enemies are constantly seeking to harm him.¶Despite his fears, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> declares his trust in God. He states that when he is afraid, he will trust in the Lord. He emphasizes that God knows his troubles and counts his tears, assuring him that his enemies will ultimately fall. The psalm concludes with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> promising to offer sacrifices and praise to God for His faithfulness and deliverance. This psalm highlights themes of fear, faith, and God's protection.

A Call for Mercy and Praise: A prayer of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> when he fled from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler>Saul</jLink></jLink></jLink> in a cave. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by asking God for mercy and refuge. He expresses his trust in God to deliver him from his enemies, describing God as the Most High.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> shares his determination to praise God even amid adversity. He uses imagery of being surrounded by lions and fierce enemies but remains confident that God will be exalted above the heavens. The psalm concludes with a declaration of praise for God’s steadfast love and faithfulness. This psalm emphasizes themes of refuge, praise, and the greatness of God.

A Psalm Against Injustice: A communal lament that addresses the corruption of unjust rulers. The psalmist begins by questioning whether rulers indeed speak justly and whether they judge fairly. He describes the wickedness of those in power, stating that they are like venomous snakes.¶The psalmist calls for God to break the teeth of the wicked and to bring justice. He expresses the hope that the righteous will see God’s vengeance against the wicked. The psalm concludes with a declaration that there is a reward for the righteous and that God judges the earth. This psalm highlights themes of justice, corruption, and the hope for divine intervention.

A Prayer for Deliverance from Enemies: A prayer of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> when <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler>Saul</jLink></jLink></jLink> sent men to kill him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by asking God to deliver him from his enemies, expressing his fear and urgency. He describes how his enemies lie in wait to attack him without cause.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> calls on God, emphasizing that He is his strength and fortress. He expresses confidence that God will deliver him from his adversaries. The psalm concludes with a call to praise God for His strength and faithfulness, affirming that he will sing of God’s power. This psalm emphasizes themes of danger, trust in God, and the assurance of His protection.

A National Lament and Call for Help: A national lament attributed to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> during a time of military defeat. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by acknowledging that God has rejected and made the people stumble. He calls upon God for help and restoration.¶The psalm reflects on the challenges faced by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and expresses the need for God’s assistance in battle. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> recalls how God has given the land to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and asks for strength and victory against their enemies. The psalm concludes with a declaration of faith, emphasizing that with God’s help, they can overcome their challenges. This psalm highlights themes of national struggles, reliance on God, and the hope for victory.

A Prayer for Protection and Guidance: A personal prayer of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>, asking for God’s protection and guidance. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by crying out to God from the ends of the earth, expressing his longing for refuge in God’s presence.¶He seeks to be safe in God’s shelter and to be upheld by His strength. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> recalls the promises made to him and expresses confidence that God will prolong his days. The psalm concludes with a commitment to praise God and fulfill his vows. This psalm emphasizes themes of yearning for God’s presence, protection, and the importance of faithfulness.

Finding Rest in God Alone: Attributed to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> and emphasizes finding hope and rest in God alone. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> declares that his soul finds rest in God and that He is his salvation and fortress.¶He warns against trusting in human power and wealth, stating that they are unreliable. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expresses confidence that God will protect him and that he will trust in Him at all times. The psalm concludes with a reminder that God is a refuge for the oppressed and that He will repay the wicked. This psalm highlights themes of trust, reliance on God, and the futility of worldly reliance.

A Thirst for God in the Wilderness: A heartfelt expression of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> while he is in the wilderness of Judah. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by declaring that he thirsts for God like a dry land thirsts for water. He longs for God’s presence and seeks to worship Him.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> recalls how he has seen God’s power and glory in the sanctuary, which fills him with joy and satisfaction that surpasses earthly pleasures. He expresses his commitment to praise God as long as he lives, even during difficult times. The psalm concludes with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> affirming that he finds safety in God’s presence and trusts in His protection. This psalm emphasizes themes of longing for God, worship, and the satisfaction found in His presence.

A Prayer for Deliverance from Enemies: A prayer of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> asking God for protection from hidden enemies. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by asking God to hear his voice and protect him from the plots of the wicked. He describes how the enemies speak deceitfully and aim to ambush the innocent.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expresses his trust in God, believing that He will intervene and bring justice. He describes how God will make the wicked stumble, leading them to their own destruction. The psalm concludes with a declaration of confidence that the righteous will rejoice in the Lord and take refuge in Him. This psalm highlights themes of seeking protection, the wickedness of deceit, and the assurance of God’s deliverance.

Praise for God’s Goodness: A psalm of praise that focuses on God’s goodness and provision. The psalmist begins by declaring that praise is due to God, who answers prayers. He highlights how God forgives sins and provides for the needs of His people.¶The psalm describes the beauty of creation and how God’s abundant blessings are evident in nature. The imagery of mountains, fields, and pastures reflects the richness of God’s creation. The psalm concludes with a joyful acknowledgment of the harvest and God’s faithfulness in providing for His people. This psalm emphasizes themes of gratitude, God’s provision, and the beauty of creation.

A Call to Praise and Remember God’s Works: A communal psalm that calls on all the earth to praise God for His mighty deeds. The psalm begins with a joyful shout of praise, inviting everyone to celebrate God’s greatness.¶The psalmist recalls the wonderful acts of God throughout <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>’s history, including the deliverance from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the crossing of the Red Sea. He reflects on the trials that the people faced but emphasizes that God has tested and refined them like silver. The psalm concludes with an invitation to offer sacrifices of praise to God for His goodness and faithfulness. This psalm highlights themes of communal worship, remembrance of God’s works, and gratitude.

A Prayer for God’s Blessing: A short but powerful prayer asking for God’s blessing upon His people. The psalm begins with a request for God to be gracious and bless the people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, shining His face upon them.¶The purpose of this blessing is that God’s ways may be known on earth and His salvation among all nations. The psalmist expresses hope that all the nations will praise God and recognize His greatness. The psalm concludes with an affirmation that God will bless His people, leading to a joyful response from all nations. This psalm emphasizes themes of blessing, the desire for God’s presence, and the call for all nations to worship Him.

The Majesty of God’s Presence: A triumphant psalm celebrating God’s majesty and His victories over enemies. The psalmist begins with a call for God to arise and scatter His enemies, just as smoke is blown away.¶The psalm recounts God’s powerful acts throughout history, including His presence in the wilderness and His provision for the people. The imagery of God leading His people like a king emphasizes His authority and care. The psalm concludes with a celebration of God’s power and a call to praise Him for His greatness. This psalm highlights themes of victory, God’s sovereignty, and the joy of His presence.

A Lament for Suffering and Plea for Help: A lament of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> expressing deep distress and suffering. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by describing his overwhelming troubles, feeling as if he is drowning in despair. He calls out to God for help, recognizing his own sinfulness but also pleading for mercy.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> recounts how he has faced ridicule and shame for his faithfulness to God. He expresses a desire for his enemies to be punished and for God to save him from his troubles. The psalm concludes with a promise to praise God in the congregation for His deliverance. This psalm emphasizes themes of suffering, the plea for help, and the importance of maintaining faith in difficult times.

A Plea for Quick Deliverance: A short, urgent prayer of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> asking for God’s swift help. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by requesting that God save him and come quickly to his aid. He expresses a sense of urgency due to the presence of his enemies.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> asks that those who seek his life be put to shame and confusion, while those who seek God rejoice and be glad. The psalm concludes with a reaffirmation of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>’s trust in God’s help and his desire to continually praise Him. This psalm highlights themes of urgency in prayer, dependence on God, and the hope for deliverance.

A Prayer for Lifelong Protection: A prayer of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> as he reflects on his life and seeks God's protection in his old age. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by expressing his trust in God, asking for refuge and deliverance from his enemies. He recalls how God has been his strength since his youth and how he has relied on God throughout his life.¶<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> describes the challenges he faces, including the mockery of his enemies who wish to see him fail. He pleads for God to not forsake him as he grows old and weak. The psalm concludes with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> promising to praise God and declare His righteousness to future generations. This psalm emphasizes themes of trust, the importance of remembering God’s faithfulness, and the desire for continued protection.

A Prayer for the King: A royal psalm attributed to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler>Solomon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, asking for God's blessings on the king. The psalm begins with a request for justice and righteousness to be granted to the king, so he can rule fairly and protect the oppressed.¶The psalmist envisions a reign characterized by peace and prosperity, where the king’s influence extends to all nations. It describes the king’s compassion for the needy and the flourishing of the land during his reign. The psalm concludes with a doxology, praising God’s glorious name and affirming that His kingdom will endure forever. This psalm highlights themes of justice, the ideal king, and the hope for a righteous reign.

The Struggle with Envy: A reflection by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler>Asaph</jLink></jLink></jLink>, who struggles with the apparent prosperity of the wicked. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler>Asaph</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins by expressing his faith in God but admits that he almost lost his way when he saw the success of those who do evil. He describes how the wicked seem to live without suffering, which causes him to question the value of his own faithfulness.¶However, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler>Asaph</jLink></jLink></jLink> experiences a turning point when he enters the sanctuary of God and understands their ultimate fate. He realizes that the wicked will face judgment, while the righteous will be upheld by God. The psalm concludes with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler>Asaph</jLink></jLink></jLink> affirming his commitment to God, recognizing that being close to God is his greatest good. This psalm emphasizes themes of doubt, the struggle with envy, and the reassurance found in God’s presence.

A Lament for the Sanctuary: A communal lament that reflects on the destruction of the Temple and the suffering of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The psalmist begins by asking God why He has abandoned His people and allowed their enemies to destroy the sanctuary.¶The psalmist recalls the mighty acts of God in the past, such as the creation of the world and the deliverance of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. He pleads for God to remember His covenant and to rise up against the oppressors. The psalm concludes with a call for God to defend His people and restore the sanctuary. This psalm highlights themes of lament, the desire for restoration, and the remembrance of God’s past faithfulness.

A Declaration of God’s Justice: A psalm that declares God’s sovereignty and justice. The psalmist begins by praising God for His greatness and acknowledging that He will judge the earth at the appointed time.¶The psalm emphasizes that God will bring down the proud and lift up the humble. The psalmist warns against boasting and arrogance, affirming that God is the ultimate judge who determines the fate of nations. The psalm concludes with a declaration of praise for God’s righteousness and His role as the judge. This psalm highlights themes of divine justice, humility, and the assurance of God’s authority.

God’s Power in Judgment: Celebrates God’s power and presence in judgment. The psalm begins by proclaiming that God is known in Judah and that His name is great in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>.¶The psalmist describes how God has defeated the enemies of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, emphasizing His might and authority. The imagery of God’s power is depicted through the defeat of kings and the fear He instills in nations. The psalm concludes with a call to honor God and to make vows to Him, recognizing His greatness. This psalm highlights themes of God’s sovereignty, His role as a protector, and the call to worship Him.

A Reflection on God’s Faithfulness: A personal lament where the psalmist, traditionally attributed to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0623G' clickHandler>Asaph</jLink></jLink></jLink>, expresses deep distress and seeks God’s comfort. The psalmist begins by crying out to God in his trouble, feeling abandoned and overwhelmed.¶He recalls the days of old and remembers God’s mighty deeds, particularly the deliverance of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Despite his current feelings of despair, the psalmist resolves to remember God’s faithfulness and wonders how God can be so powerful yet seemingly distant. The psalm concludes with a reflection on God’s miraculous acts, emphasizing His ability to lead His people. This psalm highlights themes of lament, remembrance, and the struggle to reconcile faith with suffering.

A Historical Reflection on <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>’s Journey: A lengthy psalm that recounts the history of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, focusing on God’s faithfulness and the people’s repeated disobedience. The psalmist begins by calling on the people to listen and learn from the past.¶The psalm recounts significant events, such as the Exodus from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the giving of the Law, and the wandering in the wilderness. It emphasizes how God provided for His people despite their lack of faith and gratitude. The psalm concludes with a reminder of God’s choice of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> as king and His desire for a faithful people. This psalm highlights themes of history, the importance of remembering God’s works, and the consequences of disobedience.

A lament for the destruction of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the suffering of the people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The Psalmist cries out to God, expressing deep sorrow over how the enemies have invaded the land, defiled the Temple, and killed many of God's people. The Psalmist pleads for God's mercy, asking how long He will allow such suffering to continue. He requests that God punish the nations that have harmed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and calls for justice. The Psalm emphasizes the need for God to restore His people and to remember His covenant with them.

The Psalmist seeks restoration for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The Psalm begins with a plea for God to listen and to shine His face upon His people. The imagery of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1144G' clickHandler>Benjamin</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4519G' clickHandler>Manasseh</jLink></jLink></jLink> represents the northern tribes of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The Psalm recalls how God brought <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> out of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and made them a strong nation, but now they face destruction and shame. The Psalmist asks God to restore <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, comparing the nation to a vine that God has planted. The plea is for God to revive His people so that they may turn back to Him and praise His name.

A Psalm of celebration and a call to worship. The Psalmist invites the people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to sing joyfully to God, emphasizing the importance of worship and music.
