When God gives a gift to a man of wealth and possessions and the ability to enjoy them, he should be happy with what he has. Such a man doesn't reflect regretfully on his life, because God keeps him occupied with gladness.

It is evil when God gives a man wealth, possessions, and honor only to have God give those gifts to a stranger to enjoy. No matter how prosperous a man is during his life, if he does not have enjoyment in his final days and a proper burial, than his life is meaningless and a stillborn child is better off than he is. All people go to the same place. A man's appetite is never satisfied. The wise are no better off than the fools. It's better just to observe than to have desires. Everything has been named and known. A weak man can't fight a strong one. The more words, the less meaning. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler>Solomon</jLink></jLink></jLink> asks “who knows what is good for a man in life” when he can't tell what will happen on earth after he dies.

A good name is valuable. Death is better than birth. Sorrow is better than laughter, and sorrow is good for the heart. Mourning and sadness is better than pleasure. It's better to be rebuked than to listen to fools. Extortion and bribery corrupt a person. The end is better than the beginning. Patience is better than pride. Fools are quick to anger. It's not wise to compare the joy of previous days to present ones. Wisdom, like money, is a shelter, and preserves the owner of it. You can't change God's plans. God makes both the good times and the bad. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler>Solomon</jLink></jLink></jLink> has seen a righteous man die for his righteousness and has seen a wicked man live a long life. Therefore, he recommends not being overly righteous, wise, wicked, or foolish, but instead he recommends to use moderation in all of these. A wise man is powerful. Even righteous men sin. Don't have hypocritical standards. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler>Solomon</jLink></jLink></jLink> devoted himself to understand wisdom (meaning God's plans for all that is going on) but could not. He finds deceitful, seductive women worse than death, and only men that please God could escape such women, meanwhile sinners get ensnared by such women. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler>Solomon</jLink></jLink></jLink> found one righteous man out of one thousand men, but no righteous women at all. God made men righteous, but men began scheming.

A wise man is different than others in his demeanor. Yield to the king's supreme power. No man knows the future or the time of his death. Wickedness will not release those that practice wicked behavior. The wicked lords will die too. Untimely justice encourages sin. God will treat God-fearing men better than wicked men. Sometimes, without meaning, the righteous get the reward of the wicked and the wicked get the reward of the righteous. The best a man can do is enjoy his food, his drink, and be happy in the few days God has given him. No one can understand God's plans.

The righteous and the wise are in God's hands and God will do as he pleases. The righteous and the evil both will die. Having the same destiny for both the righteous and the evil is evil. The living know they will die. The dead know nothing and have no further reward. The dead are forgotten. Eat and drink wine and be happy, because it is now that God favors you. Enjoy your wife and your work all of your meaningless days, because there is nothing for you after you die. Timing and chance play a large role in outcomes. Nobody knows when they will die. The wise can overpower kings, even though they will be forgotten.

A little bit of foolishness can ruin everything. Stay in your post if the ruler is angry with you. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler>Solomon</jLink></jLink></jLink> has seen evil rulers appoint fools to high places and the rich to low places. There are hazards associated with what you do. Skill and strength can make use of a dull ax. A snake that bites the charmer provides no profit for the charmer. The wise are gracious, while fools condemn themselves with their words. Woe to lands ruled by former children or servants, whose princes feast in the morning. Blessed are lands ruled by kings of noble birth, whose princes feast at proper times. A lazy man lets his house deteriorate. A feast is for laughing and wine is for happiness, “but money is the answer for everything.” Be careful about what you say.

Be generous and you will find generosity returned to you. Give to many, because you don't know the future. What will happen will happen. Do what needs to be done when it needs to be done despite the surrounding circumstances. Nobody can understand God's plans. Work at several different things to ensure your success. Enjoy your meaningless life, but know that God will judge you. Banish anxiety, because it's all meaningless.

Remember God before you become cynical and die. When you die, you will become dust again and your spirit will return to God. Everything is meaningless. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler>Solomon</jLink></jLink></jLink> was a wise teacher who wrote down many proverbs. His words were perfect and righteous. Keep the commandments of God, for God will judge every deed.
A thoroughly suntanned woman goes looking for her lover. They exchange dialog, emphasizing their attraction to one another.
The woman advises to let love come naturally, and marvels at her lover's traveling prowess. It is springtime.

The woman looked all over for her lover. When she found him, she brought him to her mother's house. She advises again to let love come naturally. Then she admires as King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler>Solomon</jLink></jLink></jLink> approaches wearing the crown given to him on the day of his marriage by his mother.
The lover poetically describes his woman with many metaphors of love all night long. The woman responds by inviting her lover to partake of her “choice fruits”.

The woman sleeps and dreams that her lover is coming back, but when she wakes up she finds him gone. She goes out in the night to find her lover, and the night watchmen beat her until she bruised and they took her cloak. She solicits her friends for help. Her friends ask her why is her lover better than any other man. She poetically describes her lover with many metaphors.

Her friends ask where her lover went. She replies that he went to his garden. Her lover poetically describes his woman with many metaphors. Her friends question the lover (the Shulammite). The friends plead for him to come back to the woman.
Her lover poetically describes his woman with many metaphors. The woman suggests they go away to the villages and make love in the vineyards.

The woman laments about jealous onlookers. Then she comments on how strong love is; just as strong as death is. The friends ask the woman what should be done about a girl whose breasts are not yet grown. The woman says that her breast are huge and therefore she brings her lover happiness. She then goes on to talk about renting vineyards. Her lover calls for her, and she calls for him to go away with her.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0531' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0531' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0531' clickHandler>Amoz</jLink></jLink></jLink>, had the following vision concerning <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> during the reigns of the kings of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5818G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5818G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5818G' clickHandler>Uzziah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3147H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3147H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3147H' clickHandler>Jotham</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler>Ahaz</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> says that God says: God has reared up children which rebel against Him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> says that the Israelites are full of evil and will not yield to God despite His attempts to punish them, and now they are physically injured, their country is desolate, and their fields are stripped. If it wasn't for God sparing some of them, they would all be dead. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> says that God says: God has had enough burnt offerings and asks who asked them to make these sacrifices? Stop bringing meaningless sacrifices. God hates their festivals, Sabbaths, and appointed feasts. God will not listen to your prayers. Purify yourself, be righteous, seek justice, and defend the oppressed, orphans, and widows. Though the Israelites are stained with scarlet sins, they will be purified white as snow again and be rewarded if they obey God. But if they don't obey, they will be killed by the sword. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> has become a whore, and everything has been corrupted. God declares that He will purge the evil and restore the judges like in the days before kings, and Zion (<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>) will again be righteous. God will redeem the righteous but will punish the rebels and sinners.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0531' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0531' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0531' clickHandler>Amoz</jLink></jLink></jLink>, had the following vision concerning Judah and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. In the last days, God's mountain temple will be established in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and God will judge, teach, and settle the disputes of many nations, such that swords will be turned to plowshares and there will no longer be any wars. The people of the house of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler>Jacob</jLink></jLink></jLink> are wealthy, have pagan practices, and worship idols, but God will humble them. Hide from the wrath of God. God has a day planned when all arrogant men will be humbled and God alone will be exalted. Idols will disappear on that day. On that day, men will throw away their idols and try to hide from God's wrath. Stop trusting in man.

God is about to remove all food, water, and leaders from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Judah. Children will lead and govern. Neighbors will fight each other. No one will want to rule. This will happen because they have been proud of their sins. The righteous will be rewarded at that time. God will punish the elders and the leaders for creating this evil and oppressing the poor. The Israelite women act and dress seductively, so God will give them sores and make them bald. God will take all of their jewelery. God will make them stinky, bald, branded, and poorly dressed. Men will die in battle.

In that day, women will be so desperate for marriage that seven women will marry one man only for his namesake. The survivors will inherit a beautiful and glorious land and will be called holy after God has purged and cleansed <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> with a spirit of judgement and a spirit of fire. Then God will make a canopy of smoke by day and fire by night to protect the land.

In a vineyard metaphor, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> says that God set up <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> in the best country using the best people to start things off. However, the result has been bad, so God will destroy it. God will punish wealthy landowners by making their crop production drop. Woe to the drunkards. The Israelites have parties without respect to God, so they will be sent into exile and many will die in the process. Mankind will be humbled, God will be exalted by His justice, and sheep will feed in the ruins. Woe to those that seek a quick resolution of God's plan, to those that deceive, to the arrogant wise, to drunkards, to those that take bribes and deny justice. God will punish the Israelites with deadly earthquakes until bodies litter the streets, and He has called other nations to attack them, and these nations are on their way. God will see to it that the other nations are successful in attacking the Israelites.

In the year that King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5818G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5818G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5818G' clickHandler>Uzziah</jLink></jLink></jLink> died, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> had a vision of God on a throne in a temple with six-winged seraphs flying above Him. They hid their faces with two wings, hid their feet with two wings, and flew with the last pair of wings. They praised God, and the Temple filled with smoke. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> feared that he was guilty, but a seraph touched <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s mouth with a hot coal and told him that his guilt was taken away and his sin was atoned. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the Israelites to hear but not understand, see but not perceive, make them calloused and stubborn so that they will not change their minds and thus be healed. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked how long should this happen. God replies until the land is destroyed, but a tenth of the population will remain there and as a holy seed.

When <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler>Ahaz</jLink></jLink></jLink> was king of Judah, Aram allied with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to attack Judah. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler>Ahaz</jLink></jLink></jLink> that Aram and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will not be successful in conquering Judah. God (implicitly) tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to ask <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler>Ahaz</jLink></jLink></jLink> what sign he would like from God as proof that he will not be conquered. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler>Ahaz</jLink></jLink></jLink> rejects the question, not wanting to test God. (Implicitly) God angrily responds through <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler>Ahaz</jLink></jLink></jLink> is trying God's patience, and God will give them a sign: that a virgin (literally “a young woman”) will give birth to a son called Immanuel (God with us). Immanuel will eat curds and honey until he knows right from wrong. But before the boy is that mature, the two attacking kings will be laid to waste. God will then bring the king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink> to invade Judah. God will fill the land with Egyptian flies and Assyrian bees. The Assyrian king will shave them. Cows and goats will produce a lot of milk, so the people will eat curds and honey. God will fill the vineyards and fields with briers and thorns so that they will be afraid to farm there.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to write on a scroll “quick to the plunder swift to the spoils”. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> has sex with a prophetess who bears a son, and God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to name him quick to the plunder swift to the spoils, and that before the boy can talk <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler>Damascus</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be plundered by the king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> that because the people of Aram have rejected Shiloah, God will bring the king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink> against them and they will not be able to do anything about it because God [is] with us. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to fear and dread Him, and He will be a Sanctuary. But for the Israelites, God will be a stone that trips them and a snare that traps them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> says that he will trust God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> says that those who do not consult with God will see only distress, darkness, and gloom.

But there will be an end to the dimness for the anguished; the lands of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler>Zebulun</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler>Naphtali</jLink></jLink></jLink> who were lightly afflicted and afterward heavily punished by Gentiles from across the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink> River and beyond <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler>Galilee</jLink></jLink></jLink>. (Alternate Translation: But there will be an end to the dimness for the anguished. In the future, God will honor the Gentiles beyond <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler>Galilee</jLink></jLink></jLink> and across the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink> River.) People in darkness have seen a great light. You (which is not defined as to who this is) have made the nation bigger, increased joy, and lifted peoples burdens. War-bloodied clothing will be burnt. A son is born who will rule and be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace. His peace and government will know no end, and he will rule from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s throne in justice and righteousness forever. God is angry with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> for their pride and arrogance, and will have them conquered in a single day. God will not pity orphans or widows because everybody in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> is wicked. God will scorch the land, incite brother to fight against brother, and bring them to cannibalism.

Woe to the unjust and the oppressors, they will see a day of reckoning where they will cower or die. Woe to the king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God sent him to conquer Judah, but he will be punished for thinking that it is through his strength that he has done this. God will punish his soldiers with disease, and the “Light of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>” will destroy his nation in a single day. In that day, the Israelite remnants will return to Mighty God. God tells the remnant that very soon His wrath will end against them and will turn to the Assyrians and will destroy them.

A man will come from the family of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3448' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3448' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3448' clickHandler>Jesse</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and the spirit of God will be with that man. He will be righteous and wise, have delight in and fear of God, and will speak condemning, righteous justice. Weak animals will live peacefully with strong animals, and carnivores will become vegetarians. All the earth will know God. All nations will rally behind this “root of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3448' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3448' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3448' clickHandler>Jesse</jLink></jLink></jLink>”, and God will gather the remnant Israelites back from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler>Cush</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler>Elam</jLink></jLink></jLink>, Baylonia, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2574G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2574G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2574G' clickHandler>Hamath</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the islands, and all the earth. The people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the people of Judah again will be at peace making a unified Israelite nation. They will capture <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler>Moab</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and the Ammonites. God will dry up the Egyptian sea and break the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler>Euphrates</jLink></jLink></jLink> into seven shallow streams, and create a path for the Israelites.
When that day comes, people will praise God, calling him their salvation. They will give thanks to God, and will make known to other nations what He has done.

This is a prophesy for <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> as seen by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God is bringing massive armies from far away against <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> to destroy the country. They will attack on the day of God to enact His wrath. People will be terrorized and writhe in pain. The day of God will be cruel with wrath and anger, destroying sinners. There will be no light from the stars, the sun, or the moon. God will punish the world for their wicked sins and put an end to haughty arrogance and ruthless pride. Afterwards, mankind's population will be scarce. Heaven and earth will shake. People will flee to their homelands. Anyone caught will be killed, their children will be killed, and their wives will be raped. God will send the Medes to make this merciless attack on <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> will never again be inhabited except by wild animals. The time for this is soon.

God will bring the Israelites back to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and they will rule over other nations and their former oppressors. They are to taunt the king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> after this happens. God has conquered the wicked and the land is at peace. The dead will mock the newly killed king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> had arrogant ambitions but is now brought down to common death. Onlookers wonder at <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s fall. The king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> will not be buried in his nation because there will be no nation left. Slaughter the king's sons for the sins of their forefathers so that they will have no inheritance. God will utterly destroy Babylonian nation and turn it into an owl-filled swamp. God, according to His plan for the whole world, will crush the Assyrians for oppressing his people, and nobody can stop Him. Below is a prophesy as seen by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> in the year that King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler>Ahaz</jLink></jLink></jLink> died. God will inflict plague on the Philistines and have the Israelites attack them.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> gets a prophecy that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler>Moab</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be destroyed in one night, their people will flee, the vegetation will be gone, and their wealth will be plundered. A lion will attack their fugitives and remnants.

Send tribute to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Hide the Moabite fugitives until God has stopped destroying them. In <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the throne will be established in love, faithfulness, justice, and righteousness by someone of Davidic lineage. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler>Moab</jLink></jLink></jLink> was prideful, so they will wail and grieve. Their crops will be ruined, and nobody will be shouting for joy at the harvest. This will happen within three years.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> gets a prophecy that <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler>Damascus</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be destroyed. The fortified city of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> will disappear. Aram will be reduced to a remnant like the Israelites that broke from Judah. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler>Jacob</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be reduced to a remnant too. Then people will turn to God and turn away from idols, and their fortified cities will be abandoned. They have forgotten the Savior, the Rock, God, so God will destroy their harvest and give them disease and pain. Many nations will be destroyed in a single night.

Woe to the Cushites (roughly modern-day Sudan). Everyone on earth will see God's banner raised in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and will hear His trumpet. The Cushites will be mostly destroyed, and then they will give tribute to God in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> gets a prophecy that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be destroyed. God will make the Egyptians fight amongst themselves, make all their plans fail, be ruled by a fiercely cruel king, and experience a drought so bad that the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler>Nile</jLink></jLink></jLink> will dry up and all of the crops will be destroyed. Additionally God will make all of the Egyptian leaders and wise men fools. The Egyptians will cower like women at the mention of Judah because of what God has planned for them. At that time five Egyptian cities will speak the Canaanite language and swear allegiance to God. At that time there will be an altar to God put in the heart of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and a monument to God put at its border. When the Egyptians cry out to God, He will send them a Savior. The Egyptians will sacrifice to God. God will attack them with a plague and then heal them. At that time, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and the Assyrians will all worship God together and be a blessing to the earth.

In the year that <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink> captured the city of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0795' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0795' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0795' clickHandler>Ashdod</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> got naked for three years and prophesied that the king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink> would defeat <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the Cushites, and lead their captives away naked.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> gets a prophecy that <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be destroyed by the Medes and Elamites. By the time the Babylonians realize what is happening, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> will have fallen. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> gets a prophecy that night is coming for the Edomites. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> gets a prophecy that within one year the Kedarites will be reduced to a remnant.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> gets a prophecy about <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the Valley of Vision. God is wondering why there is so much commotion when they were captured without bloodshed and their leaders were taken away. God has a day of terror planned for <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> brought on by the Elamites and the Medes. The Israelites changed <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> in the process of trying to rebuild its defences without consideration that God had designed <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God had made <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> to become captured to provoke repentance, but instead the Israelites had a party because they thought they would die the next day. For as long as they live this sin will not be atoned for. The king's steward, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7644' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7644' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7644' clickHandler>Shebna</jLink></jLink></jLink>, is going to be sent to a foreign country and disgraced. God will make <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0471G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0471G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0471G' clickHandler>Eliakim</jLink></jLink></jLink>, son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2518G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2518G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2518G' clickHandler>Hilkiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, take <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7644' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7644' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7644' clickHandler>Shebna</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s place and give him great honor and athority. What <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0471G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0471G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0471G' clickHandler>Eliakim</jLink></jLink></jLink> opens, nobody can shut, and what he shuts nobody can open.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> gets a prophecy that <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be destroyed. Everyone will be amazed at its destruction. This is part of God's plan to humble all renowned men. The destruction will spread to all of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G5403' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G5403' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G5403' clickHandler>Phoenicia</jLink></jLink></jLink>, just like what happened to the Babylonians. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink> will remained destroyed for seventy years. Then it will be like a prostitute to all nations, and all of it's profits will be given to God's people.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> gets a prophecy that all of the earth will be destroyed, its surface will be ruined and people will be scattered. The earth will be completely plundered and dry up. Because people defile the earth by breaking laws and “the everlasting covenant”, God will curse the earth, burning people until there is only a remnant left. Nobody will be cheerful or happy. The city will be ruined. The remnant will joyfully praise God. For the others, there will be no escape from God's wrath. The earth will fracture and shake violently, and mankind will never recover. At that time God will punish the mighty in Heaven and on earth, binding them in prison and punishing them for many days, and God will rule the earth gloriously from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> praises God for doing what He had planned. God destroyed fortified cities. Because God showed His power, all people will honor God. In <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> God will prepare a feast for everybody, with the best meat and wine. From <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, God will set up a one world government. God will end death forever, stop people from crying, and make the Israelites proud again. The Israelites which trusted God will rejoice in His salvation. But God will destroy the Moabites.

At that time people in Judah will sing a song saying: <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> is fortified by God's salvation. Trust in God and have peace. God humbles mighty men. We follow God's laws and seek Him. People learn righteousness when God judges the earth, but the wicked do not learn their lesson. Let God's fire burn the wicked. We don't honor our past kings, we only honor God as our king. The dead kings are punished and wiped from our memory. God has made His/our nation become (or instead “become honored in” according to a more literal interpretation) the whole world. We have worked in pain like a pregnant woman, but have have not really produced anything substantial, such as salvation or life. (As best as I can discern studying the different translations of the Bible, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> 26:19-21 could be interpreted essentially two different ways. Both are included here, numbered 1 and 2. I favor 1 because of how the reanimated dead are supposed to shout for joy [in the sense that the sins against them will finally be punished] and the earth is supposed to be a witness of their blood, but most scholars probably favor 2 because of the closer tie in with the final judgement of Christian theology.) {1} We should hide indoors for a little while, because God will resurrect those which had their blood wrongfully shed and take vengeance on those of whom are responsible. {2} All of the dead will live again. We should hide indoors for a little while, because God will unleash His wrath on all of the sinners.

At that time, God will punish with His sword. He will slay Leviathan, a sea monster. In a garden metaphor, God stewards and guards the Israelites. God will battle enemies but will accept the peaceful in peace. The Israelites will fill the earth with their fruit. God has punished the Israelites, but not as severely as He has punished those people which attacked the Israelites. The Israelites' sin will be removed when all of the idol altars are destroyed and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> is abandoned and destroyed. God will show them no mercy because they do not obey Him. At that time, God will gather the exiled Israelites and return them to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> where they will worship God.

God will punish the Israelites which broke off from Judah, symbolized as Ephriam. At that time, God will be glorious to His remnant of people. Ephriam's priests are corrupt and distort God's teachings. Therefore God will have foreigners speak to the people because they would not listen to Him. God will let them continue in their evil so that they will be ensnared and punished. God tells the leaders of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, who have made covenants with idols for protection, that He has set down the foundation of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> such that it will have justice and righteousness. Therefore, those which trust in idols will find no protection from the coming destruction. This is part of God's plan, just like you have to plow, sow, reap, and grind the grain to make bread.

God says that He will bring enemies to besiege <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and humble the city. Then, instantly God will destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s enemies with earthquakes, storms, and fire. The Israelites should be in awe by this. God has stopped giving the Israelites prophets and seers. Nobody will be able to interpret this prophesy. This is because the Israelites say they honor God but do not in their hearts, and they follow men's rules instead of God's rules. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> God will humble the wise and intelligent. Nobody can hide what they do from God. Nobody has the right to question God. Shorty the known world will be changed. At that time the Israelites will understand this prophesy and will worship God. All of the evil people will be killed. The Israelites will be proud again, worshiping God in His awesomeness. Wayward people will then understand and follow God.

God is angry that Judah as made an alliance with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> without consulting God, and therefore will disgrace them by making the alliance ineffective. God calls <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> an arrogant do-nothing. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to write it down as witness forever. The Israelites will not follow God and choose not to listen to His prophets. Therefore, God will shatter their nation. God told them to rest and repent for salvation, that quietness and trust was their strength, but they would not listen. Instead they have chosen to flee, so God will scatter them until they are defenceless. But God wants to show them grace, and blessed are those that wait for God. When <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> cries for help, God will be quick to help them. God will guide them, and they will discard their idols. God will bless their crops and livestock. At that time they will have plentiful rivers and extra-bright daylight and moonlight. God is full of wrath, and He destroys nations and leads them astray. The Israelites will rejoice in God. Men will hear God's voice and see Him unleash His wrath in fire, thunderstorms, and hail. While making music, God will destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink> in the valley of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8612' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8612' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8612' clickHandler>Topheth</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

God is angry at the people of Judah for making an alliance with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> instead of seeking God's help. God will make both <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Judah fall. Like a brave lion, God will fight in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and protect it. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> pleads for the Israelites to return to God, and at that time they will reject their idols. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink> will fall by the sword of God, not of man, and their young men will become slaves.

God will make a righteous king rule. Then the people will be able to see and understand God clearly. Then the fools, and those which lie concerning God, and evil people will be exposed for what they are, but noble people will persevere. God tells the women that although they feel secure now, in a little more than a year God will bring about this Apocalypse, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be laid to waste. This will continue until God sends His Spirit which will restore the land of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and provide peace and righteousness forever for the Israelites.

The destroyer will be destroyed and the betrayer will be betrayed. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> asks God to be gracious to the Israelites. People flee from the voice of God. God will fill <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> with righteousness and will provide salvation if people fear Him. When people are distressed from the destruction of their cities, then God will appear and be exalted. Mankind has produced nothing worthwhile and they speak evil, so they will be burned. Those far away should take heed and those near God should acknowledge His power. God scares the Godless. Then the righteous will dwell in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> with God, where God will supply bread and water without fail. Those then in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> will observe a beautiful king and vast nation, and will wonder what has become of the leaders from before the destruction. They will never again be ruled by foreigners. At that time <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be established forever, ruled by God, and full of wealth. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s inhabitants will never be sick and will be forgiven of their sins.

God is angry at all of the nations and will totally destroy them. The heavens will be rolled up like a scroll. After God destroys the heavens, He will destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God's sword is covered with lamb and goat blood and the fat of ram kidneys. God will totally destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink> as vengeance for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be desolate, and nobody will ever pass through there again. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink> will become a place inhabited by only wild animals, each with their mate per God's scroll. God distributes all things, and gives <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink> to the wild animals forever.

The desert will become a glorious place. God will come with vengeance to save the Israelites. Then the blind will see, the deaf will hear, the lame will jump, and the mute will speak. At that time deserts will become lush lands. At that time there will be a highway called the “Way of Holiness”. Only holy people redeemed by God will be able to use the highway to return to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. They will return with everlasting joy and happiness, and will not have sorrow.

In King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s fourteenth year of reigning Judah, the king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler>Sennacherib</jLink></jLink></jLink>, captured all of the cities of Judah and then besieged <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The Assyrian army's commander spoke to leaders of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0471G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0471G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0471G' clickHandler>Eliakim</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7644' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7644' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7644' clickHandler>Shebna</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3098G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3098G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3098G' clickHandler>Joah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and mocked them for putting up resistance. He mocked them depending on <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> for support, and mocked them for depending on God for support when it was God Himself that told them to attack and destroy Judah. He tells them to bargain for peace. The leaders of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> told the Assyrian army commander to speak in Aramaic instead of Hebrew so that the other Israelites would not understand. However, the Assyrian army commander continued in Hebrew and spoke specifically to the other Israelites, telling them that they will have to eat and drink their own feces and urine if they don't surrender. He tells them not to believe what <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells them. He tells them that if they surrender, they will be treated well. He tells them not to believe that God can save them, because the gods of other countries were not able to save those countries from being captured. The leaders of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> what the commander said. (Cross-reference 2 Kings 18)

Upon hearing the message, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> donned sackcloth and consulted with the prophet <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells him not to worry because <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler>Sennacherib</jLink></jLink></jLink> has blasphemed and therefore God will cause him to return to his own country and be killed. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler>Sennacherib</jLink></jLink></jLink> hears that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8640' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8640' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8640' clickHandler>Tirhakah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the Cushite king of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, is marching against him, so he sends another taunting message to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. When <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> gets the letter he prays to God, who is enthroned between the cherubim, to deliver them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> prophesies a message for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler>Sennacherib</jLink></jLink></jLink> that, while he has conquered much of the land, it is because God planned it that way. God says that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> will eat from the wild foods for 2 years, but in 3 years he will be back to sowing and reaping. God says that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler>Sennacherib</jLink></jLink></jLink> will not enter or siege <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> because God will defend it for His sake and the sake of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>. That night an angel of God killed 185000 of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler>Sennacherib</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s men, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler>Sennacherib</jLink></jLink></jLink> withdrew. One day while he was praying to his god, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler>Sennacherib</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s sons killed him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5576' clickHandler>Sennacherib</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s son <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0634' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0634' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0634' clickHandler>Esarhaddon</jLink></jLink></jLink> succeeded him. (Cross-reference 2 Kings 19)

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> became ill with a boil near the point of death. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells him that God says that he will die. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> prays to God to remember how righteous he has been and he wept. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> told him that because of his prayer and tears, God will heal him, and when he goes up to the Temple 3 days from now, God will add 15 years to his life. Furthermore, God will deliver Judah from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> had God move a shadow back ten steps on a stairway as a sign. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> wrote a poem about his illness and recovery saying that God will kill him and he will not see God again “in the land of the living”, that like a lion God broke all his bones and because God has said that he will die there is nothing he can do but submit to God's will. He goes on to say God saved him and healed him, saying that it must have been for his benefit that God made him suffer. He says that God forgave all of his sins. He says the dead can't praise God once they are dead, but the living praise God, as he is doing today. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> had a poultice of figs put on <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s boil to heal it. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> had asked for a sign that God will do what He promises. (Cross-reference 2 Kings 20)

The king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> sent messengers with gifts to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> because he heard that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> was ill. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> showed the messengers all of the treasures of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> asks <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> what he had shown the messengers, to which <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied truthfully. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> says God says that a time will come when all these treasures will be carried off to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> and sons of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s lineage will be made eunuchs for the palace of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> said God's word is good because he was happy that there would be peace during his lifetime. (Cross-reference 2 Kings 20)

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to comfort <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, to tell them that they have paid for their sins twice over. “A voice” (which appears to be God) cries out to prepare a path for God by filling valleys, leveling mountains, etc. God's glory will be revealed and all of mankind will see it. “A voice” tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the people that they are like grass which God kills with His breath, but God's word stands forever. God commands <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to shout that God is coming to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and He is coming with power and rewards. Like a shepherd, God gathers His sheep. Who is like God in His knowledge? The world is nothing compared to God. Idols are just man made objects which will not last. God sits above the circle of the earth and to him people are minuscule. At God's will, He destroys mighty men. God created the heavens by His power. God lasts forever; tireless and wiser than anyone. People who hope in God will be strengthened by Him and will not grow weary.

God tells the nations to strengthen themselves and then meet with God at the place of judgement.
