Now is the time when the leaders should weep, because God is going to destroy them in His fierce anger.

Early in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler>Jehoiakim</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s reign, God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to give a prophesy in the courtyard of the Temple and so that maybe the Israelites would listen to God so that He would not have to destroy them as He was planning to do. The priests and prophets seized <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> and threatened to kill him after he gave the prophesy. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that God gave him the prophesy and if they do not listen to God then God will destroy them, and they can do whatever they think is right to him. The officials said that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> should not be killed because he gave a prophesy from God. The elders pointed out that because <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> then repented, God did not bring that disaster on them. Therefore, if they do not listen to God they will be destroyed. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0223B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0223B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0223B' clickHandler>Uriah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8098X' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8098X' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8098X' clickHandler>Shemaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> from Kiriath Jearim had earlier prophesied the same thing as <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, so king <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler>Jehoiakim</jLink></jLink></jLink> tried to kill <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0223B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0223B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0223B' clickHandler>Uriah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0223B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0223B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0223B' clickHandler>Uriah</jLink></jLink></jLink> fled to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler>Jehoiakim</jLink></jLink></jLink> had him hunted down, brought back to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and killed. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0296' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0296' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0296' clickHandler>Ahikam</jLink></jLink></jLink> helped protect <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to put himself in a homemade yoke and declare to envoys from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler>Moab</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler>Ammon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler>Sidon</jLink></jLink></jLink> that God created the earth, its people, and its animals, and will give them all to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Then sometime later, God will have many nations subjugate <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>. That same year, the fourth year in the reign of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink>, bring the exiled Israelites back, and the Temple furnishings back within two years. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that he hopes <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler>Hananiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> is correct, but that a prophet who prophesies peace is only from God if his predictions come true. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler>Hananiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> took the yoke off of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, broke it, and proclaimed again that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> God also said that He would kill <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler>Hananiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> within that same year for preaching rebellion against God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2608A' clickHandler>Hananiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> died two months later.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> wrote a letter to the Israelites who were first put into Babylonian exile while under king <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3078' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3078' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3078' clickHandler>Jehoiachin</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The letter stated: Build a life in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> and have lots of children. Do not listen to prophets who tell you anything different. After 70 years, God will come back for them and keep His promise. When they seek God with all their heart, they will find Him. God will bring all of the exiled Israelites back to their homeland. God will punish and destroy those now in the kingdom of Judah, and make any who are exiled from there objects of scorn because they have not listened to God. The exiled Israelites in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> have not listened either. clickHandler>Ahab</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Zedekiah burned to death by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink> because of their false prophesies and because they are adulterers. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8098Y' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> for this letter. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6846G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6846G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6846G' clickHandler>Zephaniah</jLink></jLink></jLink> informed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> of this request. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8098Y' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8098Y' clickHandler>Shemaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> and his descendants, killing them all.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to write God's message in a book because the days are coming when He will bring back the exiled Israelites. In an awful day everybody will be afraid, but God will free the Israelites from bondage to foreigners. They will serve God and king <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> whom God will raise. God will completely destroy the nations to which they have been scattered. The Israelites will be punished too, but with justice. God has punished them cruelly like an enemy because of their great and many sins. However, God will heal their wounds and take revenge on their enemies. God will restore the Promised Land and give the Israelites numbers of offspring which will never be decreased and honor which will not be taken away. God will punish their oppressors. It will be like the old times when God was in the Temple. Their leader will rise from among them and be close to God. God's wrath will not be turned back until He accomplishes His plan.

Then God will be over all of the clans of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God will give aid to those who were not previously killed. God has loved the Israelites with an everlasting love and kindness. God will restore <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to being a joyful state. God will return the exiled Israelites, including the blind, the lame, and the pregnant. God will protect the Israelites. They will be prosperous and have no more sorrow. In Ramah, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7354' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7354' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7354' clickHandler>Rachel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will cry because her children were killed, but God says to refrain from weeping because their work will be rewarded. They will return from their exile. The Israelites recognize that the punishment is for their sins, and they repent. Therefore God has compassion on them and calls them back from exile. God will create a new thing: a woman will surround a man. God will restore the land of Judah. Just like God oversaw their destruction, God will oversee their restoration. No longer will people say children are punished for their father's sins. Instead, everyone will die or be punished for his own sin. God will make a new covenant with the Israelites, putting His law in their mind and hearts. Then they will all know God, and He will forgive their wickedness and no longer remember their sins. Only if the sun, moon and stars stop shining and the ocean becomes still will the nation of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> cease to exist. Only if the heavens are measured and the foundation of earth is found will God reject all of the Israelites. The days are coming when <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be rebuilt for God and will never again be uprooted or demolished.

In the tenth year of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s reign, the eighteenth year of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s reign, the Babylonian army was besieging <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> was confined in the guards' courtyard in the royal palace. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> asks <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> why he is prophesying that the Babylonians will capture him and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells him that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s cousin <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2601' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2601' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2601' clickHandler>Hanamel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will tell <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to buy a field in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6068G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6068G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6068G' clickHandler>Anathoth</jLink></jLink></jLink> for him. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2601' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2601' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2601' clickHandler>Hanamel</jLink></jLink></jLink> came in and did just that. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> bought the field for 17 shekels of silver. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells them to seal the deed in a clay jar, because God says in the future the Israelites will be back in this land. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> prayed to God, saying that God made everything, nothing is too hard for Him, He loves thousands but punishes children for their fathers' sins, He is mighty, He rewards everyone according to their conduct, He performs signs and wonders to this day, and He brought the Israelites out of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> with great terror and into the Promised Land, but the Israelites have not listened to Him, so God brought this destruction to them. Just like God said would happen, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> is being destroyed by sword, famine, and plague. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> has bought the field per God's instructions. God then told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>: Nothing is too hard for God. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be taken and destroyed where they worshiped other gods by the Babylonians. The people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Judah have done nothing but evil since their youth. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> transgressed God since it was built and so God will destroy it. The people of Judah have worshiped idols and other gods, and sacrificed their sons and daughters to Molech. God is destroying <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but in the future He will gather them back from the lands where He had banished them and let them live in safety. He will be their God, and will give them a focus on God so that they will always fear Him for their own good and for their children after them. This will be an everlasting covenant, and God will always do good for them and inspire fear in them so that they will not turn away from Him. God will plant them in the land with all of His heart and soul. Just as God has brought destruction, God will bring them back as promised. Once again land will be bought with silver. God will make them prosperous again.

While <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> was still in the courtyard, God said to him: God, who made everything, says that call to Him, and He will answer and tell you unknown things. The houses of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be filled with the dead bodies of those slain in His wrath. However, God will heal <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and bring back the exiled Israelites from captivity. God will forgive all of their sins. All of the other nations will be in awe and fear of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> because of the renown, joy, praise, honor, prosperity, and peace it experiences due to God. Although Judah will become desolate, God will restore it to its former glory and people will make thank offerings to God there. The days are coming when God will keep His promise to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Judah and will make a righteous branch of the Davidic lineage rule in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. In those days Judah will be saved and will be safe. It/He will be called “the LORD Our Righteousness”. From then on, there will forever be a king of Davidic lineage ruling and the Levites will forever offer burnt offerings, burnt grain offerings, and sacrifices. Only if the day and the night stop coming will this covenant be broken. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s descendants and the Levites will become innumerable. As surely as the day and the night, God will restore the Israelites.

When the Babylonian army was besieging <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3923' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3923' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3923' clickHandler>Lachish</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5825' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5825' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5825' clickHandler>Azekah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell king <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> that God will give <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> to the Babylonians and that he would be brought to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> where he will die peacefully. King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> made a covenant with the people in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> to free their Hebrew slaves, which they did, but then changed their minds and enslaved them again. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the people that in His covenant with the Israelites, they were to free their Hebrew slaves after six years of service, but their fathers ignored this commandment. Recently they repented and freed the Hebrew slaves, but then changed their minds. Because they have done this sin, God will “free” them to be killed by sword, plague, and famine. God will bring back the Babylonian army to destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be given to the Babylonian army.

When <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler>Jehoiakim</jLink></jLink></jLink> was ruling Judah, God told Jeremiah to invite the Recabite family over for some wine. Jeremiah invites <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2970G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2970G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2970G' clickHandler>Jaazaniah</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the rest of the Recabites over and offers them wine. They refuse, saying that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3082G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3082G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3082G' clickHandler>Jonadab</jLink></jLink></jLink> commanded them to never drink wine, build houses, sow seeds, or plant vineyards in order to live long. God tells Jeremiah to tell the people of Judah that the Recabites have obeyed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3082G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3082G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3082G' clickHandler>Jonadab</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s since it was given, but the people of Judah have not obeyed God. Therefore, God will bring on the destruction of Judah, but there will never fail to be a man of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3082G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3082G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3082G' clickHandler>Jonadab</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s lineage to serve God.

In the fourth year of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler>Jehoiakim</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s reign, God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to write down His plans for the destruction of Judah so that maybe the people would repent. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> dictates God's word to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler>Baruch</jLink></jLink></jLink> while he records it on a scroll. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler>Baruch</jLink></jLink></jLink> to read the scroll to the people in the Temple on a national day of fasting so that maybe they will repent. In the fifth year on the ninth month, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler>Baruch</jLink></jLink></jLink> read the scroll to everybody in the Temple. Upon hearing the scroll, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4321H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4321H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4321H' clickHandler>Micaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> relayed the message to the secretaries and other officials in the palace. They sent <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3065' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3065' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3065' clickHandler>Jehudi</jLink></jLink></jLink> to bring <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler>Baruch</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the scroll to them, and then had <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler>Baruch</jLink></jLink></jLink> read it to them. The officials tell <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler>Baruch</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to hide, and then eventually have the scroll read to the king by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3065' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3065' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3065' clickHandler>Jehudi</jLink></jLink></jLink>. King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler>Jehoiakim</jLink></jLink></jLink> burnt parts of the scroll after it was read until the entire scroll was burnt. None of the royalty showed fear or tore their clothes. The king tried to arrest <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler>Baruch</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but they could not be found because God had hidden them. God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to write another scroll just like the first, but to add on that God would severely punish <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler>Jehoiakim</jLink></jLink></jLink>, his children, and attendants for what he did, and he would not have a descendant on the throne of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> dictated another scroll to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler>Baruch</jLink></jLink></jLink> and added many similar words.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink> appointed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> as king of Judah. Nobody regarded what <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> had prophesied. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to pray for the people of Judah. (The Babylonians had been besieging <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' God has <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> bury stones in front of the Pharaoh's palace in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8471' clickHandler>Tahpanhes</jLink></jLink></jLink> and announce that God will bring <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink> there, where he will conquer <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and set his throne. In the process, the Babylonians will kill and capture everyone as appropriate, and destroy the temples of the Egyptian gods.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the Jews in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> that <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> was destroyed because the Jews were worshiping other gods. Why are they bringing disaster upon themselves by continuing to worship idols? Because they are worshiping other gods, God will destroy the entire Jewish remnant in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> except for a few fugitives. The Jews responded that they would not listen the <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and would continue worshiping the “Queen of Heaven” because worshiping her seemed to be beneficial in the past. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that God had reached His endurance limit of their pagan worship which caused Him to destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and God swears that He will kill all but a very few of the Jews in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. As a sign of the promise of this threat, God will have the Babylonians capture the Pharaoh <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547R' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547R' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6547R' clickHandler>Hophra</jLink></jLink></jLink> just like He did with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

In the fourth year of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler>Jehoiakim</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s reign, after <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler>Baruch</jLink></jLink></jLink> wrote down what <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> dictated, God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler>Baruch</jLink></jLink></jLink> that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler>Baruch</jLink></jLink></jLink> should not whine about sorrow, because God is about to destroy what He has built. However, God will protect <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1263J' clickHandler>Baruch</jLink></jLink></jLink> wherever he goes.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> to equip for battle and to conquer the land up to around the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler>Euphrates</jLink></jLink></jLink> River. Then they will be sacrificed near the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler>Euphrates</jLink></jLink></jLink> by God because this is a day of vengeance for God. The Babylonians will attack the Egyptian army and lay them to waste. The Babylonians will continue on into <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, conquering it and laying <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5297' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5297' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5297' clickHandler>Memphis</jLink></jLink></jLink> to waste. Before <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> attacked <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler>Gaza</jLink></jLink></jLink>, God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> that the time has come to completely destroy all of the Philistines, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> will do that because God commanded it.

God, the King, reveals that the Moabites will be completely destroyed and laid to waste. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler>Moab</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be drunk and wallow in its vomit. The Moabites had ridiculed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. They have been wicked and worshiped pagan gods. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler>Moab</jLink></jLink></jLink> will become an object of ridicule and will go into deep mourning. God asks why the Ammonites have taken part of the land of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler>Ammon</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be conquered and destroyed, and the people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will drive the Ammonites out of their lands. God swears that <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1224G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1224G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1224G' clickHandler>Bozrah</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be in ruins forever. God will have the Babylonians destroy <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6938' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6938' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6938' clickHandler>Kedar</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Hazor. Hazor will be forever desolate. Early in the reign of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> that <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler>Elam</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be destroyed, and the exiled people of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler>Elam</jLink></jLink></jLink> will go to every single nation on earth. God will set His throne in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler>Elam</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Eventually, God will restore <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler>Elam</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

God says that <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be captured by a nation from the north, and that it will become desolate. The Israelites who were exiled to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> will then return to Zion and make an everlasting covenant with God. The Israelites had been led astray and mistreated for their sins. The exiled Israelites are to flee <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> because God is sending an alliance of nations from the north to conquer <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be desolate and scorned because they mistreated the Israelites. God will destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> and lead the exiled Israelites back to their homeland. God will forgive all of the sins of the Israelite remnant. The Israelites are oppressed in their captivity, but God, their Redeemer, is strong enough to defend them. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> and its neighboring towns will never again be inhabited.

God will have <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> completely destroyed because He will take His vengeance owed for the mistreatment of the Israelites. The kings of the Medes will attack <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God made the earth and the heavens, and controls clouds, lightning, and wind. Men know nothing and make worthless idols. God can destroy everything. God is against the mountain of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and will make it desolate forever. The kingdoms of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0780' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0780' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0780' clickHandler>Ararat</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H4508' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H4508' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H4508' clickHandler>Minni</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0813G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0813G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0813G' clickHandler>Ashkenaz</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and the Medes will unite against <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s soldiers will cower like women. The Israelites have called for vengeance against <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God will honor their request and will completely destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God is a God of retribution. God, the King, will make the Babylonian officials, wise men, governors, officers, and soldiers sleep forever and not awake. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> gave this prophesy to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8304N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8304N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8304N' clickHandler>Seraiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> on a scroll when <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8304N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8304N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8304N' clickHandler>Seraiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> was headed to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. He told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8304N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8304N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8304N' clickHandler>Seraiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to read the scroll and pronounce the future desolation of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and then to throw the scroll into the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler>Euphrates</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> was 21 years old when he became the king of Judah, and he reigned 11 years. He did evil in God's eyes which provoked God to have <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> capture Judah. The Babylonian army sieged <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> from the ninth year to the eleventh year of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s reign. On the ninth day of the fourth month, the Babylonians broke through the city wall. That night <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> and all of his soldiers fled. The Babylonians captured them near <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler>Jericho</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink> killed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6667H' clickHandler>Zedekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s sons and nobles, gouged out his eyes, and brought him back to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> where he died in prison. The Babylonian army commander, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5018' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5018' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5018' clickHandler>Nebuzaradan</jLink></jLink></jLink>, captured all except the poorest people in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and burned down the city. He gave the poor people who remained vineyards and fields. The Babylonians pillaged the Temple. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5018' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5018' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5018' clickHandler>Nebuzaradan</jLink></jLink></jLink> captured and took <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8304H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8304H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8304H' clickHandler>Seraiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6846G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6846G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6846G' clickHandler>Zephaniah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, three doorkeepers, an officer, seven advisers, the conscripting secretary, and sixty men of the city to king <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink>, who then executed the captives. In total, 4600 Jews were brought to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>; 3023 in the seventh, 832 in the eighteenth, and 745 in the twenty third year of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s reign. In the thirty-seventh year of exile, when <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0192' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0192' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0192' clickHandler>Evil-Merodach</jLink></jLink></jLink> became king, former king <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3078' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3078' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3078' clickHandler>Jehoiachin</jLink></jLink></jLink> was released from prison and treated with great respect in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0192' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0192' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0192' clickHandler>Evil-Merodach</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> is deserted, the people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> are in exile, and their allies are now enemies. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s splendor is gone, and the enemies of the Israelites laughed at its destruction. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> sinned, and so now it has been defiled by its enemies under God's orchestration. Let the day come when the Israelite's enemies will be treated like <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> has been treated for its sins, as God has said would happen.

God, like an enemy, has destroyed <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Judah. The royalty is exiled, the Law is no more, and prophets no longer hear from God. The remnant survivors are lamenting in destitution. False prophets led to this destruction, and now enemies scorn <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God fulfilled His decreed destruction of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The remnant grieve and repent to God. Who else has God ever decimated like <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> has been decimated?

God has made my life horrible, making me dwell in darkness like those long dead. God ignores my prayers. My life is bitter, and I have been mocked by my own people. Yet I have hope in God's unfailing compassion. God is good to those who hope in Him and seek Him patiently. Let a man strike you in the cheek. God does not shun men forever. Although God brings grief, He will show mercy. God does not willingly bring grief. Both good and bad things come from God. Let us realize that this grief and death comes from our sins, and we must repent to God. I have been hunted down by my enemies, but God hear my cries saved me when I had almost died in a pit. God, you know the wrongdoing of my enemies, so repay them with your wrath.

<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and its people have become worthless. Its parents are cruel to their young like ostriches. Its noble men are brought low. Poverty, drought, and famine waste it away. God has done all of this because of the sin of its prophets and priests. God has scattered the remnant in exile without favor or honor shown to priests and elders. The enemies of the Israelites should rejoice now, because in the future God's wrath will be upon them and the punishment of the Israelites will end.

God, look at how You have disgraced the Israelites. We have lost our land and many men. We are punished for the sins of our fathers. We are in famine and drought, and are subjects to slaves. Enemies all around try to kill us. Our women have been raped. We are forced into heavy labor and are without respect. We have no more joy. Woe, we have sinned. God, why do You forget and forsake us for so long? Or have You utterly rejected us?

When the priest <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0941' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0941' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0941' clickHandler>Buzi</jLink></jLink></jLink>, was 30 years old and near the Kebar River, corresponding with fifth year of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3078' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3078' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3078' clickHandler>Jehoiachin</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s exile, he saw the heavens opened and saw visions of God. He saw a burning windstorm from the north, with glowing metal in the center of the fire which was surrounded by four humanoid creatures. Each creature had four faces and four wings. They had four hands like men but had feet like bronze cows. Each had the face of a man, the face of a lion on the right side, the face of an ox on the left side, and the face of an eagle. Each had two wings spread upward, touching each adjacent creature, and two wings covering their bodies. They followed the spirit without turning as they went. They were illuminated as if on fire and moved quickly like lightening. Beside each creature was a sparkling crystal wheel on the ground. Each of the four wheels had a wheel intersecting them so that they could go in any direction without turning. The wheels were large with rims full of eyes. The wheels moved any way that the creatures did because the creatures spirits were in the wheels. Above the creatures was a ceiling like sparking ice. When the creatures moved, their wings were very loud. A voice came from a Man seated on a sapphire throne above the ceiling. The Man looked like He was on fire from the waste down, and was radiating rainbow light all around Him. This was the likeness of God, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> fell facedown and listened.

God calls <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> “son of man” and tells him to stand up while God speaks to him. The Spirit came into <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and made him stand up. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to be a prophet to the Israelites, to speak God's words whether or not the rebellious Israelites listen, and to not be afraid of them. God tells “son of man” to not rebel like the Israelites, and to eat what God gives him. God then gave <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> a scroll with words of lament, mourning, and woe on both sides.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to eat the scroll and then go speak to the Israelites. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> eats the scroll and it tastes as sweet as honey. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> (a.k.a. “son of man”) to speak God's words to the Israelites. God tells him that if he went to foreign nations, they would listen to him, but the Israelites will not listen to God's words because they are obstinate. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> God will make <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> just as hardened as they are, so he should not be afraid of them. The Spirit lifted <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> while the four creatures made lots of noise with their wings, and God's hand sent <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to Tel Abib, where he sat for seven days overwhelmed. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that he is now the watchman for the Israelites. If <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> does not speak out about a man's sin to which God alerts <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, then the man will die for his sin and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be held accountable for his blood. However, if <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> does speak out, then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> is safe regardless of the man's actions. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to go out to the plain where He will speak to him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> does go, and finds God standing there, so he falls facedown. The Spirit came into <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and made him stand up. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to go back to his house; where the Israelites will tie him up and God will prevent him from speaking for a while. Then God will tell him what to say and he will then be able to speak God's words to whoever will listen.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> (a.k.a. “son of man”) to draw <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> on a clay tablet, then build siege instruments and camps around it, and then to put an iron pan between his face and the tablet to be a sign of the coming siege. Then he is to lie on his left side for 390 days, bearing the sin of the house of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> one day for each year that they have sinned. Next he is to lie on his right side for 40 days, bearing the sin of the house of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> one day for each year they have sinned. God will prevent him from turning until the time is up. While laying on his side for the 390 days, God says <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> should drink water at certain times and eat bread at certain times made of wheat, barley, beans, lentils, millet, and spelt, which is to be baked over burning human feces to symbolize how the Israelites will eat defiled food in their exile. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> protests, saying that he has never defiled himself with unclean food. God allows <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to bake the bread using cow manure instead. God says that <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s food supply will be cut off, forcing them to ration food and waste away.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to shave his head and beard with a sword. Then when his symbolic siege is over, he is to burn a third of the hair plus a few strands in the symbolic city, strike a third of the hair around the city with his sword, scatter a third to the wind (because God will pursue them with a sword), and save just a few hairs in the folds of his garment. God says that <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> is more wicked than the nations around it because they have rebelled against God's laws. Because of this God will punish them, doing what He has never done and will never do again. God will make fathers eat their children and will scatter the survivors because they have defiled the sanctuary with pagan idols and practices. A third will die by plague or famine, a third will die by the sword, and a third will be scattered. Then God will be avenged and His wrath will subside. Then they will know God has spoken. God will make them subject to reproach and will decimate them with famine, plague, beasts, and bloodshed.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against the mountains and lands of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, saying that their people will be killed and their idol worshiping implements will be destroyed. God says that He will spare some Israelites and scatter them among different nations, and they will remember their rebellion and repent, and know that God did not make an empty threat. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to clap his hands, stomp his feet, and proclaim that God will punish the Israelites wherever they are, with sword, famine, or plague, so that they will know that God is God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will become a desolate waste.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that the time has come and the end is near. God will soon repay the Israelites for their sins, punishing them without pity or mercy, and then they will know that God is God. Not one of them will preserve their lives because of their sins. They will die by sword, plague, and famine. Those who survive will be shamed and scattered. Foreigners will pillage <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the Temple. God will bring the most wicked nation to conquer, capture, and humble the Israelites. There will be many calamities and rumors. The Israelites will find no peace. God will punish their sins and judge them by their own standards. Then they will know that God is God.

In the sixth year, sixth month, and the fifth day, while <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> was entertaining some exiled elders of Judah at his house, God, in the form of a fiery glowing man (the same form as in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> 1), grabs <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> by the hair and takes him to a spot between heaven and earth. There, God shows <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> a series of visions of the sins of the Israelites in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> which ranged from bad to worse. God shows <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> an idol at the north outer gate of the Temple, 70 elders plus <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2970H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2970H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2970H' clickHandler>Jaazaniah</jLink></jLink></jLink> son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8227G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8227G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8227G' clickHandler>Shaphan</jLink></jLink></jLink> worshiping idols of unclean animals in the court, women morning the death of the god Tammuz at the north outer gate of the Temple, and about 25 men at the entrance to the Temple worshiping the sun. Because of this and the violence in the land, God will punish them in anger and without pity or mercy, and will not listen to their cries.

God moves from above the cherubim to the Temple threshold and calls in 6 armed guards, and they came with a man dressed in linen with a writing kit.
