God tells the man in linen to put a mark on the forehead of anyone who laments the sins of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and then tells the guards to kill, without pity or mercy, anyone without the marks on their foreheads. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> asks God if He will kill all of the Israelites in His wrath. God answers that He will give them what they deserve. The man in linen returns saying that he is finished his task.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> recognizes that the cherubim are the same creatures he saw in the vision in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> 1 (except that the ox face has been replaced by a cherub face) and that the same wheeled vehicle (now described as “the whirling wheels”) accompanied them. God tells the man in linen to retrieve fiery coals from under the cherubim and to spread them on <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God went to threshold of the Temple. The man went into the Temple and got coals from one of the cherubim. God then goes above the cherubim, and God and the cherubim left the Temple and went to the east outer gate of the Temple.

God takes <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to the east gate of the Temple where the 25 men. Among them are leaders <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2970I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2970I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2970I' clickHandler>Jaazaniah</jLink></jLink></jLink> son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5809I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5809I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5809I' clickHandler>Azzur</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6410J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6410J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6410J' clickHandler>Pelatiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1141R' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1141R' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1141R' clickHandler>Benaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against them, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> relays God's words. God says that He will bring the sword against <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and execute judgement on them because they have not kept God's laws, and have conformed to the nations around them. Pelataiah died while <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> prophesied. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> asks God if He will eliminate the Israelites completely. God replies that although He scattered them among nations, He will gather them back and will give <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> back to them. God will give them a pure heart and a new spirit so that they will obey His laws. They will be God's people, and He will be their God. Then God returned <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to Babylonia and God went up with the cherubim. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> told his fellow exiles everything.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that the Israelites are rebellious, having eyes but not seeing and having ears but not hearing. Therefore, God has <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> act out the coming exile. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the Israelites that he has acted out the coming exile. The prince and a remnant of Israelites who are not killed by sword, plague, or famine will be scattered among the nations where they will learn that God is God. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tremble and shudder while eating and drinking to symbolize the despair the Israelites will have as the land is laid to waste. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the Israelites that God will fulfill these prophesies of wrath in their days, and that God will not delay any longer.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against the other prophets. They have not tried to strengthen <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> for “the battle on the day of the Lord.” Instead they have prophesied lies. Therefore, God will unleash his wrath on them, kill them all, and expose their lies. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against the female mystics who prophesy lies to the Israelites to make a living. They have killed those who should not have died by discouraging the righteous while encouraging people to continue in their sins. They will know that God is God when He frees the Israelites from their deceptions.

Some elders of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> visited <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that they worship idols with their hearts and their actions. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> in an attempt to regain their hearts, God says to tell them to repent, and leave their idols and sinful practices. If anyone in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> worships idols and then asks a prophet about God, God will kill him to make an example of him. If the prophet speaks a prophesy which God entices him to do, then God will kill that prophet too. Then the Israelites will no longer stray from God, and He will be their God. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that when God punishes a country's sins with famine, if <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, or <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0347' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0347' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0347' clickHandler>Job</jLink></jLink></jLink> lived there they could only spare themselves through their righteousness. The same would be the case for wild animal attacks, army invasions, and plagues. Such will be the case with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> when all four of those judgements are applied to it. Yet some will survive, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be consoled by seeing this disaster befall <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that the people of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> are like the wood of a vine, which is not good for anything but fuel for the fire. God will unleash his wrath on them. Even though they have come out of the fire, fire will still consume them. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will know that God is God. The land will become desolate.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the people of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> that their ancestry was in the land of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler>Canaan</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the product of a Amorite father and a Hittite mother. She (meaning <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s ancestors) was abandoned, but God watched over her. When mature, God took her into covenant with Him, and she became His wife in marriage. God bathed, cleaned and adorned her so that her beauty was the envy of other nations. However, she trusted in her beauty and fame, prostituting herself to idols, and even using gifts, which God had provided to her, in her idol worship. She went on to sacrifice children to idols, without respect for what God had done for her. She prostituted herself to Egyptians, Philistines, Assyrians, and Babylonians. Actually, she was worse than a prostitute, because she offered her affections for free, and actively pursued illicit lovers by giving them gifts. Because of all this, God will sentence her to the fate of adulterers and murderers. He will gather all of her ex-lovers to strip her down and destroy her, thereby stopping her prostitution. Then God's jealousy and wrath will turn aside. She is like her mother the Hittite in that she despised her husband and children. Her older sister was <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and her younger sister was <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler>Sodom</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but her sins surpassed her sisters' sins. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler>Sodom</jLink></jLink></jLink> was haughty, “arrogant, overfed and unconcerned” and did detestable things, and had no pity to the poor and needy, so God destroyed them. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> did not do half of the sins she did. She has made <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler>Sodom</jLink></jLink></jLink> appear righteous. God will restore her, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler>Sodom</jLink></jLink></jLink> so that she will be ashamed in all that she has done. God will deal with her as she deserves for breaking the covenant, but He will still remember the covenant and will establish an everlasting covenant with her. When she is ashamed and remembers her ways, and then receives her sisters <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler>Sodom</jLink></jLink></jLink>, then He will give them to her as daughters. God will make atonement for her, and she will never again speak against God because of her humiliation.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the people of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> a parable. A powerful eagle broke off the top of a <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler>Lebanon</jLink></jLink></jLink> cedar tree and then planted it in a city of traders. The eagle also took seed and planted it by water, where it grew into a leafy vine. There was another powerful eagle, and the vine grew its roots and stretched its branches towards that eagle. This vine will not survive. This parable means that <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> carried off <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s king, nobles, and leaders to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, where they made an oath of treaty with the Babylonians. But the king unfaithfully sought help from Pharaoh of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, thereby breaking the oath. Because this king broke the oath, God will ensure that the Egyptians and people of Judah are defeated. God Himself will take the top of a cedar and plant it on a mountain in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. It will become a big, fruit-producing tree where birds of every kind rest in it. The other trees will know that God humbles great trees and prospers little trees.

No longer will the Israelites say that a child is punished for his father's sins. A righteous man who keeps God's laws and decrees will live. A wicked man who does not will die. If the son of a wicked man instead acts righteously, that son will live. Each person is only responsible for their own actions. If a wicked man repents and acts just and right, he will then live and none of his sins will be remembered, and God is pleased if this happens. If a righteous man changes and acts wickedly, he will die and none of his righteousness will be remembered. The house of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> may claim that God is unjust, but it is really they who are unjust. Therefore, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> should repent. Why die? God takes no pleasure in killing the wicked.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s mother was like a lioness who reared a cub which grew up strong and mighty. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> captured one cub, so she reared another mighty cub. Then <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> captured that one. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s mother is like a vine which grew strong and leafy branches, but the vine was uprooted and caught on fire so that no branch was left to make a ruler's scepter.

On the tenth day of the fifth month of the seventh year of Zedekiah's reign, some elders asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to get instructions from God. God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell them that God will offer no guidance to them because of the sins their fathers committed. God had made a covenant with the Israelites to bring them from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> to the Promised Land, but they rebelled and continued worshiping Egyptian idols. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> God punished them in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but then delivered them from their suffering for the sake of God's name. God gave them rules to live by in the desert, but they rebelled. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> God punished them in the desert, but appealed to their children for the sake of God's name. Their children then rebelled. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> God punished them in the desert, but not severely for the sake of God's name. God swore to them in the desert that they would be scattered throughout nations. God then let them do evil so that He could punish them to the point of horror. When God brought them into the Promised Land, they worshiped idols and committed pagan offerings, so God will not give them guidance. God will not let them worship idols, but will gather them together from the scattered nations in wrath into the desert, where face to face, God will judge them. Just like their forefathers coming out of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the unworthy will not enter <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> go ahead and worship idols, but God will force obedience. All of the Israelites will serve God and give Him offerings and sacrifices after He brings them from the scattered nations back into <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Then the Israelites will be shamed by their former actions, when God brings them back to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> in His mercy for His name's sake. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against the southern forest (<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>) that God is about ready to set an all-consuming fire in the forest which everyone will know that God has set. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells God that people say that he is just speaking parables.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against the sanctuary of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, saying that God will draw His sword and cut off the righteous and the wicked, and God will not return His sword to its scabbard. God's sword is sharpened and polished, ready to slay. The slaughter will come on every side, even to the royal lineage. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to set up a signpost where the road forks to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and to Rabbah. The king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> will reach this fork and seek a sign of divination, and God will make the divination choose <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> for attacking. The Israelites will be captured for their guilt. The time has come for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s punishment. God will exalt the low and bring the exalted down. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be ruined and not restored until God gives it to its rightful owner. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the Ammonites that God's sword is drawn against them. God will judge them, and they will be remembered no more.

God asks <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to judge <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and tells him to prophesy against them. Their days of sinfulness are at an end, and they will become an object of scorn. They commit all manners of sins and have forgotten God. God will defile them and scatter them among the nations to prove that God is God. They have all become the dross of metals, so God will gather them into <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and melt them inside the city. The leaders, priests, and people of the city do not obey God's laws, and the prophets lie by giving false visions. God looked for a man to help restore <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but found none. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> God will consume them in His wrath.

God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that two sisters of the same mother became prostitutes. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0170' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0170' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0170' clickHandler>Oholah</jLink></jLink></jLink> (<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>) and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0172' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0172' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0172' clickHandler>Oholibah</jLink></jLink></jLink> (<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>) became prostitutes in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> while they belonged to God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0170' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0170' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0170' clickHandler>Oholah</jLink></jLink></jLink> gave herself to Egyptians as well as Assyrians, who were dressed in blue. Therefore, God gave her to the Assyrians, who killed her and took her children. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0172' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0172' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0172' clickHandler>Oholibah</jLink></jLink></jLink> saw this, but continued her prostitution. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0172' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0172' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0172' clickHandler>Oholibah</jLink></jLink></jLink> went even further by servicing both the Assyrians and the red Babylonians. She then despised the Babylonians and sought after the Egyptians instead because they had big genitals and lots of semen. Therefore, God will bring His wrath in the form of her ex-lovers, the Assyrians and Babylonians. They will strip her wealth, take her children, cut off her nose and ears, and kill all the rest. She will drink the same cup of wrath as her sister, the consequence of her sins. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to judge these sisters for their idolatry, child sacrifice, and desecration. They chose to prostitute themselves out to foreign nations, so God let them. Righteous men will judge them. God will send the mob against them to pillage and kill, thereby God will put an end to their sins. This episode will serve as a warning to all nations. Then these sisters will know that God is God.

On the tenth day of the tenth month of the ninth year of Zedekiah's reign, God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to record this date because the king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> sieged <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> on that day. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the Israelites to make a stew of the finest meats. They have spilled blood on bare rock. Therefore, God will spill their blood on bare rock in wrath and revenge. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> cook the stew, eat it, and set the empty pot on the fire to burn its deposits away. But the deposits will not burn away, just like the sins of the Israelites. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> God will cleanse them through His wrath. God will act now without pity or relent. God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that He will kill his wife, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> must not outwardly mourn her death. She dies. The Israelites inquire of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell them that He is about to desecrate the sanctuary, the object of their affection, and kill the children they left behind. They will not mourn for this loss, just like <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> did not mourn for his wife. Then they will know that God is God. God will make <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> speechless until the sanctuary is defiled and a fugitive tells him the news as another sign of God.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler>Ammon</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Because the Ammonites celebrated the destruction of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Judah, God will give them over to the Babylonians and will exterminate them. Then they will know that God is God. For the same reasons, God will punish <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler>Moab</jLink></jLink></jLink> as well, and the Ammonites will not be remembered. The Moabites will then know that God is God. Because the Edomites took revenge on Judah, God will kill their men and animals through war. They will know God's vengeance. Because <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler>Philistia</jLink></jLink></jLink> sought to destroy Judah, God will destroy them in His vengeance, and they will know God is God.

On the first day of the month in the eleventh year, God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Because <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink> rejoiced at the destruction of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, God will send <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> to utterly destroy them. They will be plundered, killed, and reduced to a flat rock. They will never be rebuilt. People all along the sea will lament its destruction. God will take them to the grave, and they will not return to the land of the living. They will never be found again.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to recite a lament to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink> was perfect in beauty, made and ornamented with all of the best materials. All of the best men were attracted to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and worked for you. Many nations traded their various goods with you. You set out to sea full of cargo, but an east wind will break you to pieces. Everything and everyone will sink into the sea the day of the shipwreck. Everyone else around will mourn your loss and shudder in the horror of your destruction.

God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against the king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The king thinks that he is as wise as a god, but he is a man. Through his wisdom and skill he has amassed great wealth. Because he thinks that he is as wise as a god, God will have ruthless foreigners attack him and his city. They will end his arrogance, killing him in a violent death, and will destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to recite a lament concerning the king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink>. He was perfect. He dwelt in Eden, on the Holy Mount, and among fiery stones. He was wise, beautiful, and adorned with the finest materials. God had made him become so exalted because of his blameless ways, until evil was found in him. He became dishonest in trading, so God punished him. He became proud of his beauty, which corrupted his wisdom, so God has made an example of him for all nations, reducing him to ashes in a horrible end. God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler>Sidon</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler>Sidon</jLink></jLink></jLink> will know that God is God when He afflicts them with plague and war. No longer will <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> have malicious neighboring nations. When God gathers back the exiled Israelites, they will live in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> in safety after God has punished all who have wronged the Israelites. Then they will know that God is God.

On the twelfth day of the tenth month of the tenth year, God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Pharaoh is proud of the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler>Nile</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but God will take the Egyptians out from the lands of the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler>Nile</jLink></jLink></jLink> and leave them to die in the desert. Then the Egyptians will know that God is God. They have provided hazardous support to the house of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, so God will punish them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be without person or animal to the border of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler>Cush</jLink></jLink></jLink> (Upper <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2975G' clickHandler>Nile</jLink></jLink></jLink>, Ethiopia) for forty years, and the Egyptians will be scattered in exile. After 40 years, God will return them from Exile. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be the lowest kingdom, never again ruling over another nation, and will remind the Israelites of their sin. On the first day of the first month of the twenty-seventh year, God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that the Babylonians fought hard against <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but did not win. Therefore, God will give <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink> for the Babylonians to plunder as a reward for fighting against <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink> on God's behalf. At that time God will grow a ruler for the Israelites and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> (or perhaps another prophet) will be able to speak so that they will know that God is God.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy a lament for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God's day is near, a cloudy day with doom for the nations. Invaders will war against <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, plunder her and kill her people. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler>Cush</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6316G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6316G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6316G' clickHandler>Put</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3070' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3070' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3070' clickHandler>Lydia</jLink></jLink></jLink>, all <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6152B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6152B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6152B' clickHandler>Arabia</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3864' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3864' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3864' clickHandler>Libya</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s allies will fall by the sword along with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. They will all be desolate after war. Then they will know that God is God. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler>Cush</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be frightened. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink>, king of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> will destroy and capture <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> on the seventh day of the first month of the eleventh year that God will break Pharaoh's arms and scatter the Egyptians throughout many countries. God will strengthen <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Then they will know that God is God.

God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> on the first day of the third month of the eleventh year to prophesy against <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink> once was a beautiful and powerful kingdom which ruled many nations, and was more mighty than the Israelites, because God made it that way. God then destroyed the Assyrian empire because they were proud. No other empires will ever be as mighty, and they are all destined for destruction. All nations trembled at <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s fall, and its allied nations also were destroyed. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> is mightier than the Israelites, but God will destroy them just like the Assyrians.

God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> on the first day of the twelfth month of the twelfth year to prophesy a lament against <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> is a powerful monster. God will send people to capture and kill the Egyptians all over their land, leaving their bodies for beasts to eat. This will be in the darkness of a cloudy sky, and moonless and starless nights. The other nations will be frightened by your destruction. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> will conquer them, leaving <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> plundered and desolate. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> will know that God is God. God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> on the fifteenth day of the twelfth month of the twelfth year to prophesy a lament against the hordes of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and her allies will all be destroyed. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink> is destroyed. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler>Elam</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4902G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4902G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4902G' clickHandler>Meshech</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8422G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8422G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8422G' clickHandler>Tubal</jLink></jLink></jLink> are all in the grave, as are <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the princes of the north, and the Sidonians. Just like those others, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> will die too. Although God used the Egyptians, they will go to the grave.

God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that if a watchman warns his people of an invasion which God initiates, but they do nothing to protect themselves, then their blood is on their own heads. However, if the watchman provides no warning, his people will die because of their own sins, but their blood will be on the watchman's head. God has made <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> watchman for the house of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, so he must warn them or be held accountable. God takes no pleasure in killing the wicked, but would rather them repent and live. A man's previous righteousness will not save him if he turns to sin. A man's previous wickedness will not kill him if he repents of it. This is God's justice, despite what man thinks of it. On the fifth day of the tenth month in the twelfth year of exile, a fugitive from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that the city was captured. God them made <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> able to talk again (fulfilling the prophesy from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> 24). The remnant of people still living in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> continue to sin, so God will have them all killed by war, beasts, and plague. The people are listening to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but not doing what <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> tells them to do. They will know <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> is a prophet when all of this happens.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against the shepherds (leaders) of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The leaders have profited from the sheep (people), but have not taken care of them in return. It is their fault that the people are scattered in exile. Therefore, God will remove these leaders from their power over the people. God will search for the scattered people like a shepherd, returning them to the good pasture of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God will nurse the injured people, but will destroy the strong ones. God will judge the people which he brings back to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> too, purging out those who sin. God will have <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> be their leader, looking after them like a shepherd. God will be their God. God will give them peace; safety from beasts, drought, famine, plundering, and invasion. They will know that God is God when He rescues them from their oppressors. They will be free from scorn and will be known for their crops. Then they will know that God is God. The house of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be His people, and He will be their God.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against Mount <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8165B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8165B' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8165B' clickHandler>Seir</jLink></jLink></jLink> (<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink>). God will make <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink> desolate. Then they will know that God is God. Because they hated <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and attacked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> when God was punishing <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, God will send war to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink> to kill them. Their towns will be forever desolate. Then they will know that God is God. Because they thought they could take the nations of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Judah when God had destroyed them, God will make them desolate while the world rejoices. Then they will know that God is God.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy to the land of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Nations around <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, like <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink>, have invaded <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> since the exile of the Israelites and used its pastureland. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> God is going to subject the nations around <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to scorn. God is looking after <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, so it will produce fruit and will be farmed. The entire house of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will return to it. Towns and ruins will be rebuilt. Men and animals will be fruitful. The nation will be more prosperous than before. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will know that God is God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will never again be conquered, suffering life losses of its citizens from wars. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will not be the subject of scorn. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> a prophesy for the Israelites. Before exile, the sins of the Israelites had been unclean to God, like a woman's period. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> God punished them and scattered them throughout other nations. The other nations scorned God's name because of the exile. Therefore, not for the sake of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but for the sake of God's name, He will do the following things to prove that He is holy so that the nations will know that God is God. God will bring the Israelites back to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and will clean their sins with water. God will give them a new heart and His spirit so that they will obey God's decrees and laws. God will prevent them from becoming unclean. They will have abundant crops and no famines, and this will remind them of their former sins and be ashamed. When their sins are cleansed, they will rebuild towns and ruins. The land will be farmed, becoming like the garden of Eden. The rebuilding and replanting will prove to other nations that God has done this. God will multiply the Israelites like sheep for offerings.

God took <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> on a spiritual journey to a valley which was full of dry bones. God asks <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> if the bones can live. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> replies that only God knows. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy to the dry bones. God will breath life into them, cover them with flesh and skin, and they will live. Then they will know that God is God. As <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> spoke the prophesy, the bones became covered with flesh and skin. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy to the breath, to tell the four winds to enter and breath into the bodies. As <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> spoke the prophesy, the bodies came to life and stood up as a vast army. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that the bones are the whole house of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The Israelites claim that their bones are dry and their hope is gone. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> should prophesy to them saying that God will bring them up from the grave and back to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Then God's people will know that God is God. God will put His spirit in them. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to write “Belonging to Judah and the Israelites associated with him” on one stick and “<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s stick, belonging to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3130G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3130G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3130G' clickHandler>Joseph</jLink></jLink></jLink> and all the house of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> associated with him” on another stick. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> is to john the sticks together. He is to tell the Israelites that this means that God will gather the scattered Israelites back to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, rejoining kingdoms of Judah and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>. There will be one king over them, and will never again become two nations. God will cleanse them and keep them from sinning. They will be God's people, and He will be their God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be king over <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. They will follow God's laws and decrees. They will live there forever in peace, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be king forever, and God will increase their numbers. God will live with them in the sanctuary forever. Then nations will know that God makes <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> holy.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler>Gog</jLink></jLink></jLink>, ruler of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4902G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4902G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4902G' clickHandler>Meshech</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8422G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8422G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8422G' clickHandler>Tubal</jLink></jLink></jLink> in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4031G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4031G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4031G' clickHandler>Magog</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God will lure <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler>Gog</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s army, plus the armies of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6539' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6539' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6539' clickHandler>Persia</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler>Cush</jLink></jLink></jLink> (Ethiopia), <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6316G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6316G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6316G' clickHandler>Put</jLink></jLink></jLink> (<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3864' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3864' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3864' clickHandler>Libya</jLink></jLink></jLink>), <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1586G' clickHandler>Gomer</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Beth <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8425G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8425G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8425G' clickHandler>Togarmah</jLink></jLink></jLink> (Turkey), with their horses, shields, helmets, and swords, to invade the restored <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> in future years to show the nations that God is holy. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler>Gog</jLink></jLink></jLink> will think that he will easily plunder <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s prosperous and peaceful people. But when <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler>Gog</jLink></jLink></jLink> and his allies attack <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, God will cause a massive earthquake with His presence, scaring all living creatures, flipping mountains, and making every wall fall. God will cause <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler>Gog</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s army men to fight each other, and afflict the army with plague, rain, hail, and burning sulfur. Then they will know God's holiness and know that God is God.
