God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to prophesy against <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler>Gog</jLink></jLink></jLink>, ruler of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4902G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4902G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4902G' clickHandler>Meshech</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8422G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8422G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8422G' clickHandler>Tubal</jLink></jLink></jLink> in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4031G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4031G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4031G' clickHandler>Magog</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God will lure <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler>Gog</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s army with its allies to attack <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but God will remove the bows and arrows from their hands and kill them in fields, leaving their bodies for wild animals to eat. God will send fire to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4031G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4031G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4031G' clickHandler>Magog</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the coast lands, and then they will know that God is God. God's name will be holy among the Israelites, God's name will not be profaned, and nations will know that God is the holy one in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The Israelites will use the wood from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler>Gog</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s army's weapons and armor for fuel for 7 years, plundering those who plundered them. After 7 months, the Israelites will bury the remains of the army in a valley east of the Dead Sea, blocking the way for travelers, over the course of 7 months. The Israelites will remember that day. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that to let the wild animals know that God is preparing <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler>Gog</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s army for them to eat. God will show His glory to all nations with the punishment of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1463G' clickHandler>Gog</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s army. Then the Israelites will know that God is God. All nations will know that the Israelites went into exile for their sins, and that God has punished them accordingly. God will guard His name and will now bring <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler>Jacob</jLink></jLink></jLink> (Israelites) back from exile. The Israelites will forget their past sins committed in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> previously. God will show Himself holy to many nations through the Israelites after He brings every single one of the Israelites back to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God will put His spirit into the Israelites.

On the twenty-fifth year of exile, the tenth month of the fourteenth year after <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s fall, God gives <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> a vision of a new Temple in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. A man who looked like bronze tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the Israelites everything that he sees. What follows are several dimensions for the layout of the Temple and its grounds. The east gate, outer court, north gate, south gate, and gates to the inner court are described, including their palm tree decorations. There was a room for washing burnt offerings, and were tables for killing the burnt, sin, and guilt offerings. There are rooms for the “sons of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6659G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6659G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6659G' clickHandler>Zadok</jLink></jLink></jLink>,” the only Levites who can approach God.

This chapter continues with the dimensions and layout of the Temple. The outer sanctuary, inner sanctuary, Most Holy Place, the Temple itself, side rooms on three levels, priests' rooms, west building, and table altar inside the inner sanctuary. The sanctuary was decorated with palm trees and two-headed cherubim. One head was a lion. The other head was a man.

This chapter continues with the dimensions and layout of other structures. The north and south priest chambers as well as the outermost Temple wall. The priests make the holy offerings, and must change out or their holy clothes before going into the outer courtyard. The Temple wall separated the holy from the common.

The bronze man takes <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to the each gate, where he sees God's glory, like he had seen it before, coming from the east. God's glory filled the Temple. At the inner court, God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that this Temple is where God will live forever. The Israelites and their kings will never again defile God's name. They had done so before, which is why God had punished them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> should tell the Israelites God's master plan, and go on tell them the details of the plan if they are ashamed of their sins. The whole mountain top where the Temple is will be holy. The design of the altar is described. The priests, from the <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6659G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6659G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6659G' clickHandler>Zadok</jLink></jLink></jLink> branch of Levites, will sacrifice a bull for a sin offering on the altar and then burn it outside the sanctuary. On the second day the priests will sacrifice a male goat as a sin offering, and then sacrifice a bull and a ram burnt offering with salt. For 7 days the same goat, bull, and ram offerings will be done to atone for the altar. From the eighth day on, burnt offerings and fellowship offerings will be done on the altar. God will then accept them.

The gate to the inner sanctuary is to remain shut because God is in the sanctuary. Only the prince (ruler or king) can eat in the gateway in God's presence. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to tell the Israelites that they had broken God's covenant by letting foreigners work in the sanctuary. However, not even the foreigners living among them will be allowed into this sanctuary. Only the <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6659G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6659G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6659G' clickHandler>Zadok</jLink></jLink></jLink> branch of Levites will serve God in the holy areas of the sanctuary because only they remained faithful to God when the Israelites strayed. The other Levites will perform other, less holy duties outside the sanctuary. The Zadokites must wear linen clothes and turbans when in the inner court and change out of the linens before leaving the inner court. They must keep their hair trimmed, not shaved or grown long. They cannot drink wine in the inner court. They can only marry Israelite virgins or widows of priests, not other widows or divorced women. They will teach about the holy and the common, and the clean and unclean. The priests are to act as judges. They will keep God's laws and feasts. They will keep Sabbaths holy. Priests must not defile themselves by going near dead people, except for their parents, children, brother, or unmarried sister. If a priest is so defiled, he can cleanse himself after 7 days. The priests will eat the offerings, and only possess what is given to God, including the best of the firstfruits. Priests cannot eat anything killed by wild animals.

The division of the land of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> is described regarding the holy portion and the communal property around it. The prince will own the land to the east and west of the holy portion. God's princes will never again oppress the Israelites. The Israelites will live in lands according to their tribes. Accurate weights and measurements will be used. The Israelites will give the prince grain, oil, and one out of every 200 sheep as a special gift. The prince will provide these as offerings to make atonement for the people. The prince will provide sin, grain, burnt, and fellowship offerings at the appointed feasts. On the first day and seventh day of the first month a young bull is to be sacrificed to atone for unintentional sins for the Temple. On the fourteenth day of the first month, the Israelites are to observe Passover. The prince will sacrifice a bull to atone for his sins and those of the Israelites. Then 7 bulls, 7 rams, and a male goat sin offering must be made for each of 7 days, along with grain and oil offerings, all of which are provided by the prince.

The east gate to the inner court will be open only on Sabbaths and days of New Moons. The prince will go up to the gateway on those days to worship while the priests perform his sacrifices. Then the prince will leave. But the gate will remain open until night. The prince's Sabbath sacrifices will be 6 male lambs, a ram, grain, and oil. The prince's New Moon sacrifices will be a bull, 6 male lambs, a ram, grain, and oil. When the people come into the outer courtyard during appointed feasts, they are to leave at the gate opposite the one where they came in at. The prince's offerings at appointed festivals will be a bull, a ram, any amount of lambs, grain, and oil. For a prince's freewill offerings, the inner court gate will be opened like on Sabbaths, but will be closed after the offering is made. Every morning there will be a burnt offering of a year-old lamb, along with a grain and oil offering as a lasting ordinance. When a prince passes down inheritance, only passing down to a son will be permanent. If the prince gives to a servant, that inheritance reverts back to the prince on the Jubilee year. A prince cannot take land from other Israelites. The priests will have a bakery in the inner court for holy sacrifices. The outer court also had many kitchens for cooking sacrifices.

The bronze man took <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to see a stream of water flowing eastward, which originated from under the Temple just south of its east entrance. It continued to flow eastward outside the outer court, progressively getting deeper, eventually becoming a river which was too deep for anyone to cross. Many big fruit trees grew on its river banks. The bronze man told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3168H' clickHandler>Ezekiel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that the river flows into the Dead Sea, changing its salt water to fresh water. Lots of different kinds of fish will live in its waters, so fishermen will fish there. However, the swamps and marshes around the Dead Sea will remain salty to provide salt. The fruit trees on the banks will produce fruit every month, and their leaves will be used for healing. God provides the boundaries for the land of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The land is to be divided up among the tribes of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The land will be an inheritance for the tribes as well as for aliens who immigrate to that land. Tribes must give immigrants some land.

God describes the division of the land by tribe, as well as the holy portions for the Zadokites and the other Levites in the holy city, and the land for the prince. The Zadokites and other Levites cannot sell or give their land to anyone outside of their tribe. Workers from all of the tribes will tend pastures and farms to supply food for the workers of the holy city. There will be twelve gates to the holy city, each one named for a tribe of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The holy city will be called “the Lord is there.”

King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink> of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> besieged <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> in the third year of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3079' clickHandler>Jehoiakim</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s reign of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God gave <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and he took the treasures from the Temple of God back to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> to his god. King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5019' clickHandler>Nebuchadnezzar</jLink></jLink></jLink> ordered his chief court official, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0828' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0828' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0828' clickHandler>Ashpenaz</jLink></jLink></jLink>, to select some of the best young men of royal Israelite lineage to be trained in Babylonian language and literature for three years, and thereafter to enter into the king's service. clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> was thrown into the den of lions, sealed in by the his nobles. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler>Darius</jLink></jLink></jLink> was distressed and could not sleep that night. At dawn, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler>Darius</jLink></jLink></jLink> hurried to the den of lions, and was overjoyed to find that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s God had protected <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> from the lions. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler>Darius</jLink></jLink></jLink> then had the men whom had falsely accused <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> thrown into the lion's den, along with their wives and children, where they were killed instantly by the lions. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler>Darius</jLink></jLink></jLink> wrote a message to all nations and in every language in his kingdom; a decree saying that all must fear and reverence <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s God because He is the living God, enduring forever, His kingdom and dominion will never end, He rescues and saves, enacts signs and wonders in heaven and on earth, and has rescued <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> prospered under the reigns of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler>Darius</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3566' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3566' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3566' clickHandler>Cyrus</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

In the first year of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1112' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1112' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1112' clickHandler>Belshazzar</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s reign of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> had a vision in a dream and recorded it like so: the four winds churned the seas, while four great beasts came out of the sea. The first beast was a lion with the wings of an eagle. Its wings were torn off, it stood like a man, and was given the heart of a man. The second beast was like a bear, which had three ribs in its mouth and was told to eat its fill of flesh. The third beast was like a leopard with four heads, four bird wings, and was given the authority to rule. The fourth beast was frightening and powerful, with large iron teeth, it completely crushed and destroyed its victims. It had ten horns, but then a new small horn came up and pulled out the first three horns. The new horn had the eyes and mouth of a man and it spoke arrogantly. Then, the “Ancient of Days,” who had white clothing and hair, was enthroned. His throne and its wheels were flaming, and a river of fire flowed out from Him. Many thousands attended Him, and one hundred million stood in front of Him. His court was there and the books were opened. The small horn continued to boast, but was then slain and destroyed in fire. The other beasts were stripped of power, but allowed to live for a while. Someone like a “son of man” came with the clouds. He went to the Ancient of Days, and was given everlasting sovereignty over all people and nations with an everlasting kingdom. Troubled, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked one of the men standing around in the vision to interpret the true meaning of the vision. The man said that the four beasts are four kingdoms, but God's saints will takeover the kingdom forever. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked the man further about the terrible fourth beast with its ten horns, after observing how the new small horn had warred with and defeated the saints until God judged to give the kingdom to the saints. The man explained that the fourth kingdom will conquer the entire earth. There will be ten kings of that kingdom, and then another king will rise up to subdue three of the kings, will speak against God and oppress His saints, and change the set times and laws. God will let the saints be oppressed for “a time, times and half a time.” Then the court will condemn this king, and all of the kingdoms “under heaven” will be given to the saints, God's people. God's kingdom will be everlasting, and all rulers will worship obey Him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> was frightened by this vision, and so he kept it a secret.

In the third year of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1112' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1112' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1112' clickHandler>Belshazzar</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s reign of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> had a vision like so: <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> was standing by a canal in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5867A' clickHandler>Elam</jLink></jLink></jLink> (southwest Iran). He saw a ram with two long horns; the longest horn had grown later. No animal could stand against the ram as it charged north, south, and west. Then, a goat, with a horn between its eyes, charged from the west, covering the entire earth without touching the ground. The goat charged the ram, breaking the ram's horns and trampling on the ram. At the height of its power, the goat's horn broke, and four new horns grew towards the four winds. Another horn grew from one of the horns, and grew powerful, capturing the south, east, and the “Beautiful Land.” The horn grew until it reached the heavens and then it trampled on some of the stars. It stopped the daily sacrifices and it was allowed to defile the sanctuary because of the saints' rebellion. Truth was thrown to the ground. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> heard a “holy one” ask another holy one how long it would take for this to all be fulfilled, the “rebellion that causes desolation” and the defiled Temple. The holy one told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that the sanctuary would be reconsecrated in 2300 days. Gabriel, “one who looked like a man,” called <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> “son of man” and told him that this vision regards the “time of the end.” Gabriel told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that the two-horned ram represented kings of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H4074H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H4074H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H4074H' clickHandler>Media</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6539' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6539' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6539' clickHandler>Persia</jLink></jLink></jLink>, while the goat was <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3120H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3120H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3120H' clickHandler>Greece</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the large horn represented its first king. Four weaker kingdoms will then arise from the Grecian empire. Near the end of these kingdoms as they turn rebellious, a stern, intriguing king will arise. This king will be mighty and arrogant, and will cause great devastation which will extend even to the Israelites, thereby taking his stand against the “Prince of princes.” This king will be destroyed, but not by human power. The number of days that the Temple will be defiled is true (2300). Then Gabriel said that this concerns the distant future, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> should keep it a secret. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> was deeply disturbed by this vision, and he could not understand it.

In the first year of the rule of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler>Darius</jLink></jLink></jLink> over <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> read that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that the desolation of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> would last 70 years. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> fasted, donned sackcloth and ashes, and prayed to God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> says that God is great, loving, and forgiving, but all of the Israelites have rebelled against God, so God had scattered them like He had promised He would do when the covenant was established with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> begs God to forgive the Israelites and take action. While <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> was praying, Gabriel flew in to meet with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Gabriel told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that as soon as <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> began to pray, an answer was given. Gabriel then told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> the prayer's answer: There will be seventy “sevens” (literally weeks, but also interpreted as sets of seven years) to stop sinning, atone for their sins, establish everlasting righteousness, and anoint the most Holy. From the time when the order is given to rebuild <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, in seven sevens there will be an anointed ruler, and in sixty-two more sevens the restoration of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be complete, despite there being trouble in those times. Then the anointed ruler will be no more, and a subsequent ruler's people will destroy the city and the sanctuary, and war and desolation will continue until the end. The new ruler will make a covenant with many for one seven, and will stop sacrifices in the middle of that seven. The new ruler will establish abominations that cause desolation until the decreed end is applied to him.

On the twenty-fourth day of the first month in the third year of the reign of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink> by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3566' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3566' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3566' clickHandler>Cyrus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> had a vision. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> had mourned, ate no meat, drank no wine, and used no lotions for three weeks prior. Then, by the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2313' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2313' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2313' clickHandler>Tigris</jLink></jLink></jLink> river <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> saw a man of fire dressed in linen and gold with a booming voice who only <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> could see, but those around <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> were still frightened away. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> fainted, but the fiery man touched <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, waking him up. The fiery man told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> was highly esteemed because <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> had humbled himself and looked for understanding. Therefore, God sent the fiery man to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3566' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3566' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3566' clickHandler>Cyrus</jLink></jLink></jLink> had resisted the fiery man for twenty-one days, until the chief prince, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4317Q' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4317Q' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4317Q' clickHandler>Michael</jLink></jLink></jLink>, helped the fiery man. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> complains of being weak. The fiery man encouraged <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to be strong, and told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> that soon the fiery man would fight against the prince of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6539' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6539' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6539' clickHandler>Persia</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and then the prince of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3120H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3120H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3120H' clickHandler>Greece</jLink></jLink></jLink> will come. The fiery man said that he would tell <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> what was in the “Book of Truth,” and that nobody supported the fiery man except for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s prince, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4317Q' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4317Q' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4317Q' clickHandler>Michael</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

The fiery man continues, telling Daniel that the fiery man himself had been helping <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867I' clickHandler>Darius</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The fiery man then gives Daniel this prophesy: There will be four more kings of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6539' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6539' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6539' clickHandler>Persia</jLink></jLink></jLink>, with the fourth being the richest and inciting the enmity of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3120H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3120H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3120H' clickHandler>Greece</jLink></jLink></jLink>. A mighty king will rule, but his empire will end and it will be divided into four pieces in cardinal directions. The king of the South will be powerful. His daughter will make an alliance with the king of the North, but she will be killed. A new king of the South (of royal lineage) will then conquer and plunder the king of the North, taking the spoils back to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Later, the king of the North will unsuccessfully attack the South. The North will later attack again, making it to the South's fortress, and then be defeated. Again the North will invade the South with a better army. Israelites will rebel against the South at that time unsuccessfully. The North's king will capture and control <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler>Judea</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Then the king of the North make an alliance with the king of the South through marriage of the North's royal daughter. The king of the North will unsuccessfully attack the coastlands, and then retreat to his own country, only to be destroyed in a few years. The North's successor will come non-violently. The successor will have a large military victory and will kill a “prince of the Covenant.” During a time of peace, this successor king of the North will invade and plunder provinces unprovoked. Then the king of the North will wage war against the South, and the South will lose because of plots against the South's king. The end will come at the appointed time. The king of the North will return with great wealth after taking action against the “holy covenant.” Later, the king of the North will again invade the South, but this time ships on the western coastline will thwart his advance. The king of the North will then vent his frustration on <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, desecrating the Temple, stopping daily sacrifices, and establishing an “abomination that causes desolation.” The king of the North will corrupt many, but others who know God will resist. The people who resist will struggle so that they will be purified for the “time of the end.” This king of the North will blaspheme God, and say that he is better than everyone else and God. The king will be successful until the appointed time. He will not desire women. He will worship a god of fortresses. With the help of a foreign god, the king will conquer fortresses, and will honor and enrich those who honor him. At the “time of the end,” the king of the South will attack the North. The king of the North will counterattack, capturing <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler>Judea</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3864' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3864' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3864' clickHandler>Libya</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and Nubia. Then, the king of the North will hear of troubles in the east and north, and so he will return to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler>Judea</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Yet his end will be there, with no one to help him.

The fiery man continues to give <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> a prophesy: At that time, there will be distress like never before. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4317Q' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4317Q' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4317Q' clickHandler>Michael</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the great prince and protector of the Israelites, will arise, and will save those Israelites whose names are in the Book. The dead will awaken, and be granted either everlasting life or everlasting contempt. The righteous will shine like stars forever. Then the fiery man tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> to seal up the scroll of this prophesy until the “time of the end,” and that many will read the scroll to be wise. There were two “others” there, and one asked the fiery man how long it would take to fulfill this prophesy. The fiery man replied that it will take “a time, times and half a time” to complete, and the Israelites' power will be broken. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> inquired of the outcome, and the fiery man replied that many will be purified, that the wicked will not understand but the wise will understand, that from the time when the sacrifices are stopped and the abomination is set up will be 1290 days, that those who last until “the end” at 1335 days will be blessed, and that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be rewarded.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler>Hosea</jLink></jLink></jLink> was a prophet of God during the reign of King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3379H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3379H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3379H' clickHandler>Jeroboam</jLink></jLink></jLink> in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> (<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>). God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler>Hosea</jLink></jLink></jLink> to marry an adulterous wife and to have unfaithful children, because that is what <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> is like. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler>Hosea</jLink></jLink></jLink> married <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1586H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1586H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1586H' clickHandler>Gomer</jLink></jLink></jLink>. When they had their first son, God said to name him “<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3157K' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3157K' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3157K' clickHandler>Jezreel</jLink></jLink></jLink>,” because God will end the kingdom of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> in the Valley of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3157K' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3157K' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3157K' clickHandler>Jezreel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. When the next had a daughter, God said to name her “<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3819' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3819' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3819' clickHandler>Lo-Ruhamah</jLink></jLink></jLink>” (not loved) because God will no longer love or forgive the House of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, even though He will save the House of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. When they had their second son, God said to name him “<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3818' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3818' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3818' clickHandler>Lo-Ammi</jLink></jLink></jLink>” (not my people) because God disowns them. Despite that, at some later time they will again be prosperous and return to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, uniting with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> under one leader who they have appointed.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler>Hosea</jLink></jLink></jLink> to give the people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> the following prophesy. The people should change from their spiritually adulterous ways. Otherwise, God will strip their kingdom, send a drought to the land, and stop their celebrations; punishing them for worshiping Baals and seeking protection by allying with other nations instead of seeking God. Later, God will lure the people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> back to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and again become their God. They will no longer worship idols. God will make the people safe from animals and weapons. The land will again be productive.

God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler>Hosea</jLink></jLink></jLink> to love his adulteress wife again, just like God still loves the House of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> despite their idol worship and love for raisin cakes. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1954J' clickHandler>Hosea</jLink></jLink></jLink> bought his wife, and told her to wait for him for several days, as he would wait for her. The House of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will live a while without kings or sacrifices. Then they will humbly return to their land and to God and their king <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> in the “last days.”

God said that the House of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> has abandoned God. They instead turn to idol worship. They have become lawless. Their sins kill the land, the beasts, the birds, and the fish. The people are as despicable as those who accuse priests. Their prophets are blind. God will destroy their land because of their sins. Even the priests are wicked, and encourage wickedness in the people. God will restrict their food supply and limit their numbers. The people prostitute themselves and drink old and new wine, which ruins their understanding. God will not punish their prostitutes or adulteress women, because the men seek them out due to their lack of understanding. The House of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> should stay away from Judah and not swear by God. The House of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> is stubborn, persisting in their sins.

God knows of the House of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s corruption, sins, and rejection of God. The House of Judah is stumbling with them. God has removed His blessing from the House of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. They have children out of wedlock. God will destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Judah like a lion, and take the surviving remnant from their land. Then God will wait until they seek Him in their misery.

Return to God and He will heal us. God will revive us in two days, and will restore us in three days so that we can live with God. If we acknowledge God, He will come surely back to us. The love of the Houses of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Judah is fleeting, so God condemned them with His prophets. God desires mercy, not sacrifice, and acknowledgment instead of burnt offerings. They are wicked. A harvest will occur in Judah.

God wants to heal <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but their their sins are grievous and God remembers all of their evils always. The king delights in the people's wickedness, and likewise the people delight in the king's wickedness, together mocking God. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> mixes with other nations, which weakens <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> without them noticing. Instead of relying on God, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> seeks help from other nations. God will destroy them for their rebellion. Instead of crying to God, they turn away and seek grain and new wine. Their leaders will fall by the sword and be ridiculed.

The Israelites have broken God's covenant and laws, while acknowledging God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> chooses rulers without God's consent, and makes idols. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> worships a calf-idol and produces no fruit, so God is angry and their idol will be broken. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> sows what will reap destruction, not profit. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> have sold themselves to other nations, becoming worthless. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s altars have become used for sinning. God will punish them for their sins. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> has forgotten God, so God will destroy their cities and fortresses.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be punished for their sins, being sent to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Their sacrifices will not be accepted. If they escape their destruction, they will be killed in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. They ignore and mistreat God's prophet. God was happy when He found <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but they have turned into idol worshipers. God will make them miscarry, give them dry breasts, and will slay their children. Because of their wickedness in Gilgal, like in the days of Gibeah, God rejects them. They will be scattered among other nations.

God will destroy the means of idolatry in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>. They make false oaths which cause problems. Their calf-idol will be taken to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s king will be destroyed. The people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will ask for the mountains to cover them and the hills to fall on them. God will bring them war and slavery for their double sin. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> is like a cow, so God will drive <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and Judah will plow, because <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler>Jacob</jLink></jLink></jLink> must turn the soil. They should sow righteousness and seek God until He comes, but instead they plant and reap evil and they do not depend on God.

God loved the Israelites, bringing them out of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but they rejected Him with idolatry. God treated <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> with loving kindness, but they will be sent to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and ruled by <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink> for their non-repentance. Their nation will be destroyed by war, and God will not help them in their distress. Yet God's compassion is aroused, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> will not be completely destroyed, because God is God, not a man. God will call the trembling remnant of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> back from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Judah both rebel against God.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> lies, and makes alliances with <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Judah will be punished for their sins. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler>Jacob</jLink></jLink></jLink> grabbed his brother's heal in the womb, and as a man he successfully wrestled with God. He spoke with God. Judah must return to God, love, and justice. They are fraudulent. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> thinks that its wealth will protect them from guilt. God will make them live in tents again. God spoke through the visions of prophets, and told parables through them. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1568G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1568G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1568G' clickHandler>Gilead</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Gilgal will be destroyed for their wickedness. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler>Jacob</jLink></jLink></jLink> fled to Aram, and paid for his wife with service. God used a prophet to bring <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> out of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and care for him, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> provoked him to hostilities, and so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s contempt will be repaid by God.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0669G' clickHandler>Ephraim</jLink></jLink></jLink> was exalted, but then began idolatry, and their idolatry proliferated and progressed. Therefore they will be destroyed. They shall acknowledge no god or savior but God Himself. God had taken care of them, but in their prosperity they rejected Him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> God will attack them like a sly and ferocious animal. God angrily gave them a king per their request, and will now take their king away in His wrath. Their sins are on record. They do not learn from their pain, so God will kill them without compassion. They will have a drought. God is stirring up an invading and plundering army from the east. The Samaritans will bear their guilt through war. Their children and pregnant women will be killed.

<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s sins have caused their ruin. They should repent, beg God for forgiveness, acknowledge that <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink> cannot save them, and renounce their idolatry. Then God will heal them, love them, and bless them. They will become firmly rooted in the land, and will be attractive and famous for their prosperity. The wise will righteously walk in God's ways, but the rebellious will stumble.

Judah has experienced destruction not seen before, and should be told about to all later generations. Locusts (likely a metaphor for an army) have devoured everything. A powerful nation has invaded and stripped the land. The Day of the Lord is near. The Temple offerings have been withheld, and drought has ravished all food sources. The priests should mourn and the elders should fast and cry out to God.

The Day of the Lord is close; a day of gloom, clouds, and darkness. A powerful and large army, like never was before or ever will be, will completely consume everything in its path. Other nations will be afraid of this army. Nothing will be able to withstand this massive, mighty army which God will lead. Repent, because God may have pity. Let the Israelites mourn, fast, and cry out to God for mercy. Then God will take pity, give them abundant food, and will never make them subject to scorn again. God will drive away and destroy the northern army. God will restore the land's vegetation and provide abundant rainfall and harvests. God will repay the Israelites for the years that His locusts ate everything. Then they will know that God is their God. Afterward, God will send His spirit to all of the Israelites. The young and old, men and women, will have prophetic dreams and visions. God will show wonders in the sky and on earth; blood, fire, and smoke. The sun will darken and the moon will turn blood red before the Day of the Lord. Everyone who calls on God's name will be saved on Mount Zion and in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Those whom God calls will survive.

At that time <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be restored. God will gather and judge all nations for scattering the Israelites and taking their land, and selling their children. God will take revenge on <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler>Sidon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler>Philistia</jLink></jLink></jLink> for plundering <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> and selling the Israelites as slaves to the Greeks. God will bring the people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> back, and have the people of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler>Sidon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler>Philistia</jLink></jLink></jLink> sold to them as slaves, who will then be sold again to the Sabeans. Let all of the nations prepare for war and gather in the Valley of Jehoshaphat to be judged by God. They are abundant in wickedness. The Day of God is near in the Valley of Decision. The sun, moon, and stars will no longer shine. God will rage from Zion, but will protect the Israelites. Then the Israelites will know that God dwells in Zion, God's holy hill. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be holy. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> will never again be invaded by foreigners. The Israelites will produce abundant wine and milk, and the land will be well watered. Water will flow from God's house to the Valley of Acacias. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be desolate wastelands to repay the wrongs done to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be inhabited for all future generations. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s guilt will be pardoned.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler>Amos</jLink></jLink></jLink> gave this prophesy two years before the earthquake, when <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5818G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5818G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5818G' clickHandler>Uzziah</jLink></jLink></jLink> ruled <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Jehoash ruled <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God will destroy the nation of Aram, sending its people into exile in Kir, because they attacked <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1568G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1568G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1568G' clickHandler>Gilead</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God will destroy the nation of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler>Philistia</jLink></jLink></jLink>, killing all of its people, because they enslaved communities and sold them to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God will destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink>, because they enslaved communities and sold them to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God will destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink>, because of their continuous hostility towards the Israelites. God will destroy the nation of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler>Ammon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, sending its leaders into exile, because they unmercifully attacked <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1568G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1568G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1568G' clickHandler>Gilead</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

God will destroy the nation of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler>Moab</jLink></jLink></jLink>, killing its leaders, because they attacked <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God will destroy the nation of Judah, because they rejected God's Law and worshiped false god idols. God will destroy the nation of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, because they sell the righteous and the poor as slaves, they deny justice to the oppressed, their fathers and sons have sex with the same woman, they worship idols and profane the Temple, they forget what God has done for them, they force the Nazirites to drink wine, and they silence the prophets. None of the people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be able to save themselves from God's wrath.
