God will punish the nation of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> (<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>) for its sins because of God's covenant. When God threatens, it will come to pass. When disaster comes to a city, God caused it. Let <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0795' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0795' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0795' clickHandler>Ashdod</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> witness <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s great sins. An enemy will conquer, destroy, and plunder <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and God will only save a remnant of its people. The altars of its false gods and its splendor will be destroyed.

The idolaters who corrupt <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be cast out. Let the Samaritans keep sinning and bragging about their offerings as they love to do. God tried to get them to return to Him by punishing them with famine, drought, blight, mildew, plagues, and even fires like those at <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler>Sodom</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6017' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6017' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6017' clickHandler>Gomorrah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Yet they have not returned to God. Therefore, they should prepare to meet God.

Amos laments: Virgin <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> is fallen and abandoned. God says that her people will be decimated, and only those who seek God will live. If they do not seek God, God will destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>. They promote injustice, cast out righteousness, hate the truth, and oppress the poor. Therefore, they will not reap the pleasing benefits of their labor. Prudent men keep quiet in these evil times. If they seek God, then they will live and He will really be with them. If they repent, God may have mercy on their remnant. The Day of God will mean darkness, not light. There will be no safe haven. God hates their sacrifices and religious rites. They should instead seek justice and righteousness. Yet because they worship kings and idols, God will send them into exile.

The comfortably wealthy of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Judah will be among the first to be exiled. God will make <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> be conquered and destroyed because of their great pride in themselves. God will bring a nation to oppress <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> from Lebo <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2574G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2574G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2574G' clickHandler>Hamath</jLink></jLink></jLink> to the Valley of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6160G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6160G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6160G' clickHandler>Arabah</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

God showed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler>Amos</jLink></jLink></jLink> two different destruction prophesies of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler>Jacob</jLink></jLink></jLink> (<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>). <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler>Amos</jLink></jLink></jLink> begged God to not do these two types of destructions, and so God agreed not to do them. God then showed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler>Amos</jLink></jLink></jLink> a third prophesy, where God stood by a true wall with a plumb line. God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler>Amos</jLink></jLink></jLink> that He will no longer spare the people of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Their holy places will be destroyed during a war God will bring to them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0558J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0558J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0558J' clickHandler>Amaziah</jLink></jLink></jLink> accused <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler>Amos</jLink></jLink></jLink> of conspiring for rebellion. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler>Amos</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that God made him become a prophet, that God says <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0558J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0558J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0558J' clickHandler>Amaziah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s family will be destroyed, and that God will make the people of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> go into exile.

God showed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5986' clickHandler>Amos</jLink></jLink></jLink> a bowl of ripe fruit and said that the time is ripe to punish the House of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> for its sins, such as its lack of compassion for and taking advantage of the poor, and being greedy to the point of irreverent and dishonest practices. God will not forget their sins. God will make the land shake, make the sun go down at noon, and turn their singing into mourning. God will prevent His words from being spoken there for some time. God will bring about the forever-lasting fall of idolaters.

No matter where the people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> try to hide, God will kill them with the sword. They will be slain wherever they have run, even in exile. God looks on them for evil, not for good. God is omnipotent. God will scatter a remnant of the House of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> throughout all the nations, preserving the good ones, but all those who unrepentantly sin will be slain. Yet a day will come when God will restore the Israelites to the Promised Land as they used to be, when the city ruins will be rebuilt, and vineyards and gardens will be planted. They will never again be uprooted from the Promised Land.

God has summoned nations to humble <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s pride. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be pillaged, and their allies will turn on them. Because of their hostility towards the Israelites, they will be destroyed forever. They had better not take joy when God destroys <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, or add to the hardships of the Israelites. The Day of God is near for all nations. As they do, so it will be done to them. All nations will drink God's wrath of destruction, but the Israelites will again possess the land which God gave to them. The Israelites will utterly wipe out the Edomites. The land of the Israelites will expand to include the land of the Edomites, Philistines, and Samaritans, possessing from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6886' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6886' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6886' clickHandler>Zarephath</jLink></jLink></jLink> to Negev. This will be God's kingdom.

God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0573' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0573' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0573' clickHandler>Amittai</jLink></jLink></jLink>, to go preach against the city of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler>Nineveh</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> tried to flee, and boarded a boat headed in the opposite direction. God sent a violent storm which threatened the security of the boat. The sailors panicked and called to their gods, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> went below deck and slept. The sailors woke up <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> and begged him to pray to his god too. Through divination of lots, the sailors determined that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> was the reason for the storm, so they questioned <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s background. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that he was a Hebrew God-worshiper, and that he had already told them about his running away from God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> told the sailors to throw him overboard to calm the sea. Instead, the sailors tried to row back unsuccessfully as the storm got worse. Finally, they relented and threw <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> into the sea. The storm immediately calmed. The sailors then feared God; sacrificing and vowing to Him. God sent a big fish which swallowed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> for three days and three nights.

While in the fish, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> prayed to God, saying: God rescued me when I called to Him. I was banished, but sought God's Temple again. While I was deeply sinking, I prayed to God. Idol worshipers miss out on God's grace, but I will sacrifice to God. God provides salvation. Then, God commanded the fish to spit out <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> on dry land.

God again told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to go to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler>Nineveh</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler>Nineveh</jLink></jLink></jLink> was a big city. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> arrived and proclaimed God's judgement against the city; that it would be overturned in 40 days. The people believed God's message. Everyone in the city donned sack cloth. The king decreed for there to be a city-wide fasting for the people and the animals, and that everyone should repent of their evil and violence, in an attempt to gain God's mercy. Because of these actions, God decided not to destroy the city.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> was angry with God for showing mercy. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> had known that this would happen because God is gracious, compassionate, and slow to anger, and God relents causing calamities. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> asks God to kill him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> made a shack east of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler>Nineveh</jLink></jLink></jLink> from which to watch the city. God made a vine grow over the shack for extra shade, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> was happy about that. The next day God made a worm kill the vine, sent a hot wind, and made the day sunny and hot so that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> grew faint. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> wished he was dead. God asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> if he has a right to be angry about the vine. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> told God that he does have that right, and he is very angry. God mocked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3124' clickHandler>Jonah</jLink></jLink></jLink> for being concerned about the very temporary vine. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler>Nineveh</jLink></jLink></jLink> has over 120000 people who cannot tell right from wrong, and lots of cattle, so God is concerned about it.

God's word came to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4318K' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4318K' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4318K' clickHandler>Micah</jLink></jLink></jLink> of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H4182' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H4182' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H4182' clickHandler>Moresheth</jLink></jLink></jLink> while <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3147H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3147H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3147H' clickHandler>Jotham</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0271G' clickHandler>Ahaz</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2396G' clickHandler>Hezekiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> were kings of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>: Everyone on earth, listen to God. God is coming down to earth, melting mountains and splitting valleys, because of the sins of the Israelites in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be reduced to rubble, and its idols will be destroyed. God will bring destruction to these two nations, bringing in a conqueror. The people will be exiled.

God will punish the Israelites for being wicked, plotting evil deeds, stealing, and telling prophets not to speak. They will go into exile. Lying prophets are what they want. God will gather back the remnant of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and there will be plenty of Israelites once more. Someone will break the way before them, and they will break through the gate to leave. Their king will go before them. God will be at their head.

God will turn His back on the leaders of the Israelites for their sins against God's people. God will stop talking to the corrupt seers, diviners, and prophets, unlike Micah. Because of the corrupt leaders and prophets, God will destroy Zion and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

During the “last days,” God's Temple will be established in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and people many nations will come to it to learn God's Law and His ways. God will judge and settle disputes for big nations all over the world, so much so that they will no longer train for war and they will turn their swords into plowshares. The other nations can follow their gods, but the Israelites will forever follow God. At that time, God will bring back the scattered Israelite remnant and make a strong nation. God will rule them forever beginning from that day. The kingship of the former Israelite kingdom will return to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. It will be painful for the Israelites to go into exile to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but God will redeem them there. Now there are many nations gathered to fight the Israelites, but they do not know that God plans to destroy them. Zion will destroy many nations, and devote the war plunder to God.

Marshall the troops, because a siege is underway, and the aggressor will hit <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s ruler on the cheek. From the small clan of Judah of Bethlehem <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0672G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0672G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0672G' clickHandler>Ephrathah</jLink></jLink></jLink> will come a ruler with ancient origins for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The Israelites will suffer until the time has come for this ruler to lead the Israelites back to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. This ruler will lead and protect the Israelites like a shepherd, strengthened by God and ruling in God's name. His (God or this ruler?) greatness will be famous throughout the world. When the Assyrians invade <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, this ruler will organize several leaders in a counter-attack which will result in capturing the lands of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0894' clickHandler>Babylon</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The relatively small number of Israelites will tear through their enemies despite being vastly outnumbered. At that time, God will take vengeance on nations which have not obeyed Him; killing their horses, destroying their chariots, leveling their cities, stopping their witchcraft so that they cannot cast spells, and demolishing their idols.

God has a grievance with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God redeemed them from slavery in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, provided <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0175' clickHandler>Aaron</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4813G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4813G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4813G' clickHandler>Miriam</jLink></jLink></jLink> to lead them, and protected them on their journey through the wilderness. No amount or type of offerings, even an offering of your firstborn son, will please God if you are not obeying His Law of mercy and justice, and you are being humble. God knows that they have stolen treasures, used dishonest weights and measures, have violent rich men, have lying people, and have worshiped idols. Therefore, God will destroy them. They will be hungry, and be invaded with their possessions and produce taken from them before their possessions and produce can be enjoyed.

Micah is dismayed at the wickedness of his people. Corruption is rampant. Even the best ones are still bad. You cannot trust anyone, even your own family. Because of the Israelites' sins, God is punishing them. Yet the Israelites will survive to see their enemies destroyed. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s cities will again be rebuilt, and the scattered Israelite remnant will return, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be desolate first because of the Israelites' sins. God will shepherd the Israelites back in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> like before. God will perform miracles like during the Exodus. Nations will be weaken and ashamed, and will fear God. Who is like God, who forgives the sins of the Israelite remnant? God will show mercy on the Israelites and will keep His covenant with His people.

The prophet announces the coming judgment on <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler>Nineveh</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5151' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5151' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5151' clickHandler>Nahum</jLink></jLink></jLink> emphasizes that God is jealous and avenging. The chapter describes God as a powerful figure who is slow to anger but will not leave the guilty unpunished. Key themes include God’s power over nature and His ability to protect those who trust in Him. The chapter ends with a message of comfort for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, assuring them that their enemy will be destroyed.

Focuses on the destruction of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler>Nineveh</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Nahum describes the invading forces that will come against the city. He portrays the Assyrians as fearful and in chaos, emphasizing the fall of their stronghold. Significant imagery is used to depict the chariots, soldiers, and the walls of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler>Nineveh</jLink></jLink></jLink> collapsing. The chapter serves as a warning to the Assyrians and a message of hope for the oppressed.

Nahum continues to elaborate on the destruction of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler>Nineveh</jLink></jLink></jLink>. He highlights the reasons for this judgment, including the city's violence, idolatry, and deceit. Nahum uses vivid descriptions to portray the city’s downfall, including the imagery of bloodshed and devastation. The chapter concludes with a lament for <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler>Nineveh</jLink></jLink></jLink>, showing that its destruction is certain, and it will be left desolate. The key message is that no one can escape God’s judgment.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2265' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2265' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2265' clickHandler>Habakkuk</jLink></jLink></jLink> complains to God that there is rampant injustice, violence, and conflict, and that the wicked are prevailing. God answers that He is rousing the Babylonians to punish (inferred) the House of Judah. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2265' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2265' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2265' clickHandler>Habakkuk</jLink></jLink></jLink> then asks God why He tolerates the wickedness of the Babylonians.

God tells <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2265' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2265' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2265' clickHandler>Habakkuk</jLink></jLink></jLink> that at a certain time, God will save those who are faithful to Him and will punish the Babylonians, because they are arrogant, greedy, and murderous. All of their work will come to nothing when God acts and puts them to shame. They foolishly trust in idols, but God is reigning in His Temple, and will silence the earth.

God came from Mount <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6290G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6290G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6290G' clickHandler>Paran</jLink></jLink></jLink>, showing glory and power. He sent plague and pestilence, shook the mountains, enraged the seas, and sent river torrents. God threshed the nations in His wrath to save His chosen people. God killed the leader of the wicked nation with his own spear. Despite all of the frightening chaos and devastation around <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2265' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2265' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2265' clickHandler>Habakkuk</jLink></jLink></jLink>, he will still rejoice in God, who strengthens him.

During the reign of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2977G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2977G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2977G' clickHandler>Josiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> as King of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, God spoke to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6846H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6846H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6846H' clickHandler>Zephaniah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God will destroy men, animals, birds, and fish. God will punish the land of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> for its idolatry and rejection of God. The Day of God is near. God has prepared a sacrifice and consecrated His invited. On God's day of sacrifice, He will punish the princes, the king's sons, those in foreign clothes, idolaters, merchants, and those who are complacent. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be plundered and destroyed. God's day will be a day of gloomy wrath and death. God will quickly kill everybody on earth.

If the Israelites humble themselves, do what God commands, and seek righteousness, then maybe God will spare them on Judgement Day. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6429' clickHandler>Philistia</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be destroyed, including <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler>Gaza</jLink></jLink></jLink>, Achod, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6138' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6138' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6138' clickHandler>Ekron</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3667G' clickHandler>Canaan</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and their lands will belong to the remnant of the Israelites. Because <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4124H' clickHandler>Moab</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5983' clickHandler>Ammon</jLink></jLink></jLink> threatened and mocked the Israelites, God will destroy them and turn their land into salt pits and wastelands forever, which the remnant of the Israelites will own and plunder. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3568A' clickHandler>Cush</jLink></jLink></jLink> will also fall by the sword. God will destroy <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink>, turning <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler>Nineveh</jLink></jLink></jLink> into a desolate, desert home for wild animals. Everyone will scoff at their fall.

Woe to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> she ignores God's correction, her rulers are ravenous, her prophets are treacherous, her priests defile the Temple and twist the Law. God is in her (<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>) giving righteous justice everyday, but He is ignored. God though that she would see how He dealt with other evil nations and thus fear God, but they ignore God's correction. Therefore, God will pour out His wrath on all nations, consuming them all to purify them, and make them all yield into worshiping God together. Even from far away people will come to worship God. At that time, God will have purged the sinful people from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and so the punishment will end. The remnant left behind will do no wrong and will faithfully serve God as their king. God will take delight in the Israelites. He will remove their burdens, and give them praise and honor world-wide. Their fortunes will be restored.

God gave a message to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2292A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2292A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2292A' clickHandler>Haggai</jLink></jLink></jLink> to give to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler>Zerubbabel</jLink></jLink></jLink> (the governor of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>) on the first day of the sixth month of the second year of King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler>Darius</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God marvels that the people have not understood why they are suffering; with insufficient harvests, poor clothing, lack of financial success, and drought. They have chosen to rebuild their own houses, meanwhile neglecting the rebuilding of the Temple, so God has been punishing them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler>Zerubbabel</jLink></jLink></jLink> and all of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> obeyed God's request, and began working on the Temple on the twenty-fourth day of the sixth month. God was with them, and stirred up their spirits.

God gave a message to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2292A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2292A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2292A' clickHandler>Haggai</jLink></jLink></jLink> to give to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler>Zerubbabel</jLink></jLink></jLink> on the twenty-first day of the seventh month of the second year of King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler>Darius</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God encourages them to work hard on the Temple. God is with them, His Spirit is among them, and He is keeping the covenant given during the Exodus. Soon, God will “shake” all of the nations, and select people from all nations will give silver and gold to the Temple to bestow it with glory. This Temple will be even more spectacular than the one <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H8010' clickHandler>Solomon</jLink></jLink></jLink> had built. God will grant peace from the Temple. God gave a message to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2292A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2292A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2292A' clickHandler>Haggai</jLink></jLink></jLink> to give to the priests on the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month. Before the Temple reconstruction began, God afflicted them with blight, mildew, and hail because they ignored His Temple. However, now that they have started the reconstruction, God will bless them. God gave a message to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2292A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2292A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2292A' clickHandler>Haggai</jLink></jLink></jLink> to give to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler>Zerubbabel</jLink></jLink></jLink> on the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month. God will cause great destruction to foreign kingdoms. At that time, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler>Zerubbabel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be God's chosen king.

God gave a message to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler>Zechariah</jLink></jLink></jLink> on the eighth month of the second year of King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler>Darius</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God was angry with the Israelites' forefathers. If the Israelites return to God, He will return to them. Their forefathers were destroyed for their evil deeds. The Israelites heard <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler>Zechariah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and repented. God gave a message to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler>Zechariah</jLink></jLink></jLink> on the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month of the second year of King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler>Darius</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler>Zechariah</jLink></jLink></jLink> had a vision of a man riding a red horse, followed by red, brown, and white horses. They had ridden throughout the world and found it at peace. God had punished <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> for 70 years. God was jealous for <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Zion, and was angry to find the other nations feeling secure. God declared that He would return to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, rebuild the Temple, and grant the Israelites overflowing prosperity. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler>Zechariah</jLink></jLink></jLink> saw the four horns (nations) which had scattered <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Next he saw four craftsmen overturn the four horns.

In his vision, Zechariah saw a man about to measure <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but God stopped the man because <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be so big, so full of men and livestock, that God will be a wall of fire around it, and its internal glory. God calls the diaspora of Israelites back home. He will send an angel to punish nations which have harmed the Israelites, and those nations will be pillaged. God will live among the Israelites. Many nations will worship God and become His people. God will inherit Judah and live in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

In his vision, Zechariah saw the high priest <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> standing in front of God and Satan. God rebuked Satan, and called <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> a “burning stick snatched from the fire.” <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s clothes were filthy, so God had some angels give <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> clean cloths. God told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> that He had taken away <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s sins, and clothed him richly. God then said if <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> obeys the Law, then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> will run the Temple and have access to God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> and his associates are a sign of the times, because God will soon bring the Branch, God's prophesied servant. God set a stone with 7 eyes in front of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and God will remove the sins of this land in one day. At that time, everyone will be friendly neighbors.

In his vision, Zechariah saw a gold lampstand with seven lights, and seven channels to the lights. There was an olive tree on both left and right sides of the lampstand. God gave a message to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler>Zerubbabel</jLink></jLink></jLink>: what will happen will happen through God's Spirit. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2216' clickHandler>Zerubbabel</jLink></jLink></jLink> will build the Temple from start to finish. The seven eyes of God rejoice to see the Temple reconstruction. The two olive trees are the two people anointed to serve God.

In his vision, Zechariah saw a large flying scroll with curses banishing thieves and everyone who swears falsely, which will destroy thieves and those who swear falsely. In his vision, Zechariah saw a measuring basket full of sin and wickedness of all of the land in the form of a woman. Two flying, stork-winged women flew the basket between heaven and earth, to ultimately set the basket in Babylonia.

In his vision, Zechariah saw four chariots emerging from two mountains of bronze. God is sending these four chariots in four different directions. The chariot which had black horses went north, and there they gave God's Spirit rest. God told Zechariah to take gold given by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2469G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2469G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2469G' clickHandler>Heldai</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2900J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2900J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2900J' clickHandler>Tobijah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3048J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3048J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3048J' clickHandler>Jedaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and turn it into a crown to be set on <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s head. Then Zechariah is to tell <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> that he is the Branch, and he will build the Temple and be a priest on his throne in harmony. The crown will be a memorial in the Temple. People from far away will help build the Temple. This will come true if <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3091J' clickHandler>Joshua</jLink></jLink></jLink> obeys God.

God gave a message to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148v' clickHandler>Zechariah</jLink></jLink></jLink> on the fourth day of the ninth month of the fourth year of King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1867H' clickHandler>Darius</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The people inquired of God if they should continue to mourn for the Temple's destruction. God reminds them that He had asked their ancestors to provide justice by obeying the Law, mercy, and compassion, to not oppress widows, orphans, aliens, or the poor, and to not think evil of each other. However, their ancestors ignored God, so God ignored their cries, exiled them from the Promised Land, and scattered them in foreign nations.

God is jealous for Zion. God will live in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, which will then be called the City of Truth on the Holy Mountain. Old people and children will again be seen in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God will bring the remnant back to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. He will be their God, and they will be His people. Be strong in rebuilding the Temple. God will stop punishing the Israelites, and will instead bless them with abundant harvests. They will be a blessing to other nations. They need to speak truth, give fair judgements, not plot evil, not swear falsely, and love truth and peace. People from many foreign nations will go to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> to inquire of God.

God will apply His wrath to the land of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2317' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2317' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2317' clickHandler>Hadrach</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler>Damascus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2574G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2574G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H2574G' clickHandler>Hamath</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6865' clickHandler>Tyre</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6721G' clickHandler>Sidon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0831' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0831' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0831' clickHandler>Ashkelon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5804' clickHandler>Gaza</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6138' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6138' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6138' clickHandler>Ekron</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and Ashnod. The only ones left will be those who worship God, and they will go to Judah. God will now defend Zion. Never again will the Israelites be oppressed. Zion's humble, righteous, saved king comes riding on a colt of a donkey. God will grant peace, and the king will proclaim peace to nations and rule from the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6578' clickHandler>Euphrates</jLink></jLink></jLink> to the western ends of the earth. God will free the Israelite prisoners and slaves, returning them home to restore and bless them. God will send the restored Israelite nation to attack the Greeks, and they will defeat the Greeks quickly and powerfully while being protected by God. The Israelites will be attractive to God.

Consult with God instead of deceitful idols and lying diviners. The people are like sheep without a shepherd. God is angry with the present shepherds, the leaders. God will care for His flock, the people of Judah. The foundation of everything will come from Judah, including all future rulers. Judah will have a mighty military because God is with them. God will restore Judah and Ephriam as though He had not rejected them. God will signal and redeem them, and gather them back. When they return, there will be so many there that there will not be room for them all. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0804G' clickHandler>Assyria</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be destroyed in the process of the Israelites returning.

<jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3844G' clickHandler>Lebanon</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be burned, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1316' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1316' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1316' clickHandler>Bashan</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be cut down, and the thicket of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3383' clickHandler>Jordan</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be ruined. God had marked the Israelites as a flock for slaughter. Previously, God had pastured them with Favor and Union, but they had unsuitable shepherds and went astray, so God broke Favor with them. God left it up to them to decide if paying God respect was worth anything, and they, in turn, chose to pay only a minuscule amount. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> God broke Union, and thus the people of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink> were separated from the people of Judah. Then God gave them a worthless shepherd to be their leader.

Judah and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be besieged by all the nations of earth. However, God will make them undefeatable. Those nations attacking the Israelites will hurt themselves, their horses will be blinded and panic, and their riders will go insane. Judah's leaders will realize that this is because of God, and will subsequently thrash all of their attackers. God will protect all the Israelites on that day, but He will destroy the attacking nations. Then God will give the Israelites a spirit of grace and supplication, and each of the Israelite clans will mourn for how they have mistreated God in the past.

At that time a fountain will be opened to cleanse the Israelites from sin and impurity. Also, God will remove all idols and prophets from the land. Anyone who prophesies will be killed by their own parents. Prophets will lie about having been prophets. God will strike down a shepherd close to Him and kill 2/3 of all the people in the world. The remaining 1/3 will worship Him, and He will be their God and they will be His people.

The Day of God is coming, when plunder will be divided up among the Israelites. God will gather every nation to fight against <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Half of the city will be ransacked; its people exiled and its women raped, but half of the people will remain. Then God will fight against all of those nations with an incredibly strong army. That day will be without light, cold, frost, daytime, or nighttime, with light in the evening. Then living water will flow from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and God will be king over the entire earth. The whole land will become like <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6160G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6160G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6160G' clickHandler>Arabah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be intact and raised up. It will never again be desolate or destroyed. God will send a plague of rotting flesh to all of the nations which attacked <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> which will affect men and animals, and they will all panic and attack each other. Judah will fight, and will pillage the wealth of all of the surrounding nations. The survivors will worship God as King on a yearly basis, celebrating the Feast of Tabernacles. If they do not, God will give them no rain. “Holy to the Lord” will be inscribed on every horse bell and cooking pot in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and Judah. No Canaanite will be in God's house.

God spoke through <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4401' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4401' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4401' clickHandler>Malachi</jLink></jLink></jLink>. God says that He has loved <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2384G' clickHandler>Jacob</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but hated <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6215G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6215G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H6215G' clickHandler>Esau</jLink></jLink></jLink>, which is why the land of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink> is laid waste. <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H0123G' clickHandler>Edom</jLink></jLink></jLink> may rebuild, but they will always be under God's wrath, proving God's great power to the Israelites. God says that the priests have shown contempt for God by offering diseased and crippled animals. God will not accept their offerings. God's name will be great among the nations, and every place will burn incense and sacrifice pure offerings in God's name. People who cheat on offerings are cursed. God is a great king, to be feared by the nations.

Because the priests have not honored God, God will spread dung from their offerings on their faces. The priest will be despised and humiliated for breaking the covenant God had made with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3878' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3878' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3878' clickHandler>Levi</jLink></jLink></jLink> and for not perfectly obeying God's Law. This admonition will come so that the covenant God had made with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3878' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3878' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3878' clickHandler>Levi</jLink></jLink></jLink> can be preserved. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3063G' clickHandler>Judah</jLink></jLink></jLink> has broken faith by worshiping a foreign god. This is why God no longer listens to them or accepts their offerings. They have disturbed God by claiming that God is pleased with people who do evil, or by questioning where God's justice is.

A messenger will prepare the way for God. Then God will suddenly appear in the Temple. When the Day of God comes, He will purge out any Levites who sin. Then God will have men who bring acceptable offerings in righteousness just like in prior times. God will condemn sinners who do not fear Him. God does not change, so the Israelites will survive. If they return to Him by giving the whole tithe, then God will richly bless them, and all other nations will consider them blessed. God promises that they will again see the distinction between those who righteously serve God and those who do not.

God's Day is coming. God will burn all sinners. The righteous Israelites will trample the wicked people. Obey God's Law. Before God's dreadful Day, God will send <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0452G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0452G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0452G' clickHandler>Elijah</jLink></jLink></jLink> to turn peoples hearts to their families. If their hearts do not change, God will curse the land.

There is a family lineage of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, starting with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink>, continuing through Kind <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> and on to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler>Joseph</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3137G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3137G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3137G' clickHandler>Mary</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s husband. There were 14 generations from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink> to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>, 14 from <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> to the Jewish Exile, and 14 from the Exile to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3137G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3137G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3137G' clickHandler>Mary</jLink></jLink></jLink> was married to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler>Joseph</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but became pregnant before they had had sex. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler>Joseph</jLink></jLink></jLink> was going to divorce her, but an angel told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler>Joseph</jLink></jLink></jLink> in a dream that the Holy Spirit had impregnated <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3137G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3137G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3137G' clickHandler>Mary</jLink></jLink></jLink> with a boy who will be called <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, because He will save people from their sins. This would fulfill a prophesy that a virgin would have a child called Immanuel, meaning “God with us.”

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was born in Bethlehem in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler>Judea</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Magi from the <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6924A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6924A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H6924A' clickHandler>East</jLink></jLink></jLink> came to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> looking for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the king of the Jews, to worship Him because they had seen the star (an astrological sign) of His arrival. Upon hearing about this, King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked the Jewish Elders about the prophesied king. They said the king was to be born in Bethlehem. King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> inquired of the Magi when the astrological sign was shown, and then told them to find the child and report back to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> so that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> too could worship the new king. The Magi left, and they followed as the star, which they had observed, moved and led them to the baby <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. There, they worshiped Him and gave Him gifts. The Magi then went home, avoiding <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> because they had been warned in a dream to do so. An angel then told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler>Joseph</jLink></jLink></jLink> in a dream to take his family to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> because otherwise <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> would kill <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, so he took his family to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink>, leaving in the middle of the night. This fulfills the prophesy of when God said “Out of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4714H' clickHandler>Egypt</jLink></jLink></jLink> I have called My Son.” King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink>, angered by the non-returning Magi, ordered the slaughter of all boys two years old or younger in Bethlehem. This fulfills <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3414L' clickHandler>Jeremiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s prophesy about <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7354' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7354' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7354' clickHandler>Rachel</jLink></jLink></jLink> weeping for her children. After <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264G' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> had died, an angel told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler>Joseph</jLink></jLink></jLink> in a dream to return to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but was warned in another dream to avoid <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler>Judea</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler>Joseph</jLink></jLink></jLink> took the family and settled in the district of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler>Galilee</jLink></jLink></jLink> in the town of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3478' clickHandler>Nazareth</jLink></jLink></jLink>. This fulfilled the prophesy that Messiah would be called a Nazarene.

Sometime later, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist (wandering in the Desert of Judah, clad in camel hair, and eating locusts and honey) began preaching for people to repent, because the Kingdom of Heaven was near. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist fulfilled <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s prophesy about a voice in the desert preparing the way for God. People sought out <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist, confessed their sins to him, and were baptized by him.
