He scorned the Pharisees and Sadducees who came to him for trying to flee the coming wrath, and warned them to do good works. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist claimed that he baptized with water for repentance, but a more powerful one will baptize people with the Holy Spirit and fire, and that this powerful one was ready to dole out wrath on unrepentant people. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> came to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist to be baptized. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist did not know why he should baptized <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but he did so on <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' request. The moment <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> emerged from the water, the Holy Spirit descended on Him, and God spoke from Heaven, saying that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was His Son.

Then the Holy Spirit led <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to the desert, where He fasted for 40 days. At the end of the fasting, the Devil told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to turn some rocks into bread, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that Scripture tells us that man lives by every word from God. The Devil took <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to the top of the Temple in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> and told Him to jump off because it is written that God's angels would protect Him, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that it is also written not to test God. The Devil then took <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> up to a high mountain where He could see all the kingdoms of the world, and the Devil offered to give the kingdoms to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> if He would worship the Devil, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied for Satan to leave Him, because it is written that you should only worship God. Satan left, and angels then took care of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. John the Baptist got put into prison. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> left, and moved to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2584' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2584' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2584' clickHandler>Capernaum</jLink></jLink></jLink> in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler>Galilee</jLink></jLink></jLink>, near <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler>Zebulun</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler>Naphtali</jLink></jLink></jLink>, which fulfilled <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s prophesy about the lands of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2074' clickHandler>Zebulun</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5321G' clickHandler>Naphtali</jLink></jLink></jLink> seeing a great light. There <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> began preaching for people to repent, because the Kingdom of Heaven was near. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told fishermen Simon (a.k.a. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink>), Simon's brother <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0406' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0406' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0406' clickHandler>Andrew</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2199G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2199G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2199G' clickHandler>Zebedee</jLink></jLink></jLink> brothers <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2385G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2385G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2385G' clickHandler>James</jLink></jLink></jLink> and John, to follow Him, and they immediately did so. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> went throughout <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler>Galilee</jLink></jLink></jLink>, teaching, preaching, and healing. All sorts of ill and demon-possessed people sought Him for healing, and His fame attracted large crowds who followed Him.

When <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> saw the crowds, He went up on a mountain, sat down, and began teaching His disciples. He said: Those who hunger for and pursue God's righteousness in humility, even despite persecution, are blessed and they will be rewarded. The merciful, the pure of heart, and the peacemakers will be rewarded too. People who are persecuted because of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> will be greatly rewarded. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' disciples are the salt and light of the world, so they need to do good and be seen doing good. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> has come to fulfill the Law and the Prophets, not abolish them. His disciples should obey the Law, and teach others to do the same. Unless they are more righteous than the Pharisees, they will not enter the Kingdom of Heaven. If you are angry with someone, or call someone foolish, you are in danger of being condemned to Hell. Therefore, reconcile any disputes before making an offering to God. Settling matters quickly will save you from prison or fines. Looking at a woman lustfully is the same as adultery. It is better to remove the sinful parts of your body then to go to Hell with a whole body. Any man who divorces his wife, except for cases of adultery, causes her to commit adultery. Any man who marries a divorced woman commits adultery. Do not swear oaths, as doing so is Satanic. Do not seek justice for transgressions against you, but rather let people mistreat you. Give to anyone who asks you for anything. Love and pray for your enemies.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> continued: Do not do acts of righteousness to be praised by men, but instead go out of your way to do them secretly, and then you will be rewarded by God. Also, pray secretly in order to be rewarded. In prayer, do not babble and chant endlessly, because God already knows your needs. Simply pray for forgiveness, sustenance, protection from Satan, the coming of God's Kingdom, and God's will to be done. Forgive others to be forgiven by God. When you fast, do not show that you are fasting, because then God will reward you. Do not store monetary or materialistic wealth, but instead store treasures in Heaven. If you are focused on Heaven, then you will be full of light. But if you focus on the wealth of this world, you will come to love money and hate God. Do not worry about having food, drink, or clothing, but instead pursue God's Kingdom and righteousness, and God will ensure that you have what you need. Do not even worry about saving for tomorrow.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> continued: Do not be hypocritical when you judge, because you will be held to the same standard. Do not share sacred knowledge with intractable sinners. Ask God for what you need, and He will give it to you, like any good father would do for his children. You can sum up the Law and the Prophets as this: Do to others what you would have them do to you. Most people will be destroyed because they will not walk the narrow road which leads to life. Beware of false prophets. You will know them by whether or not they do good deeds. Not everyone who calls on <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> will enter the Kingdom of Heaven. That day many people who even prophesied, exorcised, and performed miracles in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' name will be turned away for their evil deeds. Those who do what <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> says to do will endure, but those who do not obey will be destroyed. The crowds were amazed at the authority of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' teaching.

Coming down from the mountain, the crowds followed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. He was approached by a man with leprosy, begging for healing. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> immediately cured him and told him not to tell anyone, and to make an offering according to the Law. Upon arriving in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2584' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2584' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2584' clickHandler>Capernaum</jLink></jLink></jLink>, a centurion asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to heal his paralyzed servant, but not to bother coming to the centurion's unworthy house to perform the healing. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was astonished in the centurion's faith that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> could perform a remote healing, a faith unmatched by any Jew. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that because of this lack of faith, the Jews will be rejected from the Kingdom of Heaven, and Gentiles will take their places. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> then healed the centurion's servant remotely. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> went to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s house, and healed his ill mother-in-law. That evening, many ill and demon-possessed came to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> and were healed, thereby fulfilling <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s prophesy about the Messiah carrying peoples infirmities and diseases. When the crowd gathered around <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, He prepared to go to the other side of the lake. A Teacher of the Law offered to follow <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> warned that He is going to be continuously on the move. Another disciple asked if he could bury his father before following <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied to him that he should follow <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> and let the dead bury their dead. While <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> and His disciples were crossing the lake, a storm threatened to drown them all, so the disciples panicked. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> rebuked them for having little faith, and then (to their amazement) calmed the storm with commands. Arriving on the other side of the lake, two demon-possessed men yelled at <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> for coming to torture them before the appointed time, and begged to be cast out into a herd of swine. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> sent them into the swine herd, and the herd immediately committed suicide by drowning in the lake. The pig tenders and the rest of the town asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to leave their region.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> crossed the lake over to His own town (either <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2584' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2584' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2584' clickHandler>Capernaum</jLink></jLink></jLink> or <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3478' clickHandler>Nazareth</jLink></jLink></jLink>). When men brought a paralytic man to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, he told the paralytic man that his sins were forgiven. The Teachers of the Law thought that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> had blasphemed. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> then told the paralytic man to get up and walk, which the man did. This proved that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> had the authority to forgive sins. The crowd praised God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told the tax collector <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3156' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3156' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3156' clickHandler>Matthew</jLink></jLink></jLink> to follow Him, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3156' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3156' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3156' clickHandler>Matthew</jLink></jLink></jLink> did so. While at <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3156' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3156' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3156' clickHandler>Matthew</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s house eating dinner, the Pharisees protested because <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was eating with sinners. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told the Pharisees that the sick are the ones who need a doctor, that they should learn that God desires mercy, not sacrifice, and that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> has come to call the sinners, not the righteous. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist's disciples asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> why <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' disciples did not fast, to which <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that they will fast when <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> is taken from them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that nobody patches old clothes with new fabric, or puts new wine into old wineskins, because the old fabric would be torn again and the old wineskins would burst. While <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that, a ruler arrived and then pleaded for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to come resurrect his recently dead daughter. While headed to heal the ruler's daughter, a hemorrhaging woman touched <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' cloak in the hope of being healed by it. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> turned to the woman and told her that her faith has healed her. When <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> arrived at the ruler's house, He grabbed the ruler's daughter's hand, which brought her back to life. News spread of the resurrection in that region. Departing from there, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was confronted by two blind men who believed that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> could heal them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> did heal them by touching their eyes, but told them to keep it a secret. The blind men told everybody anyway. As the formerly-blind men were leaving, a mute, demon-possessed man was brought to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> promptly cast out the demon, which impressed the crowd but caused the Pharisees to accuse <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> of using Satan's power. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, with His disciples, traveled throughout the towns of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler>Galilee</jLink></jLink></jLink> preaching, teaching, and healing these “sheep without a shepherd.” <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told His disciples to ask God for more harvesters (metaphorical) for these people.

The Twelve Disciples were <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4613G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4613G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4613G' clickHandler>Simon</jLink></jLink></jLink> (<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink>), <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0406' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0406' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0406' clickHandler>Andrew</jLink></jLink></jLink>, James, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491H' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G5376G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G5376G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G5376G' clickHandler>Philip</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0918' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0918' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0918' clickHandler>Bartholomew</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2381' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2381' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2381' clickHandler>Thomas</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3156' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3156' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3156' clickHandler>Matthew</jLink></jLink></jLink>, James, Thaddaeus, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4613G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4613G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4613G' clickHandler>Simon</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and Judas Iscariot. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> gave them authority to exorcise demons and heal all illnesses, and sent them out on a mission with the following instructions: Go to the Jews, not the Gentiles, telling them that the Kingdom of Heaven is near, and healing, resurrecting, and exorcising demons freely. Let the people you help care for your needs. If a town or individual household will not listen to you, shake its dust off your sandals, because that place will be condemned on the Day of Judgement. Be shrewd, but innocent. Guard against hostile men. If you are brought before the authorities, God will speak through you in your defence. Family members will betray other family members to death, but standing firm will yield Salvation. If you are persecuted, flee to another place. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> will come before they are done going through the towns of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3478' clickHandler>Israel</jLink></jLink></jLink>. People will call them Satanic, just like <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was called Satanic. Do not be afraid of those people. All will be revealed, so speak boldly, afraid only of God, who can throw you into Hell. Besides, God controls all death and has designed you in every detail. Either publicly acknowledge <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, or be rejected in Heaven. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> did not come to bring peace, but rather to turn family members against each other. If you love your family more than <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, you are not worthy of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. If you lose your life for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, you gain Salvation, but try to preserve your life and you will lose your Salvation. Someone who receives you, receives <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> and will be rewarded. Anyone who gives a cold cup of water to “little ones” will not lose his reward.

After sending out the Twelve Disciples, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> taught and preached in the towns of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler>Galilee</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist heard of this while he was in prison, and sent some of his disciples to ask <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> if He was the awaited Messiah. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied for the disciples to tell <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist about how <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was healing and resurrecting people, as well as teaching the poor, and to say that men who do not reject God because of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> are blessed. As <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist's disciples were leaving, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told the crowd that they went to see <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist because he is a great prophet, but he is also the one prophesied to prepare the way before God; <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0452G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0452G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0452G' clickHandler>Elijah</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Yet even the best man on earth is lesser than anyone in the Kingdom of Heaven, so bold men are doing whatever they can to enter the Kingdom of Heaven. This generation is like a bunch of fickle children; claiming that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist is demon-possessed and calling <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> (the Son of Man) a drunken glutton whose friends are sinners and tax collectors, but wisdom is proven by actions. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> denounced Korazin, <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G0966' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G0966' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G0966' clickHandler>Bethsaida</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2584' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2584' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2584' clickHandler>Capernaum</jLink></jLink></jLink> for not repenting despite His miracles, proclaiming that they will receive unbearable punishment on the Day of Judgement. At that time <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> praised God the Father for hiding the true knowledge of God from those who think that they have everything figured out. God the Father is only revealed to whomever <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> chooses. You should come to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> because His burden is light and He will give you rest for your soul.

At that time <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> and His disciples walked through grainfields on the Sabbath, and His disciples picked and ate some grain. Pharisees saw this and said that they were breaking the Law. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that when <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> was hungry, he broke the Law and ate sacred bread, that Priests break the Law by working on the Sabbath, and that they should learn that God desires mercy, not sacrifice. Besides, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> is the ruler of the Sabbath. From there, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> went to the synagogue belonging to those Pharisees, where <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath, and then healed a man with a shriveled hand in front of them. This made them plot to kill <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> fled because He was aware of their plot. He healed those who followed Him. This fulfilled <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s prophesy regarding God putting His spirit on His servant, who would peacefully proclaim justice to the nations. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> exorcised the demon in a blind, mute man, but the Pharisees claimed that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> did this through Beelzebub's (Satan's) power. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them that if Satan is casting out demons, then Satan's kingdom will not stand, and asked them by whose power they perform exorcisms. If <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> is casting out <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> by God's Spirit, then the Kingdom of God is here. Besides, who can rob a strong man without tying up the strong man? Anyone not supporting <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> is against Him. Blaspheming God's Spirit is the one unforgivable sin. Good people are known by the good they do, and likewise with evil people like the Pharisees. People will be held accountable on the Day of Judgement for every careless word they have said, and acquitted or condemned accordingly. Then some Pharisees and Teachers of the Law asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to perform a miracle, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them that only a wicked generation asks for a sign, and that no sign will be given other than <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> being in the “heart of the earth” for three days and nights. The repentant men of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5210' clickHandler>Nineveh</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the Queen of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7614J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7614J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H7614J' clickHandler>Sheba</jLink></jLink></jLink> will condemn this generation. This generation will be like a man who had a demon exorcised from him, only to have the demon come back to inhabit that man along with seven more-wicked spirits. While <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was speaking to the crowd, someone informed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' mother and brothers were outside waiting to speak to Him, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that His real family are His disciples; people who obey the will of God the Father.

That same day, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> sat in a boat on the lake shore while a crowd gathered. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> gave a parable where a farmer indiscriminately sowed seeds in different places, but ultimately only the seeds sown in good soil produced any substantial crop. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' disciples asked Him why He spoke to the crowds in parables. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that only certain people, like the disciples, will be given knowledge of the Kingdom of Heaven, but the crowds are not chosen to receive that knowledge, and these crowds will even lose whatever they have. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that He speaks in parables so that these crowds will not understand, which was according to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s prophesy about people hearing and seeing without understanding or perceiving. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> called His disciples blessed for hearing and seeing, and then explained that in the parable, the different places where the seeds were sown represent different reactions to God's word; Satan robs some people of understanding, others are joyous at first but soon falter in following God due to persecution, others are joyous at first but get distracted by life and seduced by money, and meanwhile those who truly hear and understand God's word produce good works. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told the crowd another parable. The Kingdom of Heaven is like a farmer who sowed wheat in a field, but his enemy secretly sowed weeds in that same field. The farmer, not wanting to damage the wheat, let the weeds grow too until harvest time. The farmer then first collected the weeds and burned them, and then next collected the wheat. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told the crowd a couple more parables; one that the Kingdom of Heaven was like a tiny mustard seed which grew into a large plant, the other that the Kingdom of Heaven is like yeast mixed into a large amount of dough. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> did not say anything to the crowd except parables, which fulfilled the prophesy about God speaking in parables to reveal hidden things. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> left the crowd and, at the request of the disciples, explained the parable about the wheat and the weeds. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was the farmer, the wheat seeds were the “sons of the Kingdom,” the field was the world, Satan was the enemy and the weeds were Satan's sons, and at the “end of the age” everything that causes sin and everyone who does evil will be gathered up by angels and burned in the furnace where they will suffer, and then the righteous will shine. The Kingdom of Heaven is worth giving up all you that have now to get it, like a treasure in a field or a great pearl. The Kingdom of Heaven at the “end of the age” will be like a big fishing net, where angels will separate out the good fish (the righteous) from the bad fish (the wicked), casting the bad ones into the furnace where they will suffer. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' disciples understood these parables, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that those instructed about the Law and the Kingdom of Heaven will bring forth both old and new treasures. After speaking these parables, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> went to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3478' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3478' clickHandler>Nazareth</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but He did not do many miracles there because of their lack of faith, because prophets are not honored in their home towns.

When <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> heard about <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> working miracles, he thought that it was <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist who had come back to life. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> had put <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist in prison for speaking out against <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> marrying his brother's wife, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler>Herodias</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Then, recently <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> had <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist decapitated due to a hasty oath given to the daughter of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler>Herodias</jLink></jLink></jLink> for dancing so pleasurably. Pharisees and Teachers of the Law from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> why His disciples did not wash their hands before they had eaten. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked them why they break God's Law by teaching that disobedient children should not be put to death, and said that they are a fulfillment of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s prophesy of a people who only worship God with the mouths, not their hearts, and who teach rules made by men. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told the surrounding crowd that it is only what comes out of a man's mouth that makes him unclean, not what he eats. The Pharisees sent their disciples and some Herodians to trap <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. They asked Him if it was right to pay taxes to Caesar. He replied that Caesar's inscription is on the coins, so they should give Caesar what belongs to him, and give to God what belongs to God. Later that day, some Sadducees (who did not believe in resurrection) asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> if a woman is married to multiple men throughout her life, who will she be married to at the resurrection. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them that people, like angels, will not be married at the resurrection, and further explained that they misunderstand the Scriptures, because there will be a resurrection. The Pharisees then sent a Law expert to ask <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> which is the greatest commandment. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that it is to love God, and the second is to love your neighbor as yourself, because the entire Law is built on these two commandments. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> then corrected the Pharisees in their misunderstanding that the Messiah was to be the son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that people must obey the Pharisees and Teachers of the Law, but the people should not be hypocrites like them. The Pharisees and Teachers of the Law love the esteem which they get from men, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' followers are to call nobody "father" except God, and call nobody "teacher" other than the Messiah. The greatest person will be one who becomes a humble servant. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> then condemned the Pharisees and Teachers of the Law to Hell because they prevent people from entering the Kingdom of Heaven, they go to great lengths bring people to God but then mislead them, they do not understand the ramifications of swearing by Holy objects, they follow the minute details of the Law but do not practice justice, mercy, and faithfulness, they worry about the cleanliness of their dishes when they have greed and self-indulgence on their own insides, and they appear to be righteous but are full of hypocrisy and wickedness. They claim that they would not have persecuted God's prophets in the earlier times, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> will send out prophets who they will persecute and kill, thereby proving them to be hypocrites and casting on them blood guilt from back to that of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1893' clickHandler>Abel</jLink></jLink></jLink> up to that of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148w' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148w' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H2148w' clickHandler>Zechariah</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and this all will happen to this generation. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> then mourned for <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, because He had tried many times to gather them, but they were not willing. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> will leave them until they are welcoming to someone who comes in God's name.

As <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was leaving the Temple, He told His disciples that every stone of the Temple would be thrown down. At the Mount of Olives, His disciples asked Him what signs would there be of His Second Coming and the end of the age. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that there would be many false Messiahs who would mislead many people, and there would be wars, famines, and earthquakes in the beginning of the end. Then the disciples will be persecuted and put to death, and many of the faith will fall away and turn on each other, and false prophets will deceive many, but those who stand firm until the end will be Saved. The Gospel will be taught to the whole world, and then the end will come. When you see the abomination in the Temple which was prophesied by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1840G' clickHandler>Daniel</jLink></jLink></jLink>, you should flee immediately, because there will then come a time of distress which is greater than any in history or any yet to come. In fact, if God did not plan on shortening those days for the Elect, nobody would survive. Do not believe the false prophets and their miraculous signs, who would deceive even the Elect if that was possible. By contrast, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> will come back like lightening; seen by everyone.
