It is then that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> will appear in the sky, with great power and glory. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' angels will then gather the Elect. Just like you know that summer is near when leaves sprout on a fig tree, so will these signs show you that the end is imminent. All of these things will happen during this generation. Only God knows the exact day and hour when <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> will return. His return will take people by surprise, just like the flood of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> surprised people back then. Therefore, you should be in constant readiness and should keep your deeds righteous, because if <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> comes back to find you acting wickedly, He will cast you out with the hypocrites.

At that time, the Kingdom of Heaven will be like this: Ten virgins grabbed some oil lamps to await their bridegroom. Five of them thought to bring extra oil in case they needed it. The bridegroom took a long time coming, so the five without extra oil ran out of it by the time he showed up. They went to buy more oil, but while they were gone the five with the extra oil went into the wedding banquet with the bridegroom. Those late virgins were then rejected when they finally got to the banquet. The Kingdom of Heaven will also be like this: A master, who was going on a trip, entrusted different amounts of money to each of his three servants according to their abilities. By the time the master returned, two of the servants had doubled the money, and so the master rewarded their productivity. However, the third servant had only hidden the entrusted money away for safe keeping, so he returned only what the master had given to him. The master was angry with this servant, called him lazy for not putting the money in the bank to gain interest, took the money from the "lazy" servant and gave it to the richest servant, and tossed the "lazy" servant out into the darkness. When <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> comes back, He will judge everyone. Those people who were generous, friendly to strangers, and compassionately caring will be granted eternal life. Those people who were not generous, friendly to strangers, and compassionately caring will receive eternal punishment.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> then told His disciples that Passover was two days away, and He would be crucified. The High Priest, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2533G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2533G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2533G' clickHandler>Caiaphas</jLink></jLink></jLink>, met with other Priests and Elders to have <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> arrested and killed, but they did not want to do so during the Feast for fear that the people might riot. At <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4613I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4613I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4613I' clickHandler>Simon</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Leper's house in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G0963' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G0963' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G0963' clickHandler>Bethany</jLink></jLink></jLink>, a woman poured expensive perfume on <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' head. His disciples gawked at the waste of money which could have been given to the poor. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that the poor would always be around, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> would soon be gone, and her anointing has prepared Him for burial. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler>Judas</jLink></jLink></jLink> Iscariot went to the Chief Priests and worked out a deal to hand over <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> for arrest for thirty silver coins. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told His disciples to prepare the Passover feast at a certain man's house. While they were eating the Passover Feast, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> announced that one of the Twelve Disciples would betray Him, and while <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' life must fulfill prophesy, woe will be to the one who betrays Him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> confirmed to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler>Judas</jLink></jLink></jLink> that it was him who would betray <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> broke bread and distributed it, calling it His body. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> took a glass of wine and passed it around, calling it His blood, and said He would not drink wine again until doing so in the Kingdom of God. They all sang a hymn and then went to the Mount of Olives. There, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told His disciples that they would fall away from Him that night. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that he would never fall away, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told him that he would disown <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> three times before the rooster crowed. Then they all went to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G1068' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G1068' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G1068' clickHandler>Gethsemane</jLink></jLink></jLink>. There, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> took James, John, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> to watch over Him while He prayed. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> stepped away and prayed to God to get out of His fate, if that was possible. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> came back and found three Disciples sleeping. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> chastised <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> for falling asleep. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> again stepped away to pray to escape His fate, only to come back and find the Disciples asleep again. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> again stepped away to pray to the same thing, and then He returned, awoke the Disciples, and told them that it was now time for Him to be betrayed. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler>Judas</jLink></jLink></jLink> arrived with an armed men sent by the Priests and Elders to arrest <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler>Judas</jLink></jLink></jLink> identified <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to the armed men by kissing Him. The armed men arrested <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. One of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' disciples pulled out a sword and attacked the High Priest's servant, cutting off his ear. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told that disciple to stop the attack, because He could be defended by angels if necessary, but what is happening must happen to fulfill Scriptures. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> rebuked the armed men for arresting Him like He was the leader of a rebellion. All of the disciples fled. The armed men took <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to an assembly of the Sanhedrin where the High Priest (<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2533G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2533G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2533G' clickHandler>Caiaphas</jLink></jLink></jLink>), Chief Priests, Teachers of the Law, and Elders. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink>, staying a safe distance away, followed them to find out what would happen. The Sanhedrin tried to get <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> sentenced to death, but the false witnesses did not have enough false evidence. Two witnesses said that they heard <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> say that He could destroy and rebuild the Temple of God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said nothing in His defence. The High Priest asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> if He was the Messiah, the Son of God. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> answered that He was, and in the future they would see Him at seated God's right hand and coming on the clouds. With this, they accused <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> of blasphemy, said He should die, and began mocking Him. Meanwhile, while <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> waited in the courtyard, three times people identified him as one of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' companions, but he denied knowing <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> each time. Right after the third denial, a rooster crowed, reminding <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' words, and so he wept bitterly.

With <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> sentenced to death, the Priests handed Him over to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4091' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4091' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4091' clickHandler>Pilate</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the governor. When <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455H' clickHandler>Judas</jLink></jLink></jLink> saw that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was condemned, he repented, gave back the thirty silver coins to the Priests, and then hung himself. Some people asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> why His disciples did not fast. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that they would fast when He was gone, and said that no one patches clothes with unshrunk fabric or puts new wine into old wineskins. One Sabbath, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' disciples picked grain and ate it, upsetting the Pharisees, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> reminded the Pharisees how <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink> and his companions illegally ate the consecrated bread because they were hungry. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> further told them that the Sabbath was made for man, and that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> is the Lord of the Sabbath.

In a synagogue on another Sabbath, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked the Pharisees which it was legal to do on a Sabbath: good or evil, but they did not answer. Angry at them, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> then healed a man's shriveled hand. The Pharisees and Herodians then sought out a way to kill <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> and His disciples went back to the Sea of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler>Galilee</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Crowds from all of the surrounding nations gathered to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to be healed and exorcised. The demons announced that He was the Son of God, but He told them to be quiet. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> selected twelve of His disciples, brought them up on a mountain, and appointed them as Apostles; to follow Him, to go out and preach, and to have power over demons. When <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' family arrived, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> ignored them, claiming that those who do God's will are His family.

Later, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> taught people through parables while standing in a boat just off the shore of the Sea of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler>Galilee</jLink></jLink></jLink>. He told them a parable about how a farmer who sowed seeds indiscriminately, but only the seeds which fell in good soil produced a bountiful crop. Later when <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was alone with the Twelve Disciples, He explained that the secret of the Kingdom of God is hidden from people on the outside, and so He taught in parables to keep the outsiders from understanding so that they would not repent, as it was prophesied. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> chastised them for not understanding the parable of the sower, and then explained it to them: The seed is the word of God, and for some Satan steals the word, others accept it superficially, others accept it but get distracted by the cares of this world, but some accept it and are fruitful with it. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said to the crowds: Lamps are put on stands to reveal things, so whatever is hidden will be fully disclosed. Whatever standards people judge by will be applied to them. Those who have much will be given more, but those who have little will be robbed. The Kingdom of God is like grain which grows by itself and then gets harvested. The Kingdom of God is like the tiny mustard seed which grows into the largest of garden plants. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> spoke only in parables to the outsiders, but explained the parables to the Disciples when they were alone. When they got to the other side, in Gerasenes, a man possessed with a legion of demons approached <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, yelled that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was the Son of God, and begged not to be tortured. Granting the request of the demons, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> sent them into a heard of 2000 pigs, which then drowned themselves. The people of that region asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to leave, so He did. The formerly-demon-possessed man asked to go with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but He told him to instead share his testimony of God's mercy on him. When <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> made it back to the other side of the Sea of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler>Galilee</jLink></jLink></jLink>, a synagogue ruler, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2383' clickHandler>Jairus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, pleaded with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to heal his deathly ill daughter, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> went with him. On His way to see the daughter, a woman with chronic bleeding touched <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' cloak in the hopes that it would heal her, and it did. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> turned around to identify her, and told her that her faith had healed her. While <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was speaking, men informed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2383' clickHandler>Jairus</jLink></jLink></jLink> that his daughter had died, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2383' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2383' clickHandler>Jairus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to believe, and continued on to see the girl. Once there, He took the girl's hand and told her to get up, and she did. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> strictly warned them not to tell anyone about this.

From there, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> went to His hometown, where He taught in the synagogue on the Sabbath, and people were amazed at His knowledge. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said a prophet is not honored by his family or in his hometown. He could only perform a few healing miracles there. Later, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> sent out the Twelve Disciples in pairs to preach repentance, exorcise demons, and heal people; and if any place would not receive them, they were to condemn that place. King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> had heard of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> sending the Disciples out and of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' powers, so he thought that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist resurrected, while others thought that He was <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0452G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0452G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0452G' clickHandler>Elijah</jLink></jLink></jLink> or another prophet. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> had arrested <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist for rebuking <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s marriage to his brother's wife, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler>Herodias</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler>Herodias</jLink></jLink></jLink> wanted <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist dead, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' At a birthday celebration for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler>Herodias</jLink></jLink></jLink>' daughter had danced so well for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> that he offered her anything she would ask from him, up to half the kingdom. After consulting with her mother, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2266G' clickHandler>Herodias</jLink></jLink></jLink>' daughter asked for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist's head on a platter, which <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> begrudgingly supplied. When the Disciples returned from their first mission, they reported their successes. Many people kept coming to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, so He suggested that they get away for a little while for some rest, but when they got in a boat to leave, the crowds followed them on the shore. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> felt compassion for them, and taught them much after returning to shore. It had gotten late, so the Disciples suggested to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> that He send the people away to get food. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> instead suggested that they would feed these people. He took the five loaves of bread and two fish that they had, and with them miraculously fed the five thousand men who had been there, and picked up twelve basketfuls of leftover food.. Afterward, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> sent the Disciples away by boat, dismissed the crowd, and prayed on a mountainside. By the evening, the boat was in the middle of the lake, and the Disciples were struggling against a strong wing. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> began walking across the lake, scaring the Disciples as He approached. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them not be afraid, and then climbed into the boat. The wind calmed down. The Disciples were amazed because they had not understood <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' power from the miraculous feeding. According to Jewish custom, they always ceremonially washed their hands before eating. Pharisees and Teachers of the Law from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> why His Disciples did not wash their hands. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> rebuked them, saying that as <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H3470A' clickHandler>Isaiah</jLink></jLink></jLink> had said, they follow the customs of men instead of God's laws. For example, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> pointed out how they disobey God's law to kill children who dishonor their parents as long as the children honor God instead. clickHandler>Gethsemane</jLink></jLink></jLink>, where <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2385G' clickHandler>James</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491H' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> to stand watch while <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> prayed to God to change <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> returned and found the three Disciples asleep, Claim <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> in front of other people, or else He will disown you in front of God. Blaspheme against the Holy spirit is unforgivable. When challenged, God will give you the right words to say. In response to a financial judgement request from someone in the crowd, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> warned about greed, and told a parable to emphasize that you should focus on richness toward God as opposed to financial wealth. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said to His Disciples: Do not worry about the needs of this life, but rather seek God's Kingdom, and then God will fulfill your needs. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> give away your earthly wealth to the poor, and seek instead the permanent treasures of Heaven with your heart. You need to act as though <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> could come back at any moment. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked if that preparedness message was for everyone, or just the Disciples. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied in parables that while the concept applies to everyone, the greatest responsibility falls on those in leadership because they have been given much and should know better. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that He did not come to bring peace, but rather division, setting family members against one another. Then He scorned the crowd for being able to interpret the weather better than they could interpret the [prophesied] time that they were now in, and through a parable He encouraged them to make amends now or else risk getting all of the punishment they deserved.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> explained to the crowd that just because horrible things happen to some people does not make them the worst sinners, and that unless they repent, they too will perish. He told them a parable that a fig tree had produced no fruit for three years, and that it would be given one more year to fruit, this time with fertilizer used, or else it will be cut down. One Sabbath <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was teaching in a synagogue, and there he healed a women who had been crippled by a spirit for eighteen years. The synagogue leader protested the Sabbath healing. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that they were hypocrites, because they took care of even the needs of animals on the Sabbath, so why should not a cripple be unbound from Satan on the Sabbath? The leader was humiliated. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> explained how the Kingdom of God was like a tiny mustard seed that grows into a large plant, and like yeast which spreads throughout dough. Once, while traveling through towns and villages, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> confirmed that only a few people would be Saved, and even some people who think that they will be Saved will be disowned by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> cast outside the Kingdom instead. People will come from all around to enter the Kingdom, but it is the humble and lowly who will enter, not the proud and the mighty. Pharisees told <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264H' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> wanted to kill Him, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that He would keep going, and would die in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, just like the other Prophets, in three days. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> then lamented how He had longed and often attempted to bring them back to God, but they had refused. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> swore that they would not see Him again until they had changed their ways.

Once, while at a Pharisee's house for dinner on a Sabbath, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> healed a man with dropsy, and expressed that it was lawful to heal and preserve life on a Sabbath, as even they did so when necessary. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> then told the guests that they should not take the seat of honor, or else they risk being embarrassed by the host if there is someone more honorable present. But if they seek the lowest place, then they will truly be honored when the host exalts them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> then told the host that he should be inviting the poor and disabled to meals, because even though they cannot repay him, he will then be rewarded at the resurrection of the righteous. Someone at the table replied that blessed is the man who will feast in God's Kingdom. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied with a parable about a man who arranged a big banquet and invited guests, but when the banquet was ready, the invited guests made excuses to not go there. The man got angry, and invited poor, crippled, and lame people to come instead. There was still room, so the man then invited anyone else that could be found, and swore that the original invitees would not taste any of the banquet. Sometime later, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told the large crowds following Him that they must hate their family, hate their own life, and carry a cross if they want to be a disciple of His. Through two parables, He warned them that they had better be able to give up everything and to be completely committed if they want to be a disciple of His. With a parable about salt, He warned that if you do not do what you should do, you are worthless.

The Pharisees and Teachers of the Law were indignant because <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> welcomed tax collectors and sinners. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them that if someone loses a sheep, or when someone loses a coin, they will search until they find it, and greatly rejoice when they do; and likewise Heaven rejoices more over the repentance of one sinner than over ninety-nine righteous people. To further explain, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told another parable about a man with two sons, where one son claimed his inheritance early and decided to leave. That son soon spent his wealth and found himself in dire poverty, so he decided to go back and beg for a job from his father. When the father saw him coming, he greatly rejoiced, and honored him with a great feast, because his son had been dead but now was alive. The other, consistently loyal son was angry at the special treatment for his brother because he had not been similarly rewarded for his loyalty. His father explained to the loyal son that he already owned whatever the father has, but it was proper to rejoice at the return of his brother to the family.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told His disciples a parable about a rich man who had a manager who was wasting his money, and the rich man wanted an explanation. In order to gain favor for when he would lose his job, the manager quickly reduced the debt record of those who owed payments to the rich man. The rich man then commended the manager's shrewd actions. With this, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> explained that you should use your wealth to gain friends and ultimately gain eternal reward. If you cannot do what is right with money, you will not be given the real riches, and you cannot serve both God and money. The Pharisees overheard this teaching, and became indignant, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them that God knows their hearts, and He values things differently than men do. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said: The Scriptures were proclaimed until <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491G' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> the Baptist, but now the Kingdom of God is preached and people are forcing their way into it. Nothing can be removed from the Law. A man who divorces and remarries commits adultery, as does a man who marries a divorced woman. A rich man had ignored the beggar, named <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2976G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2976G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2976G' clickHandler>Lazarus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, outside his door. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2976G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2976G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2976G' clickHandler>Lazarus</jLink></jLink></jLink> died and was taken to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s bosom by angels. The rich man died, and found himself in the torment of Hell. The rich man begged <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink> to send <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2976G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2976G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2976G' clickHandler>Lazarus</jLink></jLink></jLink> with some water for a little relief from the fire, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink> told him that he was getting what he deserved, and that he could not help him even if he wanted to do so. The rich man then begged for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2976G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2976G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2976G' clickHandler>Lazarus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to go warn the rich man's family about Hell, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that they have their warning from the Scriptures, and if they do not believe the Scriptures, then they would not believe even someone who is resurrected.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told His disciples: People who cause other people to sin will have a fate worse than drowning. Rebuke your brother when he sins, and forgive him as often as he repents. The Apostles asked for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to increase their faith, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them that with a little faith they could command trees to be uprooted. With a parable, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> explained that you should labor for God like a slave without expecting any thanks. In a village between <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler>Galilee</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> provided delayed healing to ten lepers. One of the ten, a Samaritan, returned to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> and thanked Him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked where the other nine were. Once <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told a Pharisee that the Kingdom of God was within you. Then <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told His disciples: In the future they will long to see His return, but they should not chase after rumors, because His return will be unmistakably seen by all. But first <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> will suffer and be rejected. But <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' return will come as unexpectedly and suddenly as the flood of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5146' clickHandler>Noah</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the destruction of <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H5467' clickHandler>Sodom</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Be ready, and do not cling to this life, because you will lose it. Instead give up this life to gain an eternal one.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told His disciples a parable about a persistent widow who eventually got justice to illustrate how you should pray unceasingly, because God will most certainly grant justice to those who call on Him. Then He told a parable about a self-justified Pharisee and a self-humbling tax collector praying at the Temple to illustrate how God favors those who humble themselves, but humbles those who exalt themselves. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> called for children to be brought to Him to illustrate how the Kingdom of God belongs to those who receive it like children. A ruler asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> how to inherit eternal life. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> answered to keep the commandments of do not commit adultery, do not murder, do not steal, do not give false testimony, honor your father and mother. When the ruler said that he had done so, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told him to sell everything, give to the poor, and then follow Him. The ruler left, sad, because he was very wealthy. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> remarked that it was nearly impossible for a rich man to enter the Kingdom of God, but with God it was still possible. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> claimed they had left everything behind to follow <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that they would be greatly rewarded, both in this life and with eternal life in the next one. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told the Twelve Disciples that He would be turned over to the Gentiles and killed in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but be resurrected on the third day; but the meaning was hidden from them so they did not understand Him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> healed a blind man near <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler>Jericho</jLink></jLink></jLink>, who then praised God and followed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

In <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3405G' clickHandler>Jericho</jLink></jLink></jLink>, a tax collector named <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2195' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2195' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2195' clickHandler>Zacchaeus</jLink></jLink></jLink> climbed a tree just to see <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told him that He would stay at his house today, but people were indignant that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> would be a guest of a sinner. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2195' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2195' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2195' clickHandler>Zacchaeus</jLink></jLink></jLink> pledged to give half his possessions to the poor, and pay back fourfold anyone he had cheated. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> proclaimed that he was Saved and that he was a son of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them a parable about a noble man who went away somewhere to be appointed king, and he had given ten servants each some money to put to use in his absence. Also, some of his future subjects tried to get him not selected as king. When the man returned as king, he rewarded the servants proportionally to how well they had done with money. But one servant had not done anything with the money, and so the king took his money away and gave it to the most successful servant. Then the king asked to have the subjects who had not wanted him to be king to be slain before him. clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' words, because they knew that He was <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2501G' clickHandler><jLink
