Some of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' disciples found this information hard to accept. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> wondered how they would react if they saw Him ascend to Heaven, and explained again that only those who are enabled by God to do so can come to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Some disciples left. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> asked the Twelve Disciples if they would leave too, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that they would not leave God's Holy One. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that one of the Twelve is a devil.

Thereafter, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> stayed away from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler>Judea</jLink></jLink></jLink> because the Jews were trying to kill Him there. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' disbelieving brothers told Him that He should go to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> at the Feast of Tabernacles to be seen working miracles, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them that they can go to the Feast without Him because it is not His time, and that the world hates Him because He calls their deeds evil. After His brothers left for the Feast, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> went there secretly. The crowds were murmuring privately about whether or not <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was good. Halfway through the Feast, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> began teaching in the Temple courtyard. The Jews wondered how He could be so wise without having studied. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them that His teaching came from God, that He worked to honor God (who had sent Him there), and that although <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> gave them the Law they do not obey it, and yet they are trying to kill <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The crowd was confused by what <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> meant about killing Him. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that He had astonished them with a miracle He did, that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> permitted circumcision on the Sabbath, but they are angry at Him for healing on the Sabbath, and that they should judge rightly. The crowd recognized <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> as being both a wanted man and possibly the Messiah, but they knew where He was from, so He could not be the Messiah. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> reiterated that He was sent by God, and said that they do not know God. Some of the crowd tried to seize <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but He amazingly slipped away. Others thought that He might be the Messiah based on His miracles. The Pharisees and Chief Priests sent men to arrest <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that He would be there for a short while and then would not be found. The Jews were confused by this. On the last day of the Feast, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said metaphorically that those who believe in Him would receive the Holy Spirit flowing through them. Some Jews thought He was the Messiah, but others doubted that because He came from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1551' clickHandler>Galilee</jLink></jLink></jLink> and was not from King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s lineage or from Bethlehem. The Pharisees and Chief Priests were angry when the men who they had sent to arrest <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> came back empty handed because <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> had impressed them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3530' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3530' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3530' clickHandler>Nicodemus</jLink></jLink></jLink> suggested that they give <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> a fair hearing, but the Pharisees and Chief Priests balked at this idea.

The next day <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> taught in the Temple courtyard again. The Teachers of the Law and the Pharisees brought a woman who had been caught in the act of adultery to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and asked Him for a judgement. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that one of them who had never sinned should throw the first stone at her. They all left, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told the woman that she should go and repent from her sins. Later <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told the people that He was the light that people should follow so that they do not walk in darkness. The Pharisees questioned <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> for being His own witness. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that He knows that He is speaking the truth, and that His Father is also His witness. They asked where His father was, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them that they do not know His Father. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that He was going away, but they would die in their sins and could not follow Him because they where of this world and they did not believe that He was who He claimed to be. They did not understand. He said that when they see Him (the Son of Man) lifted up, then they will know that He was speaking the truth which came from His Father. Many believed Him. To those believing Jews, He said that they should obey His teaching to know the truth and be free. They were confused. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them that sinners are slaves to sin, but the Son could set them free, and then said that they were trying to kill Him because they obey a different father. They claimed <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink> as their father, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that that cannot be the case, given that they were trying kill <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, a man who revealed the truth from God. Then they claimed God as their father, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them that it was obvious that the Devil was their father because they cannot understand <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' words and do not love <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> despite <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> speaking God's truth. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> explained that those who keep His word would receive eternal life. They accused <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> of being demon-possessed and asked if He thought that He was greater than <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them that God glorifies <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink> rejoiced at seeing <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>' day, and went on to say that He was around before <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The Jews tried to stone <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, but He slipped away.

Later, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> came across a man who was blind from the time of his birth. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> explained that it was not sin which caused the man's blindness, but rather he was blind so that God's work could be done, and that no one will be able to work in the dark but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> provided light while He was in the world. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> made some mud with His spit and put it on the man's eyes, and that healed him when he washed it in the Pool of Siloam. The man's neighbors were amazed and confused, so the man explained how <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> had healed him. They all went to the Pharisees, to whom the man again explained how <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> had healed him. The Pharisees could not believe that a Sabbath breaker like <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> could work miracles. The Jews tried to get a different answer from the man's parents, but they would not answer. They summoned the formerly blind man again for questioning, but he ultimately berated them for not recognizing that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> must be sent from God given the miraculous opening of his eyes, so they threw him out. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> found the man again and introduced Himself as the Son of Man. The man worshiped <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that He had come to judge, and make the blind see and those who see blind. Some Pharisees asked Him about that, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> told them that their guilt remains because they claim that they can see.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that the Shepherd enters the sheep pen by the gate, while thieves enter other ways, and all of the sheep will only follow the Shepherd because they know His voice. They did not understand Him, so <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that He was the sheep's gate and would give a full life to the sheep, unlike the thieves who came before to steal and kill. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that He was the Good Shepherd because He will lay down His life for the sheep, that His sheep know Him, including those who are not from that sheep pen who will also listen to Him, and that He has the authority to and will indeed lay down His life and take it up again as His Father has commanded. The Jews were divided on whether or not to believe <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. At the Feast of Dedication in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, Jews asked <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to state plainly if He was the Messiah. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> replied that He had already told them, and His miracles prove His claim, but they cannot believe because they are not His sheep. His sheep are protected from falling away, and He will give His sheep eternal life. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> said that He and God are one. At this, the Jews got ready to stone <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> for blasphemy, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> reminded them that the Scriptures had called men "gods" before, and said that even if they do not believe His words, they should believe because of the miracles that He had worked, which prove that He is in God and God is in Him. A great persecution arises against the Church in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink>, led by <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler>Saul</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Many believers scatter throughout <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3063N' clickHandler>Judea</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G5376J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G5376J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G5376J' clickHandler>Philip</jLink></jLink></jLink>, one of the seven chosen men, goes to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H8111' clickHandler>Samaria</jLink></jLink></jLink> and preaches there, performing miracles and healing the sick. Many Samaritans believe and are baptized. Later, the apostles in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> send <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491H' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> to pray for the new believers to receive the Holy Spirit. The chapter also tells the story of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G5376J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G5376J' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G5376J' clickHandler>Philip</jLink></jLink></jLink> and the Ethiopian eunuch, whom he baptizes after explaining the Scriptures.

Describes the dramatic conversion of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler>Saul</jLink></jLink></jLink>, who is on his way to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler>Damascus</jLink></jLink></jLink> to arrest Christians. A bright light from heaven blinds him, and he hears the voice of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> asking why <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler>Saul</jLink></jLink></jLink> is persecuting Him. After three days of blindness, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0367H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0367H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0367H' clickHandler>Ananias</jLink></jLink></jLink>, a disciple in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler>Damascus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, is instructed by God to heal <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler>Saul</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0367H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0367H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0367H' clickHandler>Ananias</jLink></jLink></jLink> obeys, and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler>Saul</jLink></jLink></jLink> regains his sight, is baptized, and begins to preach about <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler>Saul</jLink></jLink></jLink>, later known as <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink>, faces opposition and eventually escapes from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H1834' clickHandler>Damascus</jLink></jLink></jLink>.

God sends a vision to <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2883' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2883' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2883' clickHandler>Cornelius</jLink></jLink></jLink>, a Roman centurion, instructing him to send for <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink>. At the same time, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> has a vision of unclean animals and is told not to call anything impure that God has made clean. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> visits <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2883' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2883' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2883' clickHandler>Cornelius</jLink></jLink></jLink>’ home, where he shares the Gospel. The Holy Spirit falls on <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2883' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2883' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2883' clickHandler>Cornelius</jLink></jLink></jLink> and his household, demonstrating that the message of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> is for everyone, including Gentiles.

Begins with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> explaining his actions to the other apostles, as they are surprised that he visited a Gentile. He recounts the events with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2883' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2883' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2883' clickHandler>Cornelius</jLink></jLink></jLink> and emphasizes that God does not show favoritism. After <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink>'s explanation, the apostles praise God for granting salvation to the Gentiles. The chapter also describes the growth of the Church in Antioch, where believers are first called Christians. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler>Barnabas</jLink></jLink></jLink> is sent to encourage them, and he brings <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink> to help teach the growing number of believers.

King <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264I' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink> <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0067' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0067' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0067' clickHandler>Agrippa</jLink></jLink></jLink> begins to persecute the Church. He arrests <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> and puts him in prison, intending to execute him after the Passover. While in prison, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> is guarded by soldiers, but the Church prays earnestly for him. During the night, an angel of the Lord appears, freeing <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> from his chains. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> escapes and goes to the house of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3137L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3137L' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3137L' clickHandler>Mary</jLink></jLink></jLink>, the mother of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2491H' clickHandler>John</jLink></jLink></jLink> <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3138' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3138' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3138' clickHandler>Mark</jLink></jLink></jLink>, where believers are gathered. When he knocks at the door, a servant girl named <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4498' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4498' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4498' clickHandler>Rhoda</jLink></jLink></jLink> recognizes him but is so shocked that she forgets to let him in. Eventually, they believe <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> is truly free. Meanwhile, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264I' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2264I' clickHandler>Herod</jLink></jLink></jLink>, after failing to find <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink>, executes the guards and later dies after being struck down by an angel for not giving glory to God.

Marks the beginning of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink>’s missionary journeys. The Church in Antioch is worshiping when the Holy Spirit instructs them to set aside <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler>Barnabas</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H7586G' clickHandler>Saul</jLink></jLink></jLink> (<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink>) for a special mission. They travel to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3794H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3794H' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3794H' clickHandler>Cyprus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, where they preach in synagogues. In <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3974' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3974' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3974' clickHandler>Paphos</jLink></jLink></jLink>, they encounter a sorcerer named Elymas, who opposes them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink>, filled with the Holy Spirit, confronts Elymas, striking him blind. Afterward, the proconsul Sergius Paulus believes in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. The missionaries then travel to Pisidian Antioch, where <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink> delivers a powerful sermon about <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>, leading many to believe.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler>Barnabas</jLink></jLink></jLink> continue their journey to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2430' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2430' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2430' clickHandler>Iconium</jLink></jLink></jLink>, where they preach in a synagogue, and many believe. However, they face opposition, and they flee to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3082' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3082' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3082' clickHandler>Lystra</jLink></jLink></jLink>. In <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3082' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3082' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3082' clickHandler>Lystra</jLink></jLink></jLink>, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink> heals a man who was lame from birth. The people mistakenly think <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler>Barnabas</jLink></jLink></jLink> are gods and prepare to offer sacrifices to them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler>Barnabas</jLink></jLink></jLink> quickly correct them, stating they are mere men. Soon after, some Jews from Antioch and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2430' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2430' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2430' clickHandler>Iconium</jLink></jLink></jLink> arrive and stir up the crowd against them. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink> is stoned and left for dead but miraculously survives. They continue to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G1190' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G1190' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G1190' clickHandler>Derbe</jLink></jLink></jLink>, preaching and making many disciples. The chapter concludes with their return to Antioch, where they report all that God had done.

A significant meeting occurs in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='H3389' clickHandler>Jerusalem</jLink></jLink></jLink> regarding whether Gentile believers should follow Jewish laws, especially circumcision. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4074G' clickHandler>Peter</jLink></jLink></jLink> speaks about how God accepted the Gentiles and emphasizes faith over the law. After much discussion, the apostles and elders decide that Gentiles do not need to follow the law of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H4872' clickHandler>Moses</jLink></jLink></jLink> but should abstain from certain practices. They send a letter with <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455M' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455M' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2455M' clickHandler>Judas</jLink></jLink></jLink> (called Barsabbas) and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4609' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4609' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4609' clickHandler>Silas</jLink></jLink></jLink> to deliver this message to the churches. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G0921G' clickHandler>Barnabas</jLink></jLink></jLink> also report on their journey and the miracles they witnessed.

<jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink> and his companion <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4609' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4609' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4609' clickHandler>Silas</jLink></jLink></jLink> travel to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G1190' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G1190' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G1190' clickHandler>Derbe</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3082' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3082' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3082' clickHandler>Lystra</jLink></jLink></jLink>. They meet <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G5095G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G5095G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G5095G' clickHandler>Timothy</jLink></jLink></jLink>, a young disciple, and decide to take him along. They travel through <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G0773' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G0773' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G0773' clickHandler>Asia</jLink></jLink></jLink> Minor, but the Holy Spirit prevents them from preaching in certain areas. In a vision, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink> sees a man from <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3109' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3109' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G3109' clickHandler>Macedonia</jLink></jLink></jLink> asking for help. They sail to <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G5375' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G5375' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G5375' clickHandler>Philippi</jLink></jLink></jLink>, where they meet a woman named <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3070' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3070' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3070' clickHandler>Lydia</jLink></jLink></jLink>, a seller of purple goods, who becomes the first European convert. Later, <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4609' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4609' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4609' clickHandler>Silas</jLink></jLink></jLink> are imprisoned after casting out a spirit from a slave girl. While in prison, they sing hymns, and an earthquake opens the prison doors. The jailer, fearing the prisoners have escaped, is about to kill himself, but <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink> stops him. The jailer and his family believe in <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> and are baptized.

Sees <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink> and <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4609' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4609' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G4609' clickHandler>Silas</jLink></jLink></jLink> in <jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2332' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2332' clickHandler><jLink data-type='L' data-strong='G2332' clickHandler>Thessalonica</jLink></jLink></jLink>, where they preach in the synagogue. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler>Paul</jLink></jLink></jLink>, an apostle sent to spread the Gospel of <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H1732' clickHandler>David</jLink></jLink></jLink>, and His resurrection. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G3972G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' God's wrath is being revealed against those who have chosen to worship man-made idols instead of the real God, because God has made Himself known clearly through His creation. <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H5471' clickHandler>So</jLink></jLink></jLink> God has given the godless people over to sinful lusts, sexual immorality, and mental depravity. Believers have no excuse to hypocritically judge anyone, for they will not escape being judged by God using the same standards which they have used to judge others. Believers should repent of their sins, because God will reward those who persistently do good, but will punish those who are egocentric, who reject truth, and who follow evil. Jew or Gentile, God will not discriminate or show favoritism. Those without the Law will die for their sins, and those under the Law will be judged by it. Those who obey the Law are righteous. Even some Gentiles by their nature do what is in the Law because it is written in their hearts. God will judge everyone's secrets through <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink>. Jewish believers who are boastful in having the Law, are you fully keeping the Law? If you break the Law, you are essentially nullifying your circumcision. Jews are advantaged because they have been entrusted with the words of God. Unfaithful Jews do not prove God to be unfaithful. Unrighteous human acts highlight God's righteousness, but we should not do evil to make God seem good. Jews are no better than Gentiles, because everybody sins and there is nobody who is righteous. God has now revealed the prophesied righteousness apart from the Law. All people have sinned, and those people who believe that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='G2424G' clickHandler>Jesus</jLink></jLink></jLink> was presented by God as an atonement sacrifice will be justified by grace. Nobody can boast, because this justification is based on faith, not by observing the Law. Jew and Gentile both can be justified through the same faith, and that upholds the prophesy.

Scripture says that <jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler><jLink data-type='P' data-strong='H0085' clickHandler>Abraham</jLink></jLink></jLink> was justified by faith, not by works. His belief was credited as righteousness.
